text: This was probably one of the worst meals I've had in a long time. First of all we were seated in some tucked away corner were we couldn't even see the restaurant and it seemed like we were a little neglected because of it. Our food came out and we ordered calamari, margherita pizza, Italian sausage pizza and some raviolis. The calamari was the only thing that was good and warm. I really liked the pesto sauce that they came with! But the margherita pizza was cold and lacked flavor, other pizza was cold and the raviolis were rubbery. Worst of all with this meal were my drinks. The water that they gave us when we first got there had a funny taste like the glass hadn't been washed or the ice that was in it was really old and had sat in a freezer too long. I thought that when I got my coke that maybe the flavor wouldn't be in that drink but sure enough it was in that drink too. Because of this experience I probably won't go back to this restaurant.

I wasn't impressed.  I'm not saying that the food was not good.  It just didn't stand out.  I'm from New York and am accustomed to good pizza.  I tried the margherita pizza and it wasn't anything outstanding that I couldn't get from a New York pizzeria.  The insalata mista was pretty good.  The iced tea was interesting (kinda fruity).  Our server was the best part of the lunch experience.  Other than that, nothing special.

in vegas, unless you are paying $$$ for dinner, it is hard to find a place that has good service... food takes soooo long, i think they are going to china to pick up the fresh ingredients and then traveling back to cook it... service here was not as slow as other places, considering it's not too pricey..  unless you want to wait in line for those buffets, this is a place to go..  food tastes good, price is OK... you are not going to end up paying more than 50$ lets say... so i consider that OK for vegas, for the quality of food you are getting...  environment, its inside the city center.. its nice and chill... i would go there again, the next time i head to vegas...  p.s. maybe food was good cuz we were sooooo starving and hung over from the previous night.. what doesn't taste good then??

I had the spaghetti and meatballs here last July, and it was so good that I've had it on my mind ever since (no joke). I recall it being hot and hearty with the perfect balance of sauce, noodle, meatball. I even made a trip to the Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill at LA Live back in LA, hoping the spaghetti and meatballs would be just as good (it wasn't - too oily).  So, lots to live up to on this visit to Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina. And it did, for the most part. We started with the prosciutto with mozzarella and the caprese salad. Delicious. And of course I ordered the spaghetti with meatballs for my entree. It was good - well, great - but not as good as I remembered it (I guess that's almost always how it works out, though). I wish the meatballs were a tad hotter. And there to be some more noodles, to make that perfect sauce, noodle, meatball ratio. But now I'm just being picky. To drink, the wine list had what we wanted - a bottle of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc at just $36. We finished our dinner off with the tiramisu - different from traditional tiramisu (think less soggy, more dense and solid) - which I actually liked, so a "win" there.  Overall, I'd definitely go back. A great location in Crystals/Aria, delicious food, and reasonable pricing.

I've been here twice for the all night happy hour at the bar.  Tonight- they were not busy. I spoke to the manager and asked what the overall concept and vibe of the restaurant was. He said it was a hip and trendy rustic Italian restaurant. He also said the decor didn't match the current feel because originally the restaurant was a brasserie.  I didn't get the intended vibe at all. The music was too too loud and killed any sort of enjoyable dining experience a diner could have. For a slow night, the service was slow and the bartender was not attentive. The support staff serving the food were more helpful.   I did appreciate how the managers took it upon themselves to seat guests and take orders. No task too small.  As for the food itself:  Sliders- teeny tiny and too salty Meatballs- just average Chicken wings- had a kick of heat and were crispy and delicious!  Bread- you can get it for free with your order, you just need to ask.
The food was fresh and tasty!  Our waiter was super nice and attentive. I have food allergies and he made sure the kitchen took care of me.  He also recommended several dishes for me to pick from.

Maybe it was just an off day, but the pizza we ordered was just mediocre. The bruschetta was AMAZING, so we had high hopes for our main course, but it fell flat. The cheese didn't taste very fresh and I honestly felt like I could have ordered from one of the stand alone shops on the strip and had a similar result. However, the service was excellent. I would give this place another chance, but I won't go running back.
A bit expensive, but very tasty. Had the turkey panini & veal ravioli.

I never thought in my wildest dream that a salad would leave such an impression on me.  The pecorino salad with lemon-herb dressing was the dish that I had to have it all to myself. It was selfishly good.  The key to bringing the crispy duck and the fresh spring mix together was the delightful citrus dressing.  It was the perfect amuse bouche!  Unfortunately the dream ended when I ate the grilled rare tuna burger.  The texture of the tuna was so rare that it felt like slimy paste...not to mention it was over-seasoned.    This place was very posh and it fits well in the high-end City Center.   I came on dead Wednesday night, so the service was quick.   Brasserie Pucks name comes with a cost, so do bring many shiny pennies.   Overall, the delicious salad is not enough incentive for me to go back, But hey!  At least I know super tasty salads exists in this world.

My first visit was with three girlies on a birthday outing, which started with a wander around the mall before lunch. It was an excellent kick-off to a 12-hour birhday session on the Strip. The atmosphere is nice--casual with a touch of class. The music was superb (jazzy, bluesy, just loud enough).  The sangria was the best I've had; it was a perfect blend of ingredients with just enough brandy for a good kick. We all ordered different meals and were all happy with the quality. Everything was fresh, delicious, and very well presented. They even made my salad interesting with just the right proportions of dressing, Gorgonzola, bacon and nuts. In my book, it takes a really good kitchen to make a salad that tasty. Our server was very good. She was friendly and professional without being intrusive on our fun lunch.  I'm a fan and can happily recommend this place. Get a window seat so you can people-watch. :)
Worth a visit simply for the best fried calamari I've ever eaten and the Matilda draft. The 3 cheese panini with tomato soup was great as well.

The food was really really good. Portions are moderate. I am only giving 4 stars because the service was pretty bad. The waiter we had acted like we were a nuisance due to a larger party (6). Other than our waiter, food was good. Would recommend!
Service was slow and the waitresses see our our order, but the manageable promptly fixed the error and overall we had a very positive experience.

We ordered the eggplant parm and penne with Alfredo (minus the minced pork). The food was all good, and my girlfriend was particularly impressed with the aglio olio that came with the eggplant. However, we thought this place was pricey for the quality. We expected the food to be a little better especially since it's owned by a celebrity chef. We can get better tasting italitan food for the same price or cheaper (depending on where we go) at several restaurants in Chicago.
Really romantic setting.  The margaritta pizza was tasty.  We had the chocolate cake for dessert..  Heavenly!

Went for Happy Hour and sad to say, I won't go back for it.  Their portions are tiny.  However, their sangria is superb and is $6 a glass or $16 for a pitcher, which is a great deal!  Locals get a free dessert too, with any purchase.  Had the salmon dinner on my bday and loved it.  Go for dinner, not happy hour unless just getting drinks.

Pleasant atmosphere, tables not too close together. Friendly professional service - except I don't like the way they try to offer you bottled water instead of just tap.  Spaghetti with meat balls were very very good. Good pizza too, big enough to share between two really.  Have eaten here before and had the octopus salad which was really fresh and tasty too.

Had a great dinner here on 6/11/11 with my wife.  Like others have said, it's a relatively inexpensive place to eat in the Crystals, which is not exactly the cheapest place to hang out.  Plus, when I asked bartender to make me a Pimm's Cup, which he had never heard of, I just gave him the recipe and he only charged me $7 instead of marking it way up like others do for call drinks.
The chocolate cremoso--wow! Pistachio budino is soooo great!! Great place to end the night.

What a lovely experience. A Sunday morning that could not have started any better. Our server Paul was extraordinary. Wonderful service and conversion. We will return soon. We will ask definitely ask for Paul.
Very good pizza, and very good service.  Very nice place, and a good respite from the rest of the strip!
Delicious dinner. Fritto misto and a pizza. Plenty of food for two to share.  Price was very reasonable for Las Vegas. Especially for such good food. And service was spot on
Tony and staff was superb. Meal was excellent! It is in city center, and a easy short walk from Aria

Great Italian Food and Great Service. Came here with a group of business associates and our food was prepared just the way we like it.  Wolfgang Puck has done it again, and does not surprise me of the quality of food and service they offer. Thanks to Caitlin, our server, for the taking good care of us. We will definitely be back!

Have had lunch here a couple of times and EVERYTHING is good. Have tried everything from salad to paninis to pasta. The two standout dishes have been the caprese (tomatoes were ripened to perfection) and the tomato soup. The tomato soup I ordered as part of my meal (pesto panini, salad and soup) but I noticed that you can order a bowl of it (not sure if it's on the menu but it's a request they accommodated with no issues. Seems to be a popular spot for business lunches. Great lighting and overlooks lower level of Crystals were those cool water sculptures are. Very good!

We came here for launch.  The service was good we've been greeted and seated right as we walked in.  The waiter was very nice all the way.   We ordered one dish of calamari and one Italian sausage pizza.  The calamari was the best I ever had!  It was slightly frayed seasoned to  perfection and at the right  temperature. It had a nice crunch   when we bite on it and it's sauce was delicious ,it was creamy and garlicky. The pizza was good, but it's sausage was useless because it has overpowered by the sauce. Therefor we couldn't taste it.  The atmosphere in general was nice until the pianist at the mall started playing. This building has a terrible acoustics and the music sounds loud and horrible.
Amazing food n service , the kale salad n with mushroom ravioli, yum yum all the way.

This place is an excellent Italian place. If you think you have had a good pizza you are in for a treat trying the pizza here. Meatball pizza is the best flavor. Also dessert was amazing we had the sorbet and the flavor was to die for.

Decent food. Terrible service. Made a reservation here for my fiancés birthday in hopes to experience new food and have a great time. The server seems to work alone because we saw him maybe once every 15 minutes. They forgot one of our orders and we didn't see anyone for about 15 minutes to tell them so we were all about done by the time we got it. The food is pretty good, but exaggerated. Portions on the small side. Ambiance is great, but who cares when the service is terrible. Hire more servers to take care of your guests!

Ate here on the 17th aug on a Saturday evening. We were seated straight away no waiting.   I ordered one of the woodfire pizzas and my friend had some sort of seafood pasta dish. My pizza was delicious, perfectly cooked, not too much topping, base lovely and crisp. My friend also said her pasta was delicious too, full of flavour and a generous sized portion.  Our server was very attentive without being intrusive. The atmosphere is very laid back and lovely within the restaurant it's self.   Overall great food, great service. Would definitely return!

This place was great. We stayed at Aria and walked over after checking in the first day. We split the Grilled Meatballs, Asparagus Salad and Margherita & Italian Meat pizzas. The pizza was thin, crispy and delicious. They had some of the best Sangria and service was on point. It was a great casual meal to start off our trip. I only wish we got to go again before we left.

We came here for lunch and ordered the turkey panini; we both ordered the same thing.  When the server placed it in front of us, we both literally laughed out loud.  WTF?  My three-year-old could have done a better job making a sandwich. Very skimpy. No flavor. Fifteen bucks for that?!  Give me a break.  We sent it back and neither the chef or manager seemed to care. Sad to see such a rip off happening in one of your restaurants WP.
Despite being in a mall, given it's upscale it provides a good atmosphere to this open restaurant. Server was attentive and the chef didn't mind customizing pizza for a food allergy.

Overall, a terrible service experience.  The honey and I arrived at about 9:00pm on a Wednesday night, only to be greeted by a surly and indifferent hostess who proceeded to a) give us the evil eye while b) continuing to talk to a customer on the phone.  Really?  No one could help us get seated while the restaurant was 80% empty?  After being seated, I found one of the water glasses had some lipstick stains on the rim.  Pointed it out to the bus-man, who barely even took a second look (and no apology).    Looked over our menus, then proceeded to sit at our table for another 10 minutes, hoping to catch the eye of our waitress.  She avoided eye contact.  In fact, she looked at every table but ours and our neighbor's, who had finished eating a while ago and were looking to get the check.  A frustrating experience, all in all.  The honey and I left before ordering, without even a glance from the surly hostess as we strode out the door.  I would forgive the indifferent service if this was a Chili's (or comparable chain restaurant) on a bustling weekend night, but this was neither.  A restaurant with a celebrity chef's name bills itself as a premium experience, and this was anything but.  Avoid.

Solid restaurant but with a few missteps.   Being a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, I had high expectations for this place but it mostly didn't deliver. The stars of the show are their prosciutto pizza and their garlic bread. Both were delicious and a notch above what they normally would taste like at other restaurants. Where it didn't meet my expectations, was the soppressata pizza, the caprese appetizer, and the spaghetti with meatballs. All three were average and not worth eating again.   The decor and atmosphere are nice and would definitely be a nice place for a celebration dinner. Prices are $20-$30 for most entrees except the steaks, which are $40-$50.

Came here because we wanted a pasta dish before the Rock and roll marathon. Shared a chinois chicken salad (which was delicious), the rigatoni, and a side of cauliflower. Everything was plated to for 2. The service was really good, and the portions were big!
Happy hour pricing all day only ever sat at the bar and the service was always very good.
Great food. Spaghetti with meatballs yummy along with pizza  & boar ragu pasta. Happy hr at bar all day.

After our first long day shopping,we were starving. Wolfgang has never disappointed our family at any of his locations. The Food and service were both amazing. Fresh baked crusty bread to start,calamari, pork chops,spaghetti, and the chicken piccata were all delicious. My husband even ate brussels sprouts and enjoyed them.
Made a reservation for 5 pm on a Thursday but was not crowded. We ordered a variety of dishes ranging from a $20 ravioli to a &40 steak. They were all very good.

I love their spaghetti. I was in LV for a computer conference at the Aria. As a lowly worker, I had a corporate budget of $50 for dinner. So I could not afford the restaurants in the hotel  and the buffet was not appetizing. I am so glad Cucina was a few steps away. I went there Tuesday night at 8 PM and was seated quickly. The place was about 2/3 full.   I had a glass of red wine, an order of spaghetti and a side of (3 large!) meatballs. Total: $35. I had to box two of the meatballs for I was full. And I even had enough money to get some nice coffee after my meal.   The spaghetti is full on flavor, with the gentle tang from tomato, a savory aftertaste and good olive oil. The place is mellow, you can actually have a conversation without shouting in the other person's ear.   It's elegant comfort from the decor to the food.

UNimpressed. Had lunch with a friend. The service was pretty poor, we waited a while before anyone came by to at least give us water. My friend ordered Ensalata Pizza and I got gluten-free rigatoni with pomodoro sauce. The pizza was cold in the middle (frozen crust?) but she said it was tasty. My pasta looked like they just dumped a can of tomato sauce over it (too much sauce at that), though the sauce, too, was good. The pasta, however, was way too al dente. I'd asked for Parmesan and crushed red pepper when I ordered, but didn't get it and had to wait while they went for it. I expected much better from a big-name restaurant like this. I just can't recommend Cucina, not when you can walk across the pedestrian bridge to the Cosmopolitan and enjoy great food and service at several restaurants there.

Came here two nights in a row because it's so delicious!! Amazing food and not $$$ like every other restaurant in Vegas.  Had a $400 dinner the first night. Trying to save a bit, then came here the next night and had dinner for $60. And the food was BETTER than at the first place! Love this!

Let me start by saying I'd had gone to wolfgangs after a crazy night and my hangover would be categorized as the "hangover from hell" so maybe pizza wasn't the best idea.  I started my meal off with the grilled octopus "antipasto" it had a very fresh flavor and was very tender, executed perfectly. Unlike the octopus antipasto, the prosciutto pizza I had  wasn't anywhere near good, the combination of prosciutto, olives and parmesan had an overly salted taste and the olives made it very briny. It was really overwhelming to the taste buds so I only had one piece.  service was slow also, took about 20 mins for our drinks, we ordered beers.

Really enjoyed the pizzas and sangria. The prices here are surprisingly affordable and it was a nice change eating inside Crystals than other parts of the strip. Typically we head to Gordon Ramsays at Planet Hollywood or Mona Mi Gabi at Paris.   Our party of 8 dined on a Friday night around 8pm. It was steady but not terribly busy. Everyone's food looked delicious including the calamari, chicken cacciatore and salmon. The prosciutto pizza and was amazing. Especially with sangria. Our server unfortunately never came back with our refills after we gave him the check.   One surprising thing was that a restaurant that nice had such dirty bathrooms. The design of the bathrooms is a very neat concept where the men and women converge at the hand washing sinks. However, there was trash and paper towels on the floor, wet floors in the stalls, no toilet paper and full trash bins. I felt more dirty leaving the bathroom than before entering.   All in all, the evening was a success and I would go back but would hope it was more well kept.

This is a cool little open-concept restaurant in the Crystals at City Center. My guest and I had the steamed mussels followed by one of the signature pizzas. The food was very good at a reasonable price. The staff was friendly as well. I found the décor the most interesting from the tv in the bar to the frosted glass panels separating the dining areas. Also be sure to check out the bathroom(s). It'll fool you the first time. I would come back here on a future trip.

While visiting Las Vegas this was the first place we ate.  After the snotty hostess sat us down we waited another 20 minutes for someone to take our order and another 20 to get our food.  At that time (3:00pm) there was only one other couple eating.  The waitress never checked on us and disappeared while we were eating.   BUT the food was absolutely fabulous and fresh.   Thank god for the kitchen staff !  If you have a few extra hours and an abundance of patience I would suggest eating the food there.  It was so professionally put together.   But for the darn service!

Compared to other restaurants in Vegas, this has been one of my favorites. I went for lunch, the menu did not have too many options, so if you are a picky eater you may want to look at the menu online first. Everything was great. I had the mozzarella panini with tomato soup. It also came with a simple side salad. The dressing was very light and went well with the panini. The tomato soup was on the smaller side, meant for dipping. It tasted great! The lunch was only $14 not including drinks and tip. For such a great well rounded lunch for that price, you can't really ask for much more.   It's located in Crystals and you can get a great view of the shopping mall, the beautiful artwork, and a great place for people watching. I'm a tourist myself, but its interesting to see how different the people are that come to Vegas for a good time! Check this place out, if all else fails, at least you can say you've tried Wolfgang Pucks food.
Great restaurant. Used the My Vegas $25 comp. Great service. Thank you Javier. Worth a visit. They even brought us a complementary dessert for our anniversary. Well done.

This is a "must go" spot for us when we're in Vegas. Great location in City Center mall, the butter lettuce salad is phenomenal, the tomato soup, which is not on the menu, is a must-have!  Top those off with the best lasagna we've had anywhere and I'd say we had a great meal.  Two thumbs up!

I was looking forward to have dinner at Wolfgang Puck; unfortunately the experience disappointed. Appetisers were probably the best part but they also were inconsistent. For main course I chose Pork Milanese and it was as tough as as sole of my shoes. Service was non existent although there were plenty of servers around doing something. Twice they took all my dirty silverware but forgot to replace them. After they brought me new courses I had to ask them to bring me one and then waited for a while till my meal was getting cold. Maybe I was just unlucky that evening but I will avoid this place now
Veal ravioli with wild mushrooms and sauce wonderful. Hubby says pizza was fair, he is a pizza lover with high expectations.

very, very bad food.  uncaring hostesses.  beef crudo so salty i couldn't eat it, waitress did not care, eventually she offered a replacement for it but only as she was walking away from the table.  soup and pizza also much too salty.  That is 3 of 4 dishes way over salted.  i have never experiences anything like this before.  veal lacked any imagination.  not what was expected of a puck restaurant.  we ate two spoonfuls of the dessert which tasted like they bought it, i don't think they did, however, if your food tastes like something you would buy in a box, as a chef, wouldn't you want to make something different - something you could make better??

This place used to be one of our favorite lunch spots, not anymore!!  We had lunch here and got in right when they opened (we were the first customer). After we ordered the foods, it took a very long time for us to just wait for our food. Service was very slow and poor. Food quality is like fast food not restaurant. Took a long time to get our check as well. Overall we got bad dining experience. Not going back!!

my family (18 of us) all got together for my cousins 30th...we wanted to go somewhere nice but nothing too much as there was nearly 20 of us. This wolfgang restaurant is exactly what we wanted +more.  Our server was fun, professional, and attentive.  My dad and i shared a ceaser salad, calamari, and a mushroom pizza...others around the table opted for chicken picatta, other kinds of pizzas, fish, calzones, eggplant....everyone loved their food and everyone loved their cocktails.....would go here again in a heart beat.
Great food, great bar, and a staff that recognizes and acknowledges locals/regulars. The happy hour menu is the great secret.

Puck's place in the Chrystal Shoppes is a terrific find. Although only steps away from the Strip, it is a quiet, beautiful space for a really good restaurant. The restaurant is open to a large atrium the stretches above and below the seating area and people watching in the high-end  luxury retail boutiques is a fun bonus.  The food is really good. We all elected to try the seasonal Pre-Fixe menu and we were very happy with those choices. The prosciutto and burrata were generously portioned and flavorful, the fresh pasta bolognese was rich and it came with a desert.
Had the Chicken dinner. It was amazing! And the wine was great. They have performances while you eat and a lot of shops. I swear I saw the actor from Tron there! looked just like him!

Pork scaloppine was greasy and bland, my partners "medium" salmon was seared outside and almost raw inside and needed to be sent back. Lack of seasoning throughout. Staff didnt seem to care all that much, wont be back.  Save your money and try someplace else.  Disappointing for a Wolfgang puck restaurant, as we like them in other  places.

Really enjoyed the chicken piccata. All the flavors worked perfect together, but my only complaint would be the serving size left a little something to be desired. Fortunately I ordered the marscapone polenta which alone was a little bland, but worked well with the overall meal.  To drink I ordered the Lychee Star which was delicious non-alcoholic drink that was a mixture of a lemonade and coconut.

This restaurant in near the entrance to the Crystals shopping area initially has the feel of an upbeat casino sports bar. However, past the entrance and once settled, it reveal itself as a fairly excellent restaurant.  I've been here twice with the same group of friends. Once for dinner and once to simply enjoy apps and sangria and watch soccer. Both times, the service has been superb. Really above and beyond helpful and friendly. On the second visit, the waiting staff didn't rush us even though we were all done eating and drinking but still watching the game. Water glasses weren't just kept filled; the servers came around to fill my sangria glass for me.  A safe bet for food choice is either the chef's special or one of the pizzas. I've tried all the pizzas now and they are all excellent and easy to share. The sides such as the cauliflower and broccolini are surprisingly good.  There is a larger group room and an upscale wine list as well. One of the features I always like is being able to see into the kitchen. I don't know why, but that transparency makes me a little more at ease when I dine. If you can wrangle an area on the balcony section, it can also be a nice place to people watch.  The bathroom situation is a little weird but not enough to get upset about. Men and women are in the same basic room will individual marked water closets.

Warm decor and better food that I expected. The Caesar salad with shrimp was delicious. The pasta was okay. Fantastic service - prompt and sincere. Great beer and wine selection, too. Probably the best value for money in Crystals.

I was a little underwhelmed by the flavors and food. This is typical American-style Italian food in my opinion. It's no Angelini or Mozza (for L.A. people), and reminds me more of a Maggiano's (I actually like Maggiano's better believe it or not).   We shared the mushroom pizza and an endive salad. The creamy sauce was not flavorful and tasted like it came out of a jar. The crust was nothing memorable. The salad was a typical run-of-the-mill salad.   The decor and location was nice, but everything else was definitely not memorable.

Loved this place! It is in the trendy Crystals shopping mall next to Aria and has very good quality food. I had the pesto lamb and it was delish! My husband had the mushroom pizza and that was also very good. They also have happy hour all day every day so you can get sangrias and other drinks for pretty cheap. We were there on a special occasion so they also hooked us up on a free dessert - some sort of tart and it was yummy! I would definitely recommend this place!

We tried a lot of different entrees and all were great. We were here on different occasions and the food and Services were always flawless. Take away is great too, we took advantage of that as well. Great. We will come back.

The food was good and this is nice place for a simple lunch.  It's location at city center provides for a more quiet sit down place.  They also split the salad for us which was a nice gesture.  Both pizzas were very tasty, we had the Mushroom and the spicy pepperoni.  However the spicy was not spicy at all.  I would have provided 4 stars but our food took forever.  I think it was a kitchen screw up but the hostess should have noticed and provided a simple apology.

Located inside city center, we had a party of 8 and no reservations but we were seated right away. Our server steven was great and very knowledgable! My sister and I shared the prosciutto pizza and the clam linguini both were delicious!! I highly recommend them and a watermelon martini. The place itself has a nice ambiance.
This restaurant blows.  The food is mediocre and the service sucks.  Unless you're looking for bland, try somewhere else.

It's such a great restaurant. We were able to sit "outside", which is beautiful with the fake sky in the mall area. The servers were fast and super nice. We barely have to wait for anything. We ordered: Tomato soup --creamy and rich flavor, and service with a "toast", well balance. Salmon pizza (with caviar) --very delicious, smoke and regular salmon topping, well balance. But you have to drink lots of water afterward. Bolognese pasta --decent pasta. The meat is a little too salty, but the pasta is perfectly cook.   The waiter split our dishes without us asking which is very considerate.

My family resently moved here and wanted to check out good restaurants in our area. What an Excellent choice! The appetizers were Fantastic! Then the meal comes- i would like to congratulate the Chief! Everything was Delicious!!!!!!!!!!! The drinks, desserts, Everything! Hats off to the Chief! We will definatly go back- i told everyone i know to go to Wolfgang Puck's Cuccina Restaurant! Try it, you Will like it!

This is one of my top 3 dinner spots on the strip. Food quality is impeccable and seasonal varieties show they take great pride in the food being served. The pizzas are one of the best rivaling Mozza in Los Angeles. Their new heirloom tomato soup is delicious. Staff here is very well trained and always accommodating with food sensitivities. Matt at the bar is the best.

I thought the place was overpriced but then what isn't in Las Vegas these days. $12 cocktail? Hmmm...aren't the casino's still giving them out for free? The food was good but if you're looking for a hot dish, expect it to be a degree or two above cool. I felt like my dish was in the kitchen waiting to be picked up by the waiter for a while. Overall, it tasted fresh and I enjoyed it.

This is by far one of my top restaurants in Vegas.  Wolfgang Puck always has fantastic food but this one goes beyond wonderful.  The bread and spreads that come with it was an unexpected delight.  I got the French Onion soup and a salad with goat cheese.  The soup was the best French Onion I have ever had and I have tasted a ton.  I literally order it at every restaurant I go to and this one tops them all with ease.  I do not remember the name of the salad but it was incredible.  It even had onions on it (which I normally hate) but in this instance they were balanced so well I didn't even notice them at first.    My friends had the Carbonara and a burger which they were both very happy with.  Though out the meal we all kept exclaiming how amazing every thing was.  The drink menu as spectacular as well.  I have recently got into St Germain's liquor and Brassiere Puck had a few mixed drinks with it (very excited!).  The one I had was called something that involved numbers.  It was delicious! Whenever I have friends in town we always stop in here for lunch.  Also they are giving locals 20% off food for the rest of the summer!

After a long day on the strip, we were looking for something not too fancy but not too casual.  We happened upon this delightful little restaurant while window shopping in the Crystal Mall.  We were able to sit right down with no reservation.    Our waitress was super friendly and very helpful when selecting what to eat.  We skipped appetizers since we weren't opting for a big meal and the bread plate is excellent!  I had the chicken piccata and my aunt had the salmon which they cooked to her liking with no complaints (she likes it well done).  The chicken piccata was very tasty and also a very large portion!  My aunt also enjoyed her salmon and said it was the best meal she had in Vegas!  We also ordered the sauteed jumbo asparagus with prosciutto breadcrumbs on the side.  Oh my, they were delicious!  Love the prosciutto breadcrumbs.  Thumbs up to this smallish and sorta casual restaurant in the heart of Vegas.   We're not too picky when it comes to wine so I can't speak to their wine list but we did enjoy what we had!

where to start? The food was great, service are awesome and I had one of the best red wine sangria by far, had to restrained myself to be ordering another glass.. decor is modern, chair and table was comfortable.. They start us of with basket of bread, then we ordered the Butter Lettuce, Gorgonzola, Bacon, Hazelnuts & Egg salad, which was a wise decision to spli it. Then as main course we ordered spicy pepperoni pizza and the special of the day, is an Italian Sea Bass, Tomato-Shellfish Stew, Broccolini and yes we still took some home. Unfortunately had to skipped dessert. I enjoyed our overall dining experiece there..

I'm new to Yelp and usually don't write reviews, but after having dinner at Brasserie Puck I felt compelled to change my ways.  We started out at the bar for a glass of wine and a little conversation. We weren't famliar with the wine list, and the bartender was more than helpful. After making our choices, we enjoyed just sitting at the bar and taking in the scene. The bartenders were very good at being right in front of us whenever we needed something, and out of earshot when we didn't. Uncanny!  My husband and I had dinner on a weeknight and it wasn't very busy, so we had our choice of tables. I'm sure this will change once word gets out! Being in the middle of CityCenter makes for a strange lighting situation inside the restaurant. We sat in a booth near the back in an attempt to avoid the flourescent lights. I'm sure it is fine during lunch, but it doesn't set the stage for a romantic experience. Fortunately, the food is SO good that once you bite into something, the lighting just doesn't matter anymore!  We shared an appetizer of calamari with garlic aioli, and I can easily say it's the best we've found so far in las vegas (we're locals). Calamari was perfectly crisp with a wonderful tasting batter that didn't over or underwhelm the calamari. The aioli was absolutely amazing - garlicky, with a little bit of spicy kick.   My husband had the ravioli with field mushrooms and parmesan. I can't comment much on that - but his plate was shiny clean when he was done. :)  I had the pizza with french goat cheese, and I'm still thinking about it! We lived in Europe for 3 years and fell in love with their style of woodfired pizzas. Its just something that isn't duplicated often here in the states. When I took the first bite of the goat cheese pizza, I was amazed at how so many memories of our time there came rushing back. It's funny how a simple taste and/or smell can have such a profound effect! The crust was thin and crisp, the sauce had an intriguing blend of spices, and the goat cheese was tart and creamy.   Our waiter (I'm sorry but I forgot his name), was very knowledgeable about every item on the menu (we asked A LOT of questions), and was spot-on with his wine pairings for our meal.   We plan on visiting again very soon - especially with the 25% discount for locals through April (this is food AND wine, by the way!).

Had two meals here during our stay we liked it so much. Ambience is a little muted since you are in a mall, but it's a great mall and nice for people watching. Kids menu made it actually quite affordable with kids.   Pizzas were great. The mushroom Za with egg on top sounds strange but tastes good. The thin sliced cheese and cured meat apps were excellent. Service was excellent and they helped us figure out an issue we had with our show tickets while we ate, definitely above and beyond the call of duty.   Verdict-highly recommend!

I made my own pizza and it was delicious. I don't eat cheese and for some reason, people have a really hard time understanding that and it always comes out with a little sprinkle of parmasean at the least. Not here! Pizza was made perfectly and was delicious. Crust was delicious and the veggies and meats were very flavorful.

Get a drink - I had the Raspberry Lemon Drop and Cranberry Mojito. The bartender knows what he's doing. The drinks have a delayed effect...just how I like it. Service was excellent. Ask about half orders if you don't want too much food.

Went to Puck's, last minute, for dinner with family. Located in Crystals Mall on the Strip near Aria, it has a bright semi open space, with a nice small bar area. Only had to wait 10 minutes for a Friday night walk-in around 9PM. Staff was adequately attentive.  Overall, food was good. I tried the grilled ribeye steak, which was probably the priciest entree on the menu at $40. But it was cooked perfectly to my order (medium rare) with an unctuous reduction sauce which I wish I had more off. Topped off, it had a nice stem of mushrooms and blackened green chiles. (which was a nice touch of heat) to the dish. A perfectly acceptable opening meal night in Vegas. Nothing too fancy or spend, but good food still.  Sampled the tiramisu dessert at the end. Tasted really good. It had these nice chocolate beads in the creamy layer that added a surprising little crunch to the dish.  Even though it's a mainly pasta/pizza & some seafood place, I can safely recommend the ribeye here. Enjoy the good eats.
Had a great lunch here. Got a chicken panini and it was great. Wife got the eggplant pizza and really liked it. With two adults and one kid lunch came to $50 including a generous tip.

Our waiter was never really around , My favorite was the tomato Brushetta omg amazing!! the view was very good!!! i had Clam luguinne with white wine sauce , had no flavor was kind of dry but it was OK.!! went to the one in crystals

My wife and I were doing some shopping in the mall and I was in the mode for some Pizza, but they just did not pull it together for me.  The location was nice and we enjoyed our table but the service was really off.  Clearly no one was to interested in serving us as we had to struggle to get our order taken and get our drinks refilled.  Hack we even had to fight to get the bill, which they usually never have trouble getting to you.  The Pizza I got was just all right.  The crust could have been a little crisper but the toppings were good.  The one measure that I use is would I go back (those get three stars or above) but for me the answer is no so they get the two stars rating.
Decent food, but a long wait for a large party of 8.  Not worth the money when you can go to better environments for the same price.  2 people with drink l, appetizer, and entree was $100+.

It is the last night of our long weekend in Las Vegas.  We wanted Italian and came here based on the 4-Star Yelp review.  The food isn't here yet but I started the review anyway because of the lack of service. We sat around for over half an hour only to have water and place our drink and food order.  We weren't even served any bread.   I asked the Hostess about when we were seated and told her about our situation. She then got the Manager to check on us.  We couldn't convey our complaint right then because the Manager came over right at the same time as the server brought us the drinks.   The bread was brought out but I had to ask for small plates for the bread. The Manager later on brought out two small plates of cheese stuffed peppers to hold us over. At this time, Mr. Puck's pizzeria & cucina gets a negative 3 stars for the lack of service.  So when the food finally came, my friend's salad came at the same time as the entree. WTF?  Also, the server did not know who ordered what. We were at Hubert Keller's Burger Bar last night. The server knew exactly which one of us ordered what.  Then, we were not offered fresh cheese or peppers. Maybe it is just not their standard practice.   As far as the taste of the food is concerned, it is top-notch as always.  So the food gets 5 Stars but the poor service made the whole experience not so good.   When the bill came, the stuffed peppers were complementary, but there was no discount or free anything to make up for the seriously lackluster service. A major mistake.   With so many top restaurants in Las Vegas, I think this place seriously needs a service makeover.
Great tasting food! Tony our server was the best. He made our experience amazing. Asparagus salad was very tasty. Ordered sausage pizza. Very tasty as well.

Best meal I've had in Vegas for the price.   The service is Amazing! We all came in wearing black, the waiter immediately switched our white napkins for black so we wouldn't get white linen pieces on our clothes :) They asked if anyone at the table had any allergies, seeing as we had both a nut & shellfish allergy at the table we thought that was fantastic!  The water was always filled, the manager checked in & they always showed up right when we needed them. No hovering or over-checking in.  I had gotten a $100 gift card from Bellagio for different shops in the Crystal Shops (I much prefer the outlets on the way out)......the only food/drink options were here & Starbucks....If it weren't for the gift card I probably would have never stopped here  I took 3 friends...together we got 4 different mixed drinks (cranberry margarita, moscow mule, lemon drop & a beer) everything was cold & strong.   We got the sausage appetizer, ravioli, carbonara, a margarita pizza & soup. The soup and ravioli portion was kinda small, but the raviolis were stuffed. Half of the pizza & carbonara went back to the room with us.  All the food came out quick, it was hot & everything tasted good. The pizza & carbonara were especially yummy.  4 people, 5 alcoholic drinks, 4 meals & an appetizer - $150
Great service, great food.  Best dinner out of three I had in Las Vegas.

Delicious food and elegant atmosphere.  The waiter was very nice; if the lady at the reception could smile a little bit, then things would be all perfect. So actually I will give this a 4.9 star. Definitely worth trying when you are in Las Vegas. Actually arranging a good meal in Las Vegas i s a little bit difficult.

The price/quality/location combo for Wolfgang's gem in Crystals is hard to beat. For that reason alone I had to go with the full 5/5.   Our party of three was looking for some good food at a not outrageous price, and at a location that was nice but didn't require us to be dressed to the nines. If you're looking for the same, this is for you.   The table bread was, in a word, delicious. Our entreés (lamb pesto, veal scallopini, italian sea bass) were the best specimens of each that either of us ever had. In particular, the sea bass was out of this world (crispy skin, tender and flaky meat - just wow) as were the polenta and lamb.  Service was impeccable and the ambiance was nice, overlooking the lower floor of Crystals. Only oddity was the bathroom, with the common sink and M/F labelled separate toliets.   Entreés were $18-30, salads and appetizers $10-15 - incredibly reasonable for the location and quality. Make a reservation now via Yelp/OpenTable, I don't think you'll be disappointed.
Great service and great food. Ordered the bruschetta. The bread it was on was soft and fresh. The Italian sausage pizza was delicious.

Excelent service, excelent food quality , reasonable price to be in this area, we had a 17 persons table for Christmas Eve and we spent a beautifull night, thanks to our server, try the white sangria and calamari fritto
Decent Italian spot in Vegas at a fairly reasonable price. Basically a step up from Olive Garden or Carrabba's. Friendly personal service

My boyfriend and I went here on New Year's Eve. Before I came, I perused the online menu and was pretty set on ordering a pizza. Based on the restaurant's name, I thought that would be a good choice. When I got the menu, the veal tagliolini, a New Year's Eve special, caught my eye as did the $32 price tag but it was New Year's Eve so I went for it. It was plentiful and DELICIOUS! The veal was super tender and the tomato sauce drizzled with pesto was oh so tasty.   Boyfriend ordered and liked the turf (ribeye) and surf (prawns), which was $45. I tried the prawns and thought it was okay. I didn't try the ribeye, but the steak was big, at least 16 ounces. The turf and surf came with roasted potatoes and it was yummy. The potatoes were well seasoned, the skin was perfectly crisped and the inside was cooked perfectly.   We also shared a caesar salad ($14) which was very good and could have been split 4 ways there was so much. What I liked best was they used romaine spears and fresh shredded parmesan. The dressing was also top notch.  To pair with our food, we ordered a pear drink and a bellini. I preferred the pear drink. There was also complimentary bread and butter. The bread was warm and the butter was creamy. Very nice. Finally, our waiter was attentive but not bothersome.   The bill after tip came out to be $146. Our bill was high because we splurged, but this place is actually very affordable. Most entrees are $16-25.   It was a good experience and I would go back.

One of the best lunches I've ever had, along with the best calamari and mussels. And the best tomatoes & mozzarella in my Caprese salad. Cute little place inside Crystals at CityCenter, with a nice bar area and cool bathrooms! The staff and service was excellent! Our waiter was funny and really took good care of us, we even got a big round table with no reservations. Highly recommend for lunch as the prices are not bad at all compared to most restaurants in Vegas.   I have a full review loaded with pics that will make your mouth water here: http://littobites.blogspot.com/2012/01/vegas-lunch-wolfgang-puck-pizzeria.html
We just had 3 different types of plates to share between us. Pizza was delicious, steak was amazing, burger was very nice. Nice environment and good service. Well done!

Food was great. Really enjoyed the prosciutto appetizer. The salad and salmon special was delicious. Tony was an awesome server and was super chill. An added bonus was I checked in and I got 20% off my tab. Would definitely come back again when I'm in Vegas!

this is inside the Crystals Center and although they are all high end stores, I still feel like dinning inside a mall.   Menu is pretty simple with mostly pasta and pizza. I guess I have a higher expectation because of the Wolfgang Puck name. I was hoping to see some creative pizza and pasta combination.   The lasagna was good, it was light, meaty and delicate without a heavy tomato sauce. It was worth $19.  The sweet corn pizza was a bit disappointing. The dough tasted like frozen pizza dough and there were not enough seasoning to bring the flavors out. I enjoyed a frozen pizza more from Trader Joe's.   Plus, our waiter was very pushy trying to get us to order more food. I mean...this is Vegas, doesn't everyone have 5 small meals a day?

Craving for Italian food while shopping I ended up at Cucina. It is a well maintained restaurant in a busy shopping area. Having gone for lunch on a weekday post lunch time the service was slow and delayed. The water and cold drink were not refilled at reguar intervals. The wait time for taking orders and food service was late.   The garlic bread was freshly baked. It had a delicate garlic profile with crisp bread edges which were not too hard to chew. The tomato basil pasta however was sloppily served. I was shocked when they prepared it with canned tomatoes. The only basil flavour was from the huge basil leaves placed on the pasta. The texture of pasta was soft. It was clearly overcooked.  Being a sweet lover I ordered the Tiramisu. This was also a disaster. The cookies were soggy and the tiramisu tasted pre prepared.   I am a huge fam of Wolfgang Puck. But Cucina does not live upto the name. It is more like a fast food joint than a restaurant.

Everyone in my party really enjoyed their food. We're vegetarian and the waiter suggested the spaghetti without meatballs which two people got. I appreciated the fact that they only charged us $15 for it, when the menu price is $21, because we got it without the meat. Most places won't adjust price like that.   Service was friendly overall.

Service is terrible!! So slow and the waiter never checked on us at all. The server also took away our bread before we were even done eating it!  Some of us ordered soup with our entree, and some just the entree. Their soups were brought out when our entrees were brought out. So when we finished our entrees, they didn't even GET THEIRS yet. It was pretty ridiculous!!!!   The rigatoni and the lasagna sauces are REALLY salty. Almost unbearable to eat. I couldn't finish my dish because it was so salty. The clams and linguine does not taste like anything but butter.   Overall, a VERY disappointing meal. Best thing was the bread

we had a nice time. food was good and service was very good. we had several of the bar menu items which were just ok but not great (palenta, rice balls, porc belly and mahroom arugala salad). they lacked seasoning and were all just ok. the pizza on the other end was great great great. perfectly cooked, crispy, think with great toppings. we had 3 of them as well so lots of left overs for the next day (one was with carmelized onions, one with italian sausage and another with asparagus and mascapone)  we were very disappointed with the manager treatment which we felt not very classy for such location. we had purchased a voucher at the tix4less location (discounted shows and restaurants on the strip). the voucher was suppose to be for 20% off on all food items. unfortunately, when the bill arrived it turned out the bar menu are not a food item as they were not included in the discount. when we pointed it out to the waiter he said we should speak to the manager and he just brushed us off saying he will speak to tix4 less (surly its not the first time he heard of this issue as it clearly satted in the voucher all food items). this was clearly a misrepresentation by the restaurant as they are clearly being dishonest about it which is not at all something you can associate with wolfgangpuck!  all in all, the bar food was just ok but can easily skip this food item all together as it was not very tasty and apparently it is not a food item at all as per management.  the pizza's were all amazing in this location as well as others we had tried in previous times on the strip as well. pizza is the best bet  4 beers later and a bill of $100.....the voucher deal and the bar menu left us with bad taste but the pizza rocked

Stopped in for a quick bite when we arrived to the Aria and on our way to explore Vegas.  Instead of a pizza, we ended up with the mushroom-barley soap, Gorgonzola salad, and an amazing pork shank.  To top it off, the pear "perfect" martini.   What a great little find.    The wait staff was solid too.    True to Vegas, there was interesting people watching too.     This is a must.
Quetzi was amazing! She was attentive and so friendly. Made our dining experience that much better. Thanks for the suggestion on the lemon sorbet!

This was our third time here, and, again, we loved it!  The food is fresh, mostly organic, and prepared with care.  The main course (eggplant parm) was outstanding, and the appetizers (shrimp scampi and meatballs), and the side veggies (broccolini and polenta) were excellent. O my lordy, the polenta is out of this world.  Seriously.  Even if you're not a polenta fan, you want this. Trust me.  We got the budino trio for desert, and I love the addition of the pistachio flavor....  Excellent wine list, excellent, speedy, friendly service-- when you eat here, you will love it!

my friend and i went for a late night dinner here after a show.   when our food came out, her fish that she had was so hard that when she tried to cut a piece off to eat, it flew into her lap! i think i got the gluten-free pasta ragu, which wasn't very impressive. i barely remember the meal!   My friend ended up sending her fish back, but it took so long for it to come back out that i was finishing mine. at this point we were both so tired and she wasn't hungry anymore that we just sent it back in. Mind you, it wasn't like I had scarfed down my food. I was leisurely eating, trying to wait for her food to come out... and we were talking the whole time.  definitely not a place I'm too willing to go back to.

We wanted something quick but tasting like home, Cucina did the trick. Tony was our fabulous waiter and gave us the las vegas welcome. Margherita pizza and caprese salad were delicious. He even went as far as re-heating my pizza after it got cold. The wine was flowing and so was the dessert. A no brainer! Thank you Tony!

Two of us came here for lunch and we ordered prime beef cappacio, linguine with clams in white wine garlic oil base, and cheese panini with tomato soup. Everything was great, I never seen places using huge clams to make linguine as they did, and the service was very satisfying.

Vegas ain't cheap. It can be really difficult to have a solid meal for under $50 a person. I looked at the menu for Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina and couldn't pass up the possibility of a good meal at very reasonable price.   Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria is hidden within Crystals at City Center so we really wouldn't have found it if we didn't research restaurants in preparation for our trip. When planning our list of dining options, I discovered a fabulous secret: all day happy hour. Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria offers all day happy hour at the bar which includes amazing deals on small plates and drinks. As there were only two of us, we walked right in and sat at the bar.   We proceeded to order an insane amount of food including calamari, an insalata mista, gnocchi, and the lamb chorizo pizza. The calamari was crispy and delicious, one of the best I have had. It was served with a garlic aioli which made a fabulous dip. We received our salad shortly after finishing our calamari and were pleased but not wowed. It was a pretty basic salad with cherry tomatoes and parmesan but it was very well dressed. After finishing the salad we were happy to see a huge plate of gnocchi and a very large pizza, perfect for sharing. The gnocchi was one of the best I have had, served with a flavorful sausage bolognese, and the portion size was HUGE! The pizza was certainly upstaged by the gnocchi but still very good. The chorizo was tasty and I really loved the crust.   We received our bill and were thrilled to see that it came to somewhere around $75-$80, a steal in Vegas! The food was excellent and I would definitely recommend it to someone wanting a delicious, casual meal in Vegas. Why four stars? Our waiter who was actually a bartender, was pretentious an inattentive. We did not receive any of the delicious bread people rave about and we barely saw him the entire time we were there! He was chatting and laughing with another party seated on the other side of the bar. That night I was very thankful for food runners because if there were none, we would've never eaten. This didn't seem to be an issue with every waiter/bartender, just ours so don't let this stop you from going.

Cucina is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas and has some of the best Italian food around. I just came back from a trip to Italy and the pasta and pizza is as good if not better. I always come for lunch as it is pretty casual and sit at the bar for the amazing happy hour deals. The ingredients are simple but all fresh and homemade, which is the base to any great food, no? I have been to all of the other Wolfgang Puck restaurants in Vegas except for Spago because I go to the one in LA, but Cucina is definitely the best! I recommend the margarita pizza and spaghetti, as I said both simple yet divine!

The mushroom pizza was really good. It had a nice buttery olive oil flavor. Great crust. The bruschetta was also good. Service was friendly and the bus boy worked really hard. Reasonable prices for Vegas and a nice spot in the mall.

Great spot for lunch! Our female server was accommodating and the paninis were yummy. We also had the tomato soup which was a great accompaniment to the paninis. Their ginger iced tea is a fun twist on a tasteful tea. We prefer their lunch to their dinner but still decent dinner menu:)  Pros: Lunch, Service, Food  Cons: not a great spot for dinner
I came here with my husband for my birthday.  The food was amazing and our server Tony made our evening very special. Thank you Tony!

Yummy restaurant in the middle of the very expensive and very prestigious shopping mall. Random spot for such a tasty place, but it was worth it.   My friend and I shared the Caesar salad and then we each had the same pasta dish and for the life of me I cannot remember what it was called but I was happy.  Perfect last meal in Vegas

I give the food 3.5 stars, but the setting and service helps round it up to a 4-star experience. I had the all-meat pizza and the portions were generous. The meat and peppers were tasty, but I have had better pizza. My friend had the clam linguine and enjoyed it. Overall, it's a nice place for any occasion.

We were so glad to come by this place on our trip to Vegas! The salmon is out of this world delicious. Crispy and and flaky AND tender and flavorful. What more could you ask for? We were on a keto / ketogenic diet and still were able to eat here - which is great.   Service was also great. Make reservations! We saw people get denied.

Visiting Vegas for my birthday so decided to try a Wolfgang Puck experience. So disappointed, the service was bad from start to finish. We sat three feet from the bar and still couldn't get a drink until my husband walked up to the bar himself. Our food and desert took so long to be served my husband had to ask manager. They have a special menu that we did order from which was a deal so I'm not sure if our service was based on us ordering from that menu because we did notice party at table close to us was getting great service. I am hoping it's not because we were a table of hispanics and they weren't... anyhoo food was salty and service bad and when we complained they offered 20% off bill which I just noticed is offered to everyone on this yelp site. Needless to say we will NEVER be dining there again.

Very modern setting in the Crystals shopping mall in City Center.  Did not try the pizza but the eggplant parm was excellent.  The starter of Calamari was perfectly cooked and very tender, served with Ailoi instead of the usual red sauce, a nice change.
The food was amazing however the service was the best ever. Ask to sit in Tony's section, trust me. You will not be disappointed. The experience will make your day!

I was really surprised at how much I actually enjoyed this restaurant. We had just arrived in Las Vegas and we were starving with no dinner reservations. We hopped the train from Bellagio to Crystals at City Center and within minutes we were seated at a booth overlooking the cavernous Crystals bottom floor. What a treat! While we dined, we were treated to a quasi-flash mob of dancers as well as various duos of dancers performing modern and classical dances. Without a doubt, these are the most coveted seats in the restaurant!  There was no pretense at all at this "celebrity" outpost of the famed Wolfgang Puck. It was casual and comfortable, and the service was attentive but not overly so. We started with the calamari fritti which was perfectly cooked and well-seasoned. My husband had the Veal Scallopini. It arrived as an abundant plateful of succulent and tender veal 6covered in mushrooms and artichokes. My hubby, who has a huge appetite, was "complaining" he was full about half-way through his plate.  I had the Eggplant Parmesan which came with a side of Capellini Pasta. It, too, was a generous portion of delicious eggplant which was not overly breaded or greasy.  (I consider myself an eggplant parm connoisseur and order it whenever I see it on the menu.)  This one did not disappoint! Like my better half, I could barely get through half and was bummed that I had no place to heat it or store it back at the hotel to devour later.  What impressed me most, after the food and unexpected entertainment, was the modest bill. With all we ordered as well as a glass of wine and a martini, we didn't even hit $100, a feat I wish we could duplicate at other LV restaurants named for a famous chef!
The food and the drink was absolutely amazing! The staff was super friendly. We were not disappointed. Highly recommend for a casual dinner or romantic couples night out.

Located along the Las Vegas stripe, this open restaurant overlooks the center of the Crystals shopping mall.    The service:   The wait staff was very nice and were very attentive.   The food:   I had their vegetarian option of a mozzarella pesto panini sandwich, creamy tomato soup, and mixed green salad. Everything was very good. I really enjoyed the crusty bread that added to the crispiness of the sandwich, but I especially loved the tomato soup. It was thick and creamy and you can taste the tomato flavor without the acidity. I love idea of  how it was served in a cup: brilliant.   Overall:   This place is an excellent place to enjoy a filling lunch with quality ingredients. I'd comeback in a heartbeat.

This was the best and cheapest meal we had in Vegas on this trip.  The food was excellent. There where three of us and we shared an excellent pizza for an appetizer.  I had the Wild Boar Ragu. IT WAS TERRIFIC. Service was great, dessert was good and the casual atmosphere was most relaxing. This place is recommended for an alternative treat and great value when in Las Vegas.

My friends and I were looking for a somewhat fancier meal in Vegas, without breaking the bank. Its hard to find in this city, but this restaurant seemed to fit the bill.  We started with the calamari, which was probably the best calamari I have ever had. The pieces of squid were in nice large chunks, and the batter was a golden brown, perfectly deep fried. The garlic aioli accompanying the calamari was delicious but there wasn't enough.  Three of us ordered pizzas while the fourth person ordered gnocchi. The gnocchi was soft and chewy, and was tossed in a thick red sauce. The pizzas were not as delicious as the calamari, which I had thought was going to be a prelude to an awesome meal. The dough was very thin throughout the pie; probably the thinnest pizza I have ever eaten. I had the yukon gold potato pizza, but the potatoes were sliced so thin that I couldn't even taste them. (Upon eating the leftovers the next day, the potatoes even seemed undercooked as they tasted a bit raw). The dough also had a very floury taste to it.  The service was quick and friendly. Our water glasses were kept filled all throughout our meal.  Overall, the pizzas were meh, but the rest of the food was good, and prices are reasonable. I would come back, I just wouldn't order a pizza.
Here I had the best calamari ever in my life - Fritto Masto , crunchy and soft. I had Frutti Di Mare pasta and Tuscan potato both good.
Always love Cucina and all the PUCK restaurants in vegas! Great happy hour prices and selection. Delicious as always!

We thought based on the reviews that this place would live up to the Puck name. Not even close. Slow service and below average food. The chicken tasted like hospital food and my wife should know as she is a RN. The pizza was decent and for the location and service, I would find an alternative.

Ate here for dinner on a Tuesday night.  Would recommend this as a good spot for a upscale casual dinner with very good food and nice ambiance.    Restaurant features a "patio" of sorts overlooking Crystals mall which makes for good people-watching during your meal.  Booths are comfortable, although the degree you sink into them is kind of strange and kind of feels like eating on a couch...  Portions were huge and good was good.  I had the veal scallopini and my friend had the chicken picata.  Would order both again.  Other friends have eaten here for brunch and also recommended it.  Price point is reasonable given location in Crystals/CityCenter and, additionally, locals receive 20% off or dessert through the end of September.  Will be back.

Went here for lunch and ordered Cesar salad and broccolini. The Cesar salad was a bit disappointing; the lettuce was limp and a bit old and the dressing was watery and lacked flavor. The croutons were blah. With so few ingredients it should be easy to assemble a quality dish.  The brochillini was passable.   The Wolfgang white wine was lovely.   The service was slow but friendly.

Good and friendly service from all the staff.  There's table and bar seating available with relaxed atmosphere.  This was our first visit to a Wolfgang Puck restaurant and we only had room for a pizza due to a late lunch so we'll return to try other menu items in the future.  Overall good experience.
The food was delicious, and service was great! Request Tony if you want to have the best time ever!

Pretty much can't go wrong at Wolfgangs restaurants. The food was great, actually excellent but the service was terrible. Sucks when a bad server can ruin a meal. Didn't ask if we wanted drinks, just brought the food. Not good.

Oh my gosh! This was fancy dining at its most enjoyable. Our party all had the specials of the night and every bite was perfection. I strongly recommend Cucina for a bit classier treat. Our waiter, Tony, was simply the best. He made recommendations and treated us like family. But the family you like and invite to your house for dinner.
Everything was delicious! Cappuccino was fantastic.  White sangria delicious and refreshing. The chicken picante was outstanding and margarita pizza perfect.
My salad was fantastic! My husband's sandwich and fries were amazing too! Great service! Great food for a reasonable (for Vegas anyways) price!!!

Yawn. Nice atmosphere, cool location. Not crowded. Came with my family. Food wasn't bad, not amazing either. All four of our dishes needed salt. Our waiter was good. Tiramisu was average. For the price I was hoping it would be a little better.

This evening we enjoyed a delicious meal at Cucina.  The caprese salad had freshly made mozzarella, heirloom tomatoes in a balsamic vinaigrette.  When ordering a wood fired grilled pizza, we requested meat free & our server offered red onions which complemented the olives & other toppings perfectly.  Apollo, our server, provided impeccable service.  My sweet grandson needed a pizza prepared for his food allergies.  The Cucina staff exceeded our expectations.  He loved his dinner!  Thank you to Apollo and all the staff at Cucina.
Great food in Crystals for a good price.  Great service.  We had lunch there and split a salad and pizza.  The passion-fruit drink was great and husband loved his strong beer.

For some reason this place is empty a lot of the time. If you're looking for a convenient bite to eat by Aria, Cucina will more often than not have tables available. The bolognaise pappardelle was the highlight. Sea bass was quite good as well. A more of a lighter dish. The torchio was very hearty. More heavy flavors if you're feeling it.

The pizza and service here are way way better than in the Aria's pizza joint.  As with every Wolfgang Puck place I've been to, the service and wine selection were also of a high quality.  This place is a nice, quiet respite just feet from the hustle and bustle of the strip.

I am shocked by anyone who said negative things about this venue.  We were absolutely pleased.  The food is fresh, great flavors and very wonderfully priced!  We enjoyed a special for one of our party Anne it was beyond amazing!   Another party of ours enjoyed the prefix 3 course!!! They serve generous portions and the food is quality!  We too had Tony the server and he was beyond helpful in all questions!  In fact we have not seen a waitstaff so happy and honestly wanting to make you feel at home.  The view is all open concept so it is very nice to enjoy!!!!
Stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner & not impressed. Service was incredibly slow & the food was mediocre, at best! Save your money & go elsewhere!
Good for lunch. The linguine with manila clams were good. However, the grilled chicken panini was just ok. Nothing great.

The food was delicious, as well as beautifully plated. Our server was so nice, and closed a dividing curtain to give the group of 7 of us a private dining experience at no extra charge. I would definitely recommend! From the food to the ambience to the great service.
Food is ok, nothing exceptional about it, but everything tasted fresh, and is a good spot for a quick meal. Would not go here for dinner or consider it fine dining.

I came here with a few of my coworkers since it was one of my boss's favorite restaurants. It's located in the Crystal shopping center next to Aria.  We started off with some appetizers: The Salumi & Cheese board, Bruschetta and Fritto Misto (calamari). The cheese board had a nice variety although I didn't like that the olives were not pitted. The calamari was cooked perfectly and had a great garlic aioli to accompany it.  Since we dined there on a Thursday, it was Gnocchi night and I decided to go with their daily special, the Veal Gnocchi. I was tempted to try their Ribeye which was the other daily special but decided on something lighter. The veal was cooked perfectly and flavorful but I wasn't so much a fan of their Gnocchi. My coworkers who ordered the ribeye said that it was very good.   Overall, the food and service were great, would definitely recommend this place!
Service was very slow and they didn't seem particularly busy. The manager was very apologetic and offered free dessert and coffee.
Great experience, awesome pizza, superb service, location easy to find and get to.

Enjoyed delicious wild mushroom pizza with hen egg and pappardelle pasta with meat sauce and ricotta. The service was great as well. Caesar salad was kinda run of the mill unfortunately, high quality lettuce but dressing was nothing special.

came here on the last night of our trip and everything was delicious. We had 6 people in our party and we were all celebrating our anniversaries. So they were nice enough to ask for everyone's name and print out a Happy anniversary sheet with our names on it. (Thought that was a nice way of making us feel special). since it it was Sunday they also do a family style dinner. All in all everything was great and we all enjoyed our meal. Def a place to go!

Great Food!!! Location, Location, Location.....inside the NEW City Center, it's HOT, overlooking everything from up top. Real sexy.  I had Chicken Parmesan....wifey had the Eggplant Parmesan. Some of the best Parmesan's that we've ever had. Everyone one else at the table had different pizzas and no one was disappointed. The pizzas are HUGE, but no one was taking any extra food to go....we all had to do some gambling, watch the Viva Elvis Cirque Ole at Aria, and a club to DJ at later that night.  We loved the food, the ambiance, and the overall experience. Check it out for yourself!
Amazing food!  Awesome service and the best prices in Vegas!! Apollo was the best waiter.

What a clean restaurant with great service and great food. The Caesar salad was deliciously simple and presented well. Not overly dressed.  The soprasetta pizza was scrumptious too. A delicious sauce. Every bite was tasty. Thank You!

Perfect $$ place in a luxury mall with a chill ambiance. Good for bar drinks (mixologists here are top notch), or dinner and drinks. Seats 2-6 people tables comfortably I think, so keep that in mind if in a large group. Overall, a surprising find in Vegas with great food and drinks at reasonable prices and decent portion sizes!   For apps, the speck salami was great! It was presented well and they provided a generous ish portion with ~6 slices, olives and 2 pieces of toasted bread.   I tried the burrata filled ravioli. It was earthy, creamy and zesty. Delicious. And vegetarian.   The fettuccine carbonara was creamy without being heavy/oily, and was perfectly balanced with bits of pancetta and zucchini.   The pork Milanese was the star. The meat was tender and moist and paired perfectly with the freshly squeezed lemon juice and mustard sauce (on the side). And since it's fried, the salad cut through the fat nicely. I loved this dish!   As far as drinks go, just get them ok? They are artisanal, special and well crafted. Plus their ice is clear, which I always like. I would rather go here than those other fancy bars like chandelier!   Expect to pay $25-30 without drinks.
Great chicken piccata. Pizza was a bit of a let down, but still pretty good. Great service as well.

After numerous Vegas trips passing by this restaurant I finally stopped in for a bite to eat - and I definitely do not regret it. Wolfgang's pizzas were fantastic. Thin crust with just the right amount of sauce and toppings. I could go as far to say that it might turn into one of my top favorite places to dine at on the strip. The atmosphere was casual, the services was friendly and quick, and the food left me craving for more.   I tried:  | Spicy Pepperoni, Calabrian chili, and Fresh Ricotta Pizza  | Marghertia, Mozzarella, San Marzano Tomatoes, Basil Pizza.    I drank:  | Mint Basil Ice Team - So refreshing!

Service and food was very good. The restaurant closed at 10pm and we stayed till 10:20. The server never made us feel rushed and was really kind. Our pasta had just enough cheese and sauce to make it as delicious and tasty as we like it. I would say, the only downside is that they don't give you complimentary bread.. who does that? Sorry, I just love my bread  but overall, excellent chill Italian restaurant right on the strip and extremely affordable! Did I say affordable! As well, if you don't finish your fancy drink, the server will offer you to bring it to go!!!

Great staff! Very nice kept checking in, but wasn't a bother. I was never low on water!! The food was good and the servers seemed to know everything about the menu! Very helpful! Also hours are great and not too pricy when you order correctly!!

If you're looking for a casual place to grab a quick bite before a show, the staff here can have you in and out fully satisfied, within 30 minutes.   The bruschetta with its tasty topping of pesto and finely chopped tomatoes was fantastic. The flat bread pizza was light and crunchy, and the sautéed garlic spinach was fresh and flavorful.

As one that eat in almost every resturant on the strip. The Cuchina has a spaicel launch menu 3 meals for 25 $ I needed to try that out. The minestrone soup was ok not more then that. Then I had the mushroom ravioli ....i don't know why the chef put peas in this meal because I don't find match between peas and mushroom. Espacily if the mushroom outside the pasta and not inside. Inside the ravioli was chees..they say on the menu it's parmesan but it was really sour...so, I'm not sure a bout that. Atleast I got termisu cake was OK LIKE regular diner bit more then that. Everything was 25 $..but after 2 hours I will be hungry again.. one more very important thing. It was taking forever to the food to come out. So it makes all the experience even worse. You will do your thinking. For me, I'm not coming here again.

way TOO SALTY ..we were very excited to try out this place. we ordered prochiutto di parma, seafood linguini, and carbonara. but everything was salty and Carbonara was just way way too salty that it was inedible and the server took it off our check. but the servicewas good.

Love the pappardelle pasta!!!! All the favors were simply flavorful. This is what we had: -Pappardelle pasta -child's pizza -Bread!!!! So good!!! -Rigatoni pasta -Carbanero  pasta -Broccoli rabe -Cauliflower -Market vegetable The service is amazing and everybody is so nice.

My wife and I stopped in here to have a drink prior to figuring out where we wanted to eat dinner. After having a drink and great conversation with the staff we decided to have dinner as well.   We started off with the charcuterie board which was solid. Bread, meat and cheeses were fresh and plentiful. For entrees My wife ordered the bolognese and I ordered the torchio (a carbonara dish). Prior to ordering our server told us he would put their pasta dishes up against any in Vegas and after trying them I would, too. Our dishes were opposite from each other so we had a broad spectrum of their pasta dishes. Both were phenomenal. It would be hard for me to order something else the next time I am here.  Two last notes: First, when heading to the restroom area, you are able to see into the entire kitchen and I really mean the entire kitchen, floor to ceiling, delivery area to grills. It was impeccably clean which is not too common anymore. Second, all of the staff was amazing. It seemed like everyone in the restaurant was taking care of us that night while we sat at the bar, and in fact, they probably all did. We enjoyed the entire night there and would to go back soon!

My husband was craving for thin crust pizza so we came here.  I was excited to taste the linguine and clams, but they were all out.  I was bummed.  I had another type of seafood pasta; I forgot the name.  It had calamari, shrimp, and clams in an angel hair pasta.  It was okay and had a kick to the sauce.  I wasn't too impressed with the service.

This place has excellent food and amazing service.   We ordered from the 3 course meal for $35 and also individual dishes. The Chicken Parmesan and prosciutto were probably the highlights of the night. It was cooked perfectly and the breading was crispy. The Pappardelle was also good!
