The pasta's texture was  really on point. We ordered the NY steak (medium well) from the 3 course meal (with extra charge). There was a good crust on it was still tender inside. Finally the sea bass was good, but it still had a somewhat fishy smell to it, which I personally do not like but it was bearable.   Adding on! The waitstaff was exceptionally accommodating and courteous! I scrapped my foot from my heels and asked if they had a bandaid and the waiter, Apolo, brought me more than enough bandaids to patch up my scrapes. He was extremely attentive and made our dining experience very memorable. We couldn't have asked for a more helpful person to wait our table.  However, service is a bit too slow for my liking. I arrived at 7:20 and am still here at 9:20 waiting for my dessert to arrive and it is not packed here.   Other than that, I would recommend this place to anyone! I made a reservation a hour before and when I arrived I was seated immediately. If you're someone who likes to take your time and enjoy your drink while eating a great meal, this will definitely not be a problem.  Note: the restaurant is located in the Crystal next to Aria. From what I know, there is a self parking in Aria.

We had a wonderful experience with server Tony! We had a bachelorette party and he took amazing care of us! Huge shoutout to him he had excellent food knowledge and he was super fun and energetic. The food and drinks were amazing as well!
Sea bass, spaghetti and ravioli were all amazing. We came here for lunch for two days straight.

The food here will not disappoint but it is on the pricier side just like anything on the strip. Portions on the salad and pasta are quite small. We had the beet salad with goat cheese (so fresh!!) and the tomato ravioli pasta. Service is very good too and it's a great excuse to check out Aria. I'd come back to try more of their food next time since we were in a rush and didn't get to fully enjoy our meal.

Great meal especially considering the cost and location.  Staff was great.  Went over the menu and specials and answered all our questions.  They had a great 1/2 off wine special when we were there.  Charcuterie board was very good (especially for the price compared to other restaurants on the strip)  The Ravioli was incredible and I could eat the Sopressata Pizza every day.  Loved it and will return often.

*Disclaimer: I am a Bay Area foodie which could explain my extreme disappointment of yesterday's lunch.   The most underwhelming food experience I've had in Vegas... ever!  It was a late Saturday afternoon and the restaurant wasn't full. There seemed to be plenty of support staff and chefs and cooks in the kitchen. With so many people, I was expecting prompt service but I was so wrong.   Paid $11 for the most basic Moscow mule I've ever had. My friend and I could determine the lack of ginger taste is because they didn't use ginger beer - more like ginger ale. The salami plate was probably the shimmering highlight of the meal but it came 20 minutes after we were given our drinks. How long does it take to slice up some salami and put it on a cutting board? My friend ordered an extremely basic balsamic dressed insalata. We both agreed that we could make better attempts at home.   For our mains, we both got the cacio e pepe. Which we delivered another 20 minutes after the antipasti. We were both expecting a buttery and cheesy masterpiece. It was not. It needed more seasoning and was not hot and steaming as I would like for it to be.   I'm sad that Yelp reviews didn't away me to love this place.  I'll be looking towards other Italian places next time in Vegas.
Tony with a T kicked ass!  Food was great, but service made the night.  I'd come back anytime.  Especially liked the Cauliflower.

I frequent a lot of Wolfgang Puck's restaurants both in Los Angeles and in Las Vegas. However, I have never been so disappointed in the service at a restaurant before. I came here over a year ago and I am still so mad about the service that I finally decided to Yelp about it.   My friends and I wanted to watch the Patriots Texans game but most of the restaurants in the City Center area were packed. So, we decided to eat here. There were 8 of us (5 girls and 3 guys) and the restaurant seated us at a table with no access to televisions. So, we asked to be moved. They had a high table that sat five with a view of the TV and some seats at the bar, so the boys and the girls split up. We asked that the high table next to ours be held for the boys when it  became available so that at some point in the meal, we could all be sitting together.  We ordered and soon the people at the table next to us left, so we went to tell the boys to come over. However, before we were able to do so, the red-haired lady who we were dealing with sat another group at the table. We pointed out that we had saved this for our friends, and she just said it was too late now because she sat other people there. Our master plan had been foiled, but we gave up at this point and decided to continue dining separately.  At one point in the meal, our waiter overheard my girlfriends and I discussing how we were disappointed and we would have probably eaten elsewhere had we known we would have had to sit separately anyway. He asked if everything was okay, and we told him that he had been great, but the others at the restaurant were not. The red-haired hostess/manager came over to us and said "I heard you are talking badly about me. Do you have a problem with me?" My friends and I were shocked. We didn't realize we were in high school again, dealing with this type of gossip and confrontation. We told her that yes, we were disappointed in her service. She did not do anything to make it up to us, and had a major attitude with us for the rest of the meal.   Totally disappointed in my experience here.

I really enjoyed our meal at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina. The restaurant is located in the heart of Crystals, City Center's high-end shopping district, but trust me, this isn't "mall food" fare. This is quality, tasty food severed in a casually elegant, modern yet warm and inviting environment.  My husband and I noticed that both chicken parmesan and chicken piccata were on the menu, along with veal scallopini. We both love veal, so we asked if they'd be willing to make veal parm and veal piccata instead - the chef accommodated and our meals were excellent!  Our waiter was pretty good and gave great cocktail/beer suggestions as well. I had a seasonal pumpkin martini that was YUMMY! A bit sweet for dinner but I didn't mind in the least.   Overall, a great experience!
WP. Always Rocks.    Loooove his Restaurants.   Went there few Times. Always Perfect Food. Nice stuff!!!

Had to stop here since the walking around back and forth on the damn skywalk ways from hell tired me out. The baby artichokes and olive tanapade was very good but I wish it would have been a hot dish (perhaps not meant to be). The eggplant Parmesan was good and crunchy (thank you Panko breading) but not quite moist, fine either way. The side pasta was good also, not sure if it was cooked in butter or olive oil, perhaps some other sauce, it was comforting enough. Finally, I am usually biased for big portions and I was scared when I saw the dish sizes but surprisingly, it quite filling and just right! Vegas strip prices, ok service (I had to ask for the bread, how dare they!)

MY husband is a vegetarian and we found when we arrived in Vegas that it is difficult to find good vegetarian options. W.P.'s was perfect! Husband ordered the goat cheese pizza without the meat. The onion with the cheese was just delicious. I ordered the creamy pasta with prosciutto on it (forgot the name). At the end, we ordered the donuts, which were perfectly cooked and to-die-for. Excellent service as well. All around perfect dinner.

We ate the Salmon Dish/Italian Sausage Pizza/Beat Salad and Tuscany White bean soup..Best Pizza U ever tasted. Salmon was fresh and soup full of flavor. Without  thinking twice I would come back again tonight and duplicate our order.

The food was amazing. Their speciality cocktails are some of the best I have ever had in my life. The atmosphere is nice and quiet away from the loud casino scene and no smokers. The food is pricey, but the quality and taste of the food is amazing. The service was great as well. Very courteous and patient.

This meL was the first time we had every person in our party finish all their dinners and desserts....Apolo, our server, was fantastic and gave excellent recommendations for entrees and desserts and kept our drinks full. We will definitely be back again. Papardelle pasta was perfect not gamey at all for wild boar Grilked Pork Steak was marinated and grilled to perfection. If you like korean bbq pork or pork adobo you'll def like this. Polenta was super smooth creamy... def not like other polenta served at your typical restuarant ea bass was flakey yet had a crispy skin that wasnt oily Ravioli was perfect cheesy goodness  Kids pizza was perfect to share with  toddler and everyone at the table  Apple dessert, zeppole and kids sundae were perfect as a closer to our meals
Love this restaurant! Excellent food and service All The Time! The spaghetti and meatballs are the best ever.  Reasonable prices and great atmosphere. My favorite restaurant on the strip.

Our party of 3 enjoyed the pre fixe  dinner option for $35.  It proved to be an excellent value including a starter, main course and dessert. The salmon cooked a perfect medium.   Although the portions were a bit smaller,  we were satisfied and didn't feel stuffed. Service prevented a 5 star rating.

After shopping around at the Aria Hotel, our stomachs were rumbling and we were in dire need of food. Since Wolfgang Puck had a reputable and popular name, we felt safe coming here to eat.  We arrived just as they opened and HH was all day long! Ordering some beers, caprese salad, bruschetta, and pizza, we were stuffed and still had money in our wallet.  The decor is nice located right in the middle of the mall with beautiful wood chairs and tables.  It was a nice find for a famished family, leaving satisfied and not ripped off.

Grilled cheese with pesto was amazing. One of the best I've tasted. My friend and I had the same dish. We asked to substitute fries for the salad and they brought us fries and salad but no soup (which the dish comes with) but they quickly rectified the situation and brought us the soup. Really delicious!

My family and I came here for dinner on Christmas and we certainly weren't disappointed. We had the antipasti board, minestrone soup, veal scallopini, and several pasta dishes which were all nothing short of delicious! Service was also impeccable - our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful. Needless to say, we'll definitely be back for more one day.
Tony made our night! Thanks so much for your great service and honest recommendations. We will be back for more!

Appetizer was really good we did the $25 set lunch combo comes with the appetizer main course and a choice of dessert I ordered the panini and it was too salty for me didn't like that much the spaghetti Pomo diro was good.The Tomato bruschetta and Shrimp Scampi appetizer was really good!!!! Also The place small easy to find the people here are really nice kudos to Anthony and Juan really did a great job taking care of us! We also had cappuccino and tiramisu and vanilla zeppole w/ caramel sauce! Now that one is really good while it's warm the tiramisu not much! Will be back to try other entree here!

Great experience here! Went for a friend's birthday & had the best dinner. Appetizers were very tasty. Had the antipasto salad & bruschetta for starters. The pappardelle with wild boar was excellent. Our server, Tony, was not only attentive but very down to earth & made us feel very at home. The drinks were also very good; the Old Fashioned is a must! Best one I've ever had! Will be back next time I'm in town.

Sitting at the perfect perspective to see out into the crystals shop, Cucina by Wolfgang Puck provides both a wonderful view and wondrous food. I was here for a young professionals mixer. As soon as we got to the restaurant, pizza, bruschetta, mozarella balls and many  of their appetizers and hors doeuvres were presented to us immediately.  The waiters circulated the little balcony area so quickly and efficiently. It seemed as if food was coming out in all sorts of directions. It was definitely the speed they needed for an after work function.  Noticing the decor, the restaurant was vibrant in colors but also warm and comfortable. There was a sitting area, a bar and of course a little area for the cocktail tables.  We got our drinks which was brought to us immediately. The bartenders were friendly and receptive to questions. Just when we thought they had stopped serving food, they brought out another selection of appetizers. Off to the side was also a cheese-board and cold meats charcuterie.   Cucina provided a magnificent location with outstanding food service, professional and friendly staff and the perfect vibe. I would recommend this restaurant for your future event!
excellent food and the waiter was outstanding. was my wife's birthday July 4th and he had a great dessert with a sparkler candle in it  recommend to anyone
Nice little place, food was amazing, drinks were great and the service was the best. Definitely coming back here when I visit Vegas.   Ps our waiter Tony was amazing!

My first Wolfgang Puck Restaurant! After seeing this guy's name all over TV/ nearly all the hotels in Vegas, I HAD to try something amazing.  After a CRAZY long day of walking in 100+ degree weather all the way down the strip trying to save taxi money, we figured SCREW IT, WE DESERVE A DAMN GOOD MEAL. Okay, in all honesty, it was probably only me that didn't want to take the taxi but after that day I realized that public transportation is definitely worth it.   ANYWAYS, I ordered the ravioli with porcini mushrooms, brown butter, sage/pepper sopresatta sweet peppers! The name sounded fancy so I decided to give it a try! It was a little pricey but it's probably the cheapest of all the WP restaurants around. The ravioli were delicious, I preferred them over the cheese ones that my friend ordered. We also had a few pizzas at our table, and all these dishes were definitely big enough to be shared by two (at lunch) !! Servers were great, my only complaints are that the sun was pretty much blinding me during half of the meal, and the cute but tiny fizzy drink that I ordered was definitely not worth the 6+ dollars that I probably paid for it.  Definitely a great lunch spot! :)

What I ate: -Fresh Bread Rolls (topped with carmelized onions) - Free -Garganelli Carbonara w/English Peas, Egg Yolk, and Pancetta ($17.00)  Both of the above dishes were delicious and filling. Pre-gaming for an upcoming night out of drinking, the carbs defiinitely cam ein handy.   The bread was light, tasty, and hot. The Carbonara was sauced perfectly, the pasta was fresh, and the portion was made just right.   Although dinner took a bit long to make, the waiting service was freidnly and quick to refill drinks/bread.   Bottom line: I'd definitely return.

Since it's not as fine dining as the other Wolfgang joints in Vegas, I thought it was still a decent place to go to. We tried the octopus appetizer, prosciutto pizza, and ravioli dish.   I thought the octopus was eh...kinda lacked a punch. Maybe could use some more acid. It's not a winning dish.  The pizza was not bad. Consider the price too I thought it was pretty doable. The crust wasn't too dried up and the proscuitto was pretty good. The tomato sauce helped since I tried my friend's pizza that didn't have it and I thought the tomato sauce gave it that extra punch to the pizza. It really helped.  My favorite and winning dish was that ravioli. The sauce was very good and the inside was tasty. Prob could eat that all day. It came with like 8? ravioli but yea I recommend this dish.   Service was pretty nice too but they weren't busy at all so that added to it I guess. haha

Was craving some Italian and was in the area so checked this place out. It was an interesting open concept built into the mall. Tried out the 3 for $25 lunch and was not disappointed! Great cheese and meat plate, some of the best chicken Parmesan I've ever had and delicious doughnuts!  That was definitely a nice dining experience!

Atmosphere is great as restraunts is modern and has a nice open environment.  Food was good, nothing extremely special though in the food department as I felt it was normal. My husband and I both got the pizza and although it was good it was nothing to write home about.

I'm Italian. La pizza è buona. Gli spaghetti al pomodoro sono da evitare, talmente piccanti da non sentire il gusto. Il caffè espresso non è male. Il servizio al tavolo ottimo anche se fanno troppe domande mentre si mangia. L'ambiente è ok considerando che si trova dentro ad un centro commerciale.

Came here spontaneously last night with a girlfriend. Place was pretty dead for a Friday night. Sat immediately. Server was nice, ordered the citrus mint iced tea....wish i hadn't. We both started off with a caeser salad, it was truly fantastic. I got the spicy pepperoni pizza, my friend got the veal ravioli. She had one bite and was disgusted although she didn't return it or make a fuss they took it away and didn't offer to replace with anything, we figured they would just take it off the check. They didn't. Barely saw our server. The busser mostly did everything for us. All in all, place was nice a little expensive, but chances are I probably won't be returning.

My friend and I kicked off Restaurant Week with a bang, or a Puck.  Cucina is one of the many restaurants in Vegas by Wolfgang Puck.  They offered a wonderful menu and provided a lovely meal. Service was very attentive as my water glass did not go empty.  Our mother's brought us up right and taught us to share.  We were able to enjoy many of the dishes with leftovers.  We started with the Summer Panzanella Salad.  This salad is so light and refreshing.  It embodied fresh tomatoes, cucumber, greens and croutons.  It's definitely a great starter salad that won't ruin the rest of the meal.     Next up is the Sweet Corn Ravioli, Chicken Piccata & Meat Pizza.  I was won over by this twist on ravioli.  I loved the sweet flavor with the creamy burrata.  The Chicken Piccata matched the excellence of the ravioli.  The chicken gave way to the light sauce and fresh asparagus.  The Italian Meat Pizza was loaded with pepperoni, coppa, red onion & olives.  It was good but I would stick to the pasta and entree options.   Our dessert choices included Tiramisu and Chocolate Budino.  I loved the budino. The chocolate cake pieces on chocolate pudding with cherry pieces & whipped cream created a masterpiece dessert.  And really how can you go wrong with Tiramisu? It's wonderfully made here to cap off a fulfilling meal.   So if you're hungry in the Crystal Shops, Cucina is a great option.

One of the beat restaurant experiences in vegas! Apollo was our serve. It was the best service we had ever had. We were celebrating a bachelorette party and we felt like queens! I definitely recommend coming here! The restaurant was open and it was very intimate! Thank you so much!!

Don't get the ravioli! I had to squish the cheese into 1/4 of the ravioli to have a full bite of cheese. The wine the waiter recommended was bad. He was just trying to up sell! Ugh. I think the only thing that was worth the price here was the Margherita pizza. Other than that there have got to be better places to eat in Las Vegas.

Our lunch here this week was SO good. The Italian sausage pizza with smoked mozzarella and peppers was amazing-- so many flavors in each bite. I didn't think the crust was anything to write home about, but the toppings really blew my mind.  The butter lettuce salad was also solid. Hit the spot!

upscale mall restaurant with very professional staff and service.  Had the hickory burger with a side of fries fried w/ sea salt and rosemary, awesome hearty combo.  Thanks Kara for the great experience.
Very fancy and great location/service, but food left much to be desired.  This is a see and be seen place not a foodies paradise.
Very elegant place! Good food and great service. Great getaway lunch place after loud casinos and shops
Absolutely terrible pizza. Soggy, and tomatoes on Margerita look and taste like canned. Salad serving ($15) is big enough for about 3 bites.

Food was great, experience was ruined by poor service. Would have been great if the waiter would have checked on us after taking our order. Another drink or some more water would have been great. Looked like he was having a great time with the other staff though.
Just ok. If you like pre-breaded frozen wings and sangria made with cheap dollar store wine. On the upside the waiter was great.

My fiancée and I grabbed dinner here and it was one of the worst dining experiences we have endured.  We ordered drinks and the meatballs immediately and waited 20 minutes for my wine and another 30 for the horrible - worse than frozen - meatballs.  They brought us drinks we didn't order, and a simple margarita pizza took over an hour.  Our server avoided us so she didn't have to explain everything.    The pizza finally came and was the best thing we had.  It took well over an hour.    There are too many great restaurants in Vegas to put up with bad service and so so food. Wolfgang should be embarrassed.

First off,   I own a restaurant.  My large group of friends and I dropped with no warning on this restaurant, and they exceeded every expectation.  the service was quick, attentive, and superbly friendly.  The food was ordered family style, 7 pizzas, 2 salads, 4 entrees, and 4 appetizers.  It came out in amazing time, was well executed in presentation and timing, and honestly the best meal I have had in at least a year.  Calamari was very good. The grilled octopus salad was perfectly cooked and just the right texture, the salmon was sushi grade and cooked just as we ordered it, rare. Most other restaurants overcook fish, but they seared a 1/4 inch thick layer of carmelization, and the rest was perfectly uncooked. I complimented the manager and staff on the way out, and they deserved it- our experience should have been botched, but was handled by true professionals.

we have dinner at Cucina by Wolfgang Puck. Started with the mussel special with spicy tomato sauce with a bit of white wine for appetizer (wish I got a picture!), prosciutto pizza (pepporoni, salami, red onions, and oregeno), and Pappardelle (wild boar raguat ++ pecorino). Then ending with Vanilla Zeppole which is basically fresh fried donuts with white chocolate and raspberry cream! All so good! Definitely recommended!!! I honestly can't go to another Italian place based on flavor, fresh dough and the best pasta I've ever had. #cucinaitaliana #wolfgangpuck #freshpasta #foodporn #foodie #lasvegas #inlovewithfood #anniversary #yum

It will cost you about $80 (including a decent tip) for two entrees, one app of bruschetta and one Stella draft.  The food was good, but nothing over the top.  The service was good, but our waitress was in a rush to do her job.  I wouldn't recommend Wolfgang Puck unless you just wanna sit at the bar and have a wood fired pizza with a beer.

I remember back in the 80's when Wolfgang Puck's name meant something. Even after Spago. Eating st Granita in Malibu was a big thing for me. And when he opened CUT steakhouse I felt like it was ok but just very well marketed. Food was not as good as people said it was. And now we're here at possibly the worst pasta I've had in all of my life. I'm embarrassed to even say it. I love food. So it has to be bad for me not to finish it. But if it's good I will praise it to next levels. Some people forget I've had food channels and even CNN do features on me about spots to eat at and I wish I could show them the bad places too. I ordered the prefix lunch and the prosciutto was not fresh or tasty. Ok. Fine. Next course. Chicken parmesan which was not so bad. Maybe a 7 Out Of 10. But then I ate the spaghetti and it was a 1 Out of 10 legit. Cmon. This is a restaurant with Wolfgang's name on it??? I should have just walked further and ate at Carbone. They never disappoint. But overall the food was terrible. And it's Italian food which is embarrassing to Wolfgang's name. I will not only never eat here again. I will make sure nobody I know or who follows me on my actual larger social media pages knows to avoid this place. The service was pretty d decent. My actual waiter did a great job. But the food was bad. I also think Crystals should be embarrassed to have such a poor tasting restaurant inside their premier mall.

It was awesome. We eat vegetarian pizza and pasta; so  delicious. French fries was so crispy and low oil.   Staff were so polite and smiling. Our food was customized.( we choose every thing that we want) also gelato was so delicious.

20% off with a Yelp check in is what drew me to this place!  I made a reservation for 3 at 7:30pm on a Friday night and it wasn't crowded at all. My group was greeted by a server who's name I think was Sean? I forget but he was attentive and gave some great recommendations. My friend and I split the rigatoni and the Italian meat pizza.  The rigatoni was great and tomatoey! Loved the flavor and it came out piping hot, nearly burned my tongue! The pasta still had a nice bite to it and how it was made perfectly captured the sauce.  The Italian meat pizza lived up to it's name. Lot's of delicious meats my favorite one was the coppa. The crust was nice and crispy and served as a great vessel to dip in the extra rigatoni sauce I had leftover.  The food was great the service was nice and the 20% made this experience that much sweeter. I'd definitely come back!

Always visit here when we come to Vegas every few mos. Service is always on point and food is always quick and truly outstanding. Never disappoints. Visited Lupo at Mandalay Bay ( another Wolfgang Puck production) and was disappointed by both the service and food.

We needed a place to go to before the LOVE show at the Mirage and this place really delivered!  From the appetizers to the wine to the perfectly prepared tiramisu (perfect consistency)... Will definitely come back. And Bryce was one of the best servers I've had so far. (Bruce like the canyon, y'all!) Cheers!

Four Stars?!!!  You gotta be kidding me.  I'd ask if al the people giving this place amazing ratings are drunk, but its Vegas so clearly they are.  The pizza here is boring as hell.  Toppings are typical of pretty much any pizza place in any major city, and the crust is totally soggy in the middle of the pizza, but scorched on the outside.  Totally unimpressed.  At $18 for my pizza i could have gotten one just as good from Dominoes for 8 bucks.  I also got the Ricotta fritters with red pepper jelly to start.  They were not very good.  The Jelly was not spicy at all, but instead incredibly sweet paired with the extremely sour lemon ricotta fritters, my palette was totally shot after eating just one of them.  Why would a well known chef put his name on this crap?  Give me some interesting pizza not the same old fair I get everywhere else!

A wedding rehearsal dinner group had an amazing time here! Wow- I really loved it! A lot- anyone having a wedding at the Aria or a nearby hotel should DEFINITELY consider having a reception here! So we had a room in the restaurant that I wish I would have photographed so that others on here could see. It was super nice, elegant but not stuffy. It was perfect for the dinner. We had around 3 dozen, but my guess is you could probably add another dozen or two.   The food was awesome. A few appetizers and pizzas were selected for the tables and were all very good. The pizzas were particularly excellent!! I would definitely come back here just for the pizza. Most everyone enjoyed there meals or loved their meals that came afterward. The only ding I would give them is that the drinks were a bit on the very weak side; however they tasted fantastically!  The bride mentioned how easy it was for her to work with the staff to make this event happen, and they decided to go with WPP&C on a last minute change of plans and they worked with them seamlessly.   I will definitely head back here next time I am in Vegas, which is often, and will tell friends!!

The basilico was delicious (a cocktail made with vodka, limoncello, lemon juice and a basil leaf). I paired the basilico with a grilled octopus salad: delightful. Of the nine kids who were with us (ages 7 to 15), everyone who tried the octopus loved it. For the entree I had the roasted duck ravioli, a $28 chef's special that wasn't quite as amazing as it sounds. The other star of the night was their cauliflower with capers and chili. Finally, portion sizes are neither sparse nor overflowing; salad, cauliflower and ravioli all together didn't have me loosening me belt.

Great restaurant! No crowds. Slightly difficult to find in City Center, but worth the hunt. Once you get there, you should try the caprese salad, the veal ravioli, and the  with penne with red sauce. The lasagna is unique! Prices are more like a $$$.

Made a reservation through Open Table. Didn't even need one on a Sunday night. Place was dead and although very nice, service was very slow. Also had a slight misunderstanding about their family Sunday dinner. Please note that the wine offered in the package is NOT included in their package, we found that out as soon as our bill came.   Food was good but not great. It's priced about right for the name but I wouldn't eat there again. Ravioli was cold-we sent it back and the plate and serving size was a lot smaller than our original plate.

We were really hungry and thought the menu looked pretty good... We were seated in the corner on the other side of the restaurant... it was a little secluded...  It's located inside Crystals facing Aria Hotel... We started with the calamari... the sauce was amazing!  the calamari was nice and crispy, and tender.  I ordered chicken piccata, which I thought was excellent... husband ordered the eggplant parmesan which had a nice texture and crunch but a little on the bland side... We also got free onion and sourdough bread.    Overall, the service and food were both good... it was also a decent price...so we'd return if were in the area...

Fabulous restaurant. I'm in town this week for a conference and I went here with a friend who is local, we did the $40 three-course restaurant week menu.  You usually can't go wrong with Wolfgang Puck, so after looking at the menus online, I chose this place. I had seen it before on previous trips but had never dined there.  Busboy service was impeccable - my water glass was rarely empty, and the one time it was empty for a few minutes, the busboy came over and actually apologized which was over and above. Wait staff was friendly as well.  I ordered the tomato caprese appetizer, the grilled pork for my main, and tiramisu for dessert. Everything was fantastic although the tiramisu had more of a cheesecake-type quality; it could've used a little bit more coffee flavor and this is coming from someone who doesn't drink coffee.  My friend had a different appetizers, ravioli, and the pistachio pudding for dessert. She loved the pudding but said that you had to really like pistachio in order to like it.  Glad to know that there are other great Wolfgang Puck restaurants on the Strip, I've only been to Spago and maybe one other. Spago is one of my favorite Vegas restaurants but I'm adding Cucina to that list now too.

To be candid, I was fully prepared to not enjoy this meal. Celebrity chefs typically have more flash than substance. That being said, I would be more than happy to eat my words...if I wasn't so pleasantly stuffed on a great spicy pepperoni pizza! The spaghetti and meatballs were just as delicious. All of the wonderful food was made even more exceptional by Jeremy, the bartender, who took excellent care of us through the meal. Well done!

3.5 stars. Solid place for a quick meal. Like hearty the ministrone soup. The burrata and prosciutto appetizer is rich but a bit too much burrata in proportion.   Skip the tricolor salad - a bit too strong in vinegrette and cheese is a bit too salty.   Good for a quick bite.

Good slightly-more-upscale-than-casual Italian place. The food was simple but rich. I had the "really good amaretto sour" and it was delicious. Also had the caprese which had an amazing cheese. The pappardelle bolognese was so so good. It wasn't too packed for Friday night either. It's next to a bunch of shops so I imagine it'd be great for lunch after a morning of shopping.

Had a nice table behind the host station. It was a 50% off wine night and we tried two bottles that were a good deal. The food was mediocre at best. Not what I have come to expect from a Wolfgang restaurant. The service was poor. We had to seek out our server several times to get basic things. The food runner tried to step in to help but had no training on serving. To leave the restaurant we had to find the server and then wait for the bill then go and find the server again to pay the bill and had to wait for our paid receipt.

I forgot that I have been to this place with my wife three years ago. Anyway, the food is still great and worth another visit after three years. We ordered Antipasti Salad and it was a wonderful surprise. And the Linguine was something a seafood pasta lover should never miss. The wines are also reasonably priced. Love it!
Love this place. Pizza and pasta was delicious. I especially love the white peach sangria. I will come back to eat there. I recommend to everyone.

I wish I had found this place earlier in my trip - I spent far too much time and money in mediocre restaurants along the strip. The Crystals @ Aria is a stunning addition to the strip with its striking architectural design and minimalist interior plus it has NATURAL LIGHT.   This WP is a casual open air bistro with fantastic food, great service, and decent prices. I sat at the bar and loved everything that the bartender/server Carlos recommended. It was also the happy hour with drink and appetizer specials. I had the grilled pork belly (delicious and crispy), asparagus & prosciutto salad (amazing and I wish I could eat this every day), and fried fritti with spinach dip (tasty fluffy dough balls).   Honestly, I probably could have eaten here everyday and been content. I highly recommend checking out Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria & Cucina.

Had a wonderful dinner with no wait on a Sunday night. Their pizza and pasta were both amazing! Our waitress Bryce was absolutely amazing! Put up with tons of our questions about the menu and was overall very nice and super attentive :)
I was not impressed with the pizza. I love thin crust, but the pizza here was like cardboard.
Good food and good selection of wines. Attractive pricing given the premium nature of most sit down restaurants in Vegas.

On the plus side of Cucina: Very reasonable prices for a famous chef's Las Vegas restaurant located in a swanky mall. The pre fix, 3 course dinner option is a particularly good value.  Professional and friendly wait staff. Quiet location away from noisy,smelly casinos. Good food, mostly. Our entrees were very good. My husband had pizza and I chose eggplant parmigiana. The eggplant was crispy and flavorful, although the tomato sauce was a bit bland. The tiramisu dessert was packed with flavor. There were a couple negatives in our one dining experience here. On the negative side: the salad (ensalada misto) was so over-dressed I could not eat it. I love balsamic vinegar, but not that much! I couldn't find our waiter to complain, but I did mention it to the second waiter bringing bread and filling water glasses, as she took away my mostly filled salad plate. She either didn't mention my "inedible" comment to our waiter, or no one cared.   To go along with my tiramisu dessert, I ordered decaf coffee. The first cup was excellent. I commented to my husband that it was the best decaf I ever tasted. I eagerly accepted the offer of a refill. The waiter took away my cup, and 3-5 minutes later, came back with a full cup that was frothy and tasted like instant. Yuck.  The first cup was either caffeinated or was brewed decaf.  Either way, I was sorry that the second cup left yucky taste in my mouth after a mostly very good meal.
This is a quite and hidden place with amazing food and great service. We loved the sangria and the bruschetta was to die for! Totally loved the ambience and it's right next to the Aria Hotel.
We expected better food. It tasted like California Pizza Kitchen. Not impressed !

Kinda of a sleeper hit.  Although really pretty in very elegant crystals, it doesnt have the over the top, loud decor /presence you expect from a very branded wolfgang puck in over the top vegas.  It actually has some class, lol. Pricing very reasonable and portions good.  All the food was very good, not one item that couldve been prepared better: -Calamari- wow that pesto sauce -Butterleaf salad w hazelnuts -Antipasto Salad -Veal Raviloi- decadent -Chicken Picatta, and panini so good and very nicely presented -Pizza- perfect crust -In the running for best tiramisu ever

Stopped here for dinner with the wife. Small restaurant so we were happy they weren't too busy and took us quick.  The menu is pretty lackluster. Nothing gourmet about the selection. This place is more suited for lunch time or quick bites.  I had a 3 meat pizza, my wife had eggplant parmesan.   The pizza was ok, took the waiters advice and subbed one meat for sausage. Great call... but I'd have loved some, any, cheese. It lacked the sweet flavor that cheese gives which makes pizza so enjoyable.   My wife said her dish was good. I don't care for eggplant so I passed testing it.  Dessert, my wife got gelati and I got zeppolas. Gelati is always good, the zeppolas had no flavor.  The best saving grace here is the staff. They are fast, friendly, and very efficient. Bravo!

This place is amazing on multiple fronts. A distinguished restaurant in a stylish location. Excellent Italian food. Perfect service. I can't remember having a better server in my whole life, I am serious, Paul killed it! He is a very friendly person. We had a really nice discussion about wine and beer - he is quite knowledgeable about the latter. He brought multiple samples so we could easily decide on what we liked best. During our lunch he was always there to tend our needs and make sure nothing was missing.  The food was excellent. I went with the bruschetta as the appetizer and I loved them. The tomatoes were fresh, properly prepared (seeds removed) and very well seasoned. The dish featured a freshly made basil pesto that lifted the dish to a whole different level.   Paul told us that their pizza was baked in a wood fire oven, so the decision for the main dish was pretty simple for me. A very appealing thing was that their oven has a window on the restaurant side and you can see how your pizza is being baked - a really nice touch! I went for the Prosciutto pizza and I do not regret it. The taste was astonishing. All the ingredients were fresh and and you could really taste the smokiness of the wood.  Everything was fine tuned for a perfect experience. When I'm back in Vegas this is a spot I will definitely revisit. Thank you for the wonderful experience! I had the time of my life.

Honestly we had the best service here. Tony was one of the best waiters we have ever had. The food was very good and had a great atmosphere. I had the caprese salad and and their pizza.  It was so amazing and the flavor was perfectly balanced. The customer service is still astounding. Everyone was so nice and I will ask for tony from now on. A well earned tip.

We came here for Italian style pizza but they unfortunately ran out for lunch. Instead, we ordered one meal off their fixed price menu with rigatoni, caeser salad, and tiramisu and another entree of spaghetti. The salad and rigatoni were very good according to my husband and my spaghetti was decent. Although I prefer my red sangria stronger, I loved the small cuts of apple in it.  The tiramisu was light, fluffy and not too sweet - so it was a great dessert. Overall, the service was fantastic and I didn't mind eating in the open mall - it was strangely relaxing but formal.

I am obsessed with Cucino! The servers are very friendly and attentive. We ordered the Fritto Misto (calamari), spaghetti, rigatoni, garlic bread, and the meatballs. The calamari was beyond tender and the aioli dipping sauce paired with it perfectly. Spaghetti and rigatoni were both fantastic and full of flavor, they were also large portions. Meatballs literally melted in our mouths and the garlic bread was nice & crispy/crunchy on the outside and soft & buttery on the inside. I would highly recommend this place for anyone who loves Italian food!!

Yay for Wolfgang Puck being my neighbor! Their happy hours are great. The ambiance is nice and the staff is friendly. Anyone I bring here really enjoys it even though it's for purposes of a quick meal. That being said, they're also very fast. Wish they would add more vegetarian options but the pizza hits the spot so I can't complain much.   Discounts for checking in! So definitely take the second to do that.

It's time I wrote a review of this place.  This place has been my go-to restaurant for entertaining out-of-town friends who are picky eaters.  By picky eater, I mean the full range from "kid palate" to vegan to full-on celiac.  This restaurant always manages to please everyone, and I had such a good experience this last time, I wonder why I don't go here more on my own.  So the last time I was here was with a group of 7 (4 adults and 3 kids).  We walked in without a reservation and the restaurant was able to seat us right away.  That alone merits a couple of stars.  The gluten-free, dairy-free adult in our group was happy with her chicken entree.  The gluten-free, dairy-free kid liked his pizza.  The adult who can eat gluten, but avoids meat, enjoyed his pizza.  The other two kids loved their pizzas.  I don't even know what my husband ate, but it was devoured.  My salmon on a bed of legumes was to die for.  I washed it down with some sangria which was wonderfully refreshing.  The restaurant just nailed everything, from the food to the drinks to the service.  The location in the Crystals Mall is delightfully airy.  It's a welcome reprieve from the chaos of the strip and the smokiness of the casinos.

Arrived at around 4:00 pm, which was quite early for dinner. Requested to sit at the window seats but was refused because they were all reserved(they were almost all empty until we left). Ordered a median rare steak, but it was served very rare. Fortunately the waiter was nice to bring it back to recook. The sauce on the steak tasted too sour, personally I didn't like it.

Fantastic pizzas and service.  I came here with 2 girlfriends.  We ordered 2 pizzas and 1 salad; the wild mushroom pizza, prosciutto and arugula pizza and the butter lettuce salad.  The wild mushroom pizza with bechamel sauce was out of this world.  So creamy, so much mushroom!  It was so good.  The prosciutto pizza was also very good.  Lots of prosciutto and thinly sliced.  The butter lettuce salad included bacon, blue cheese, hazelnuts and cranberries.  Great mix of flavors.  Service was great - our waiter came back to check on us frequently and made sure we had everything we needed.  I would definitely come back again for pizzas!

Have a place in veer so this is a go to spot when I'm in town. The food is always great and consistent. I usually get to go from here but there's no shortage in quality or presentation. The only downside I would say is that they took the spaghetti and meatball entree off the menu. Now you have to order spaghetti pasta and a side of meatballs. It went from a reasonably priced entree of $15-20 to almost double. While it's a simple and classic dish, theirs is amazing. The pizzas are great and reasonably priced too.

3 is perhaps a little harsh anywhere else but by the high standards of Las Vegas, this place was a bit of a disappointment. Firstly, it was a crime for a Wolfgang Puck restaurant to make a huge spelling mistake on their set menu. "Pre-Fix" as they called it rather than Prix Fixe. Wolfgang would be furious if only he knew. Sadly he has sold himself out these days and has too many restaurants to be able to spend any time at any of them.  I started with the Caprese salad which was the highlight of my meal. The mozzarella (or maybe it was burrata) was creamy and delicious and went well with the assortment of tomatoes.  I then had the "Tuesday Special" which was lasagna. It wasn't bad but I'd back myself to make one just as good at home to be honest, and I wouldn't charge over $20 for it either! The garlic bread on the side was nothing special either - again nothing bad but nothing you or I couldn't make at home.  If you want good Italian close by then head to Carbone at the Aria for some 5* food and service.

Had a great time at happy hour! Bartender was extremely friendly and took care of us. Okay, so, we ordered red sangria (delicious, it wasn't strong, and had a fizzy taste), meatball pizza and mushroom pizza (both delicious - we went to Lago and paid wayyyy more for this Michelin rated place than this), and tiramisu (it was a lot smaller than expected, maybe 4 bites, good but not good enough for me to order again.   As others have mentioned, all day happy hour and you can combine it with the Yelp deal!  Excited to have found this place!

So far horrible service by our waiter Juan. He took out appetizer order and didn't see him again for 15 minutes. When our appetizer came out, we told the runner to call him . When he came out, he was rude. This is the second time we come here. The first time , they forgot my husbands order. Everyone's food came out except his. Never again!

We plan out all of our Vegas meals - dining is the biggest reason we go to Vegas (yes, even more important than my Wizard of Oz penny slots). We had a big, rich dinner planned and at the last minute decided we were tired and wanted to back out.  Instead we decided to have at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina. I'm so glad we did!  We got a great, private table overlooking the shops. We had a very helpful and personable server along with all the others who looked after us throughout our meal.  We shared all of our items, staring with a Caesar Salad.  Then we had the Pappardelle with Wild Boar Ragu, and the Spicy Sausage Pizza.  All of the dishes were fantastic, the pasta being a favorite.   We both ordered really delicious drinks - I ordered a nonalcoholic juice drink (Raspberry Velvet) with raspberries and cranberries and he ordered a Cucumber Gimlet which tasted like spa water.  Really happy and would come back to order other pastas and entrees that looked just as good!

We found this place on yelp with a decent rating and thought to give it a try. Definitely recommend! The setting is cute and open air, but quiet and private. We happened to come on a Wednesday so half price wine night! We ordered the cesar salad, sea bass piccata and the prosciutto pizza. All fantastic, not a bite left. The service was also perfect. Attentive and genuine. A great experience overall.
Sangria was on point. So was the ragout.  Celebrated my brother in laws wedding. Had a large party and they handled it well. Everything I sampled was delicious.

I mean... it is in a mall... there are so many other places in Vegas (and I'm not a fan of Las Vegas), and you eat in a mall... and it is a bit overpriced. However, the food is pretty decent (note I don't say fantastic), the service is good. So basically... up to you :)
Consistently good food and service, year after year. Reasonably priced and centrally located. Can't beat the views either inside a phenomenal mall.

They have excellent service here. The servers were on top of it. They were very friendly and attentive.   I tried the mushroom pizza and the crust was just divine. I had more than one Moscow Mules. It's a must try.

Amazing pizza and wine!  Cute little restaurant inside the Crystals shops. The Wolfgang Puck house Pinot Noir is amazing. I have had several of the wood fired pizzas but my favorite are the Margherita pizza and the prosciutto pizza.  There is no parking at Crystals. You can either valet your car or park at Aria and walk over.

Great service and food and thank you to yelp 20% off check in coupon. Tomato soup reminds old fashion thick home made soup. Loved Cesar salad with anchovies. Was pleasantly surprised with food quality.

It was everything I expected but so much more! Our server Miguel and Antonio are what really made it for us. Service was impeccable and made it so much better. The food tasted so fresh and delicious. We will definitely be frequenting this place again very soon. One of the best Italian restaurants I've been to in Vegas.
The four of us stopped in to share a pizza a get a few drinks before heading to another restaurant.  The pizza was really good and fresh.  The service was friendly and the drinks were good also.

This is a great go-to- for a casual affordable dinner in Vegas that still has a great ambience, good food, and good service.  Our appetizers were delicious, and pizzas were "ok" (but I'm a pan pizza gal and these are Italian thin-crust type).   Must trys:  Asparagus Salad - Delicious Prosciutto - Not only is the prosciutto good but the burrata is SOOO GOOD!  Service was solid, too!

I had a late night in the Aria poker room during my last trip to Vegas, putting me on a different schedule from my friends, who woke up shortly after I went to bed. They were getting some work done at the Starbucks in the Crystals mall when I rolled out, and I decided to grab a pre-made sandwich just to throw something at my hunger. When I got there, I noticed Cucina right upstairs, and ended up treating myself to a decadent solo lunch.  Cucina is a casual Wolfgang Puck restaurant, an open space in the middle of the Crystals shopping center, a sort of food courty floor plan with tables and a bar but no walls. It was all but empty at noon on a Monday, and it felt totally natural to sit at the bar and eat alone. The bartender was friendly and welcoming, and he knew when to chat and when to leave me to eat and read my book.  It was a pretty perfect lunch, a plate of spaghetti and a glass of white wine. The house white was crisp and tasty, and I believe priced for happy hour, and I loved the spaghetti a la pomodoro. The pasta was super satisfying, cooked a spot-on al dente, tossed with an acidic tomato sugo and parmesan. I added on meatballs, and these were great, too, tender and beautifully flavored. This was just a luxurious treat, and it made me feel pampered and wonderful.  That was the day before the election, and unfortunately, I had to tarnish this lovely memory with a return visit the night of November 8, for a party that did not feel like a party. I sat at the bar surrounded by other thunderstruck Democrats watching the votes roll in, and drank several whiskeys.  I still think fondly of Cucina, and of that last blissful lunch before the election. That spaghetti was remarkably delicious, and I hope to eat it again on a happier trip to Vegas.

Wow! One of the best dinner experiences I have had in a loooong time. This place made me remember what fabulous food taste like and that superb service is still out there.   Came in on a Tuesday evening around 7PM without a reservation. The hostess greeted us and we were seated immediately even though they were pretty busy.   We had two servers taking care of us. Both were wonderful and very attentive with us and the surrounding diners. They made sure our beverages were always filled, checked in to see if we had any needs, and kept us in the loop regarding our food being prepared.   To start off we ordered the house salad that had mixed greens, tomatoes and fresh parmesan cheese. They split the salad for hubs and I to share. It was a simple salad with light dressing. They serve two types of bread a fresh soft yummy onion focaccia and slice French bread. The focaccia was my favorite. Being Italian I would have been content eating a basket full of it.   Next was the meatball appetizer. It came with 8 small meatballs with a tomato and pesto sauce. The meatballs were tasty with the sauce and very moist.   About 30 minutes later our Margarita pizza arrived. It was cut into 6 slices and was pipping hot right out of the oven. A very simple and yet wonderful pie. I'm not a huge fan of thin crust pizza but this one is very good. Their sauce has a great flavor with the seasoning.   Our dinner lasted about an hour and a half. They didn't rush us in and out. We were able to take our time and enjoy each dish as it arrived. They time the courses perfectly one after another.   For the salad, meat ball app and pizza with tax total and tip total was around $52.00.

We expect a lot from a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, and Cucina met our expectations. Service was outstanding (maybe because we sat down at 5:30 pm, but still have to give them credit). The calamari appetizer was top notch, my wife had the fettucini carbonara with a side of cauliflower, I had the pappardelle with a side of brussel sprouts. The size of the entrees is reasonable, not tiny and not gut-busting; the side dishes are quite large so you should consider sharing between 2 people. Our only criticism is that the carbonara, while tasty, was very salty.   Would definitely go there again.

Wife and I landed in Vegas late Thursday afternoon and wanted something near our hotel (Aria) for dinner. I read some decent reviews on yelp so we decided to check it out. We ordered some mild prosciutto as a starter, we received about 9 thinly sliced pieces, along with some olives and bread. Quite tasty. For our main we split the yukon gold potato pizza. We eat a lot of pizza, and this was probably one of the best we've had at a restaurant. It was a thin crust, so all the flavor came from its ingredients. The mascarpone and thinly sliced potatoes combined with the greens and guanciale (pork cheek) was the perfect combination of slightly sweet and savory. The servers were very attentive and kept our water glasses full throughout our meal. The total with tip was under $30. Very reasonable for a tasty Vegas meal.

We have come here multiple times, every time we are in Vegas. The wild boar pasta is phenomenal, and the sangria is great and very well priced. My husband and I LOVE this place! Great value and amazing food, especially for Vegas.

I have eaten Wolfgang puck at the MGM HOTEL and it's way better then this one..I thought it would be the same but I guess I was wrong..pizza wasn't as good the salads were ok..no I will not go back here sorry!

Good place for a fast lunch and to grab a quick bite before shopping. Not exactly a food court type restaurant, but can seem that way because it's located in the middle of a mall. It's located in an open area, so a good location to people watch while eating lunch.  The food we had was not very impressive. I didn't come in with high expectations, since it was just for a quick lunch, but I wanted a tastier meal because it was a Wolfgang puck restaurant. We ordered the specials they had for the day, Rock shrimp pizza and steamed mussels. The pizza was very bland and the cheese was overwhelming in taste. Our mussels were too salty and a lot of my shells were empty.   The staff was very friendly, but the service took awhile. The restaurant was not busy at all, but it took over 45 minutes to get two entrees out. I didn't have the best experience here, so I will not be coming back.

FANTASTIC! Finally Italian food made correctly, not dumbed down for LV. everything was perfect- the pastas, bread, salads, service.   If you don't like their food, you need to go back to Olive Garden. Ha!

Today is a Sunday, we came here around noon, no so many people eat here, a lot of empty tables, we want to see the soccer game, so we seat at the bar, they have the full lunch menu on the bar as well They have a lot choice on their lunch menu, which is awesome We tried  Fritto Misto Italy meat pizza Ribeye  Peach bread pudding with ice cream The Steak is so good, well cooked and full of flavor The pizza is a little bit disappointed, as it name as, it has too much meat on the top, very heavy to eat, I did not finish it Our server is really friendly and nice Overall a good lub

We stumbled upon this gem while walking back to our hotel. It's right in the middle of a mall. They have a set menu for lunch and dinner but you can also order off the menu. We had a large group of eight and they were able to accommodate with no issues.   Really enjoyed the pastas. They were very flavourful and delicious. Two people got pizzas and didn't enjoy them as much. They were a bit dry and had very light toppings.   The sangria pitchers are delicious. My meal came out a bit later than my friends and our server brought out a wonderful selection of desserts because he felt bad.  Overall, service was excellent and the pastas are delicious. Great place to visit!

This place is pretty good & reasonable. It's convenient if you're staying at the Aria because it's in the Crystal Shops. The space is cute. We had a pizza margherita & a pizza with eggplant & spinach. Both were very tasty. I have to say that I didn't think the margherita looked as good  as it actually tasted. It had a good amount of basil too :) Note: Each pizza serves 1 person. They are the thin Italian type of pizzas.

I am not sure if this is fancy restaurant etiquette, you judge it.  Our group had a reservation, and were seated as planed. After talking for a bit we noticed that nearly 15 minutes rolled by without anyone pouring water or coming to us. To the waiters defense, I think he may have been waiting for drinks for the other party, but still I was ticked from walking the whole strip to get here and being very thirsty!  When the waiter did show up everything went smoothly. The prices are more then I expected for a "$$" place but the quality justified it well. I had a tuscan potato with garlic and basil priced around $6. It was delicious and the portion decent as well. My other friend got a cheese pizza and he said it was amazing, he said he liked how the moz and parm cheeses blended to create a UNIQUE flavor experience. My other friend is sleeping so I can't ask him. We had it yesterday you see and it was a long night that I am glad that I chose Wolfgang puck to start it off.   Sodas are $3.50 (with refills) to give a good measure on prices.    Knocked off a star because of that waiter who was late with my water. Dang him. That chap was a humorous fellow.
Beautiful fresh food.  Friendly service and fun open ambiance.  The heirloom tomatoes they serve are a thing of beauty.  I would come again.

We had dinner at the bar.  Shawn was the bartender for the evening.  He was so attentive to our needs and made us feel welcomed.  He had such a great personality!  We ordered the Salmon and Pappardelle dishes...both were delicious!  I hope Wolfgang appreciates what an amazing representative he has at this location!  We will definitely be back thanks to Shawn's hospitality!!

Eric was a great waiter for our wine pairing with MyVegas.com. Explained our pairings well and went to get answers when we questioned him. He did a great job and the food was great too.   We had the linguine with clam sauce and brick chicken.

Logistically, I just don't understand this place.  They will not actually seat you until 5 and our group of 10 was there for an early dinner.  We waited at the bar and ordered some drinks off the happy hour menu which was an excellent value.  The red sangria was amazing although a lot of the small pieces of fruit were orange peels that you can't actually eat.  Anyways, how do you not allow a party to transfer the tab over to the table???!?  Seriously, with all the technological advances why would you inconvenience the customer so?  The bartender also rudely informed us we were not allowed to order any happy hour apps since we were moving to a table.  I must say I was relieved that the night began to take a turn for the better.  We had the calamari, the shrimp scampi, the platter of meats, the prosciutto, and the special flatbread pizza as appetizers.  The prosciutto and the meats were the best apps although I'd order all of them again.  I was more impressed with the complimentary bread and the appetizers than I was with my entree of linguine and clams which was pretty standard.  Good amount of clams and good pasta but it is hard to over deliver on such a dish.  The tiramisu was excellent and a nice portion.  Overall, the apps are a 5, the entree 4, and the service was a dud.  If you're not in a hurry and don't need a lot of attentiveness from you're waiter, then this place ultimately is a great value, especially in the location.  Sounds like they need some better management and logistics.
Wonderful service, great food and smoke free. Received 20% off with a Yelp check in. 3 course dinner meals were $35 a piece and delicious.
Lots of places to choose for food, and was very happy with Puck's. Pizzas were flavorful, grilled veggies and salads were great. Decent beers on tap. All around worth the money.

This place was really yummy! From the pizzas to the pastas to the desserts, they did not disappoint. We had a party of 7. Great place for larger parties. You can make reservations on open table. Service was excellent. They offer gluten free pizza and pasta. Everyone was pleased with what they order. We would highly recommend the spaghetti, meatballs, pappaedelle, ravioli, and pistachio budino. The sea bass was good, but when we go back, we will definitely get the pastas! So fresh, cooked to perfection and sauced just right.

Ate here on a recent trip to Vegas... wow! Pizza was fantastic. Also had the caesar salad with garlic croutons, humbolt fog blue cheese, and butter lettuce. Different spin on the classic caesar salad. Very good.  Best part of the meal was the mac n' cheese. It comes out still sizzling in a cast iron bowl. The hot bowl creates a crispy layer of cheese that brings the mac n' cheese to a whole nother level.  Wow. Great late night dinner.
In City Center, pleasant, open location.  Good place to get away from alas Vegas madhouse.  Food was fine but not memorable.

I ordered one of the pizzas and it was fantastic. Service was also great. My wife and I got a side of meatballs with our meal and they were delicious. I would come back for sure. 4 stars only cus to get 5 i have to love the place.  it is in the crystal mall inside of the Aria complex so it took us a little while to find it but it was a great time. The Aria is beautiful and the pizza was great. I was a fan.

Very quiet inside the building, very slow at the restaurant which is surprising given the good food at a good price. We were one of two tables in the restaurant for a Saturday evening. We were given the bar menu in addition to the regular menu which had good deals on pizzettes and appetizers. Waiter Tony was very friendly and professional. The pizzette was maybe two inches smaller radius than a pizza for half the price. The pasta was fantastic, fresh made noodles, perfect Bolognese sauce and real shredded beef. I would make this my first choice for Italian on the strip.

Across from the Aria (park there), inside the Crystals shopping above Starbucks... this was one of the BEST meals that I've had in Vegas.  From the Brioche to the squash soup and the Baby Kale Salad was amazing !  My date had the Chilean Sea Bass special at lunch - he said it was fabulous too.  Dessert was the Tira Misu - yummy !  Service fabulous, I felt like a Queen.  Met one of the chef's "Lucky" - very nice young man - service with a smile !  Definitely going there again.

Went here with my boyfriend and my boyfriend's brother and his girlfriend for a late dinner.    First the appetizers: Calamari and Mushroom Pizza.  I didn't try the calamari but everyone else said it was good.  The pizza had so many mushrooms on it that they were falling off!  Yum!  I got gnocchi as my entree which was very good.  My boyfriend and his brother both ordered the Lamb Sirloin.  They asked the waitress for mint jelly and were upset that they didn't have any.  They even went so far as to ask the chef to make them a mint sauce....giving the waitress directions for doing so.  I was so embarrassed!  But she was a trooper and took it all in stride,  And when it all came down to it, they both enjoyed their meals.  The other girl in our party ordered the Chicken Piccata and seemed to enjoy it.    I would go back for sure, just without the company of my boyfriend's brother...he's a bit hard to take!  But like I said, the waitress was excellent with all his demands and made the dining experience that much better.

WOW ...this is definitely a wolfgang puck restaurant.   The mushroom risotto balls were little balls of crispy creamy heaven. So delightful!!  Proscuitto Pizza was good.  Edive salad was quite interesting. A bit heavy on the blue cheese side.  I definitely would go back for dinner! :)

Amazing amazing amazing food and service!   Fresh ingredients and great customer attentiveness.   Everything is so flavorful. Although located in the shopping area behind Aria - a more quiet and peaceful environment was provided.   I will be back!

Went for a bachelorette dinner before a night out on the town. Our server, Tony, was PHENOMENAL! So personable, quick witted, and so attentive while juggling multiple large groups. Funny enough the manager, Moon, was a past coworker and was truly a gem as well. They not only provided us with a tasty dinner, quick service, and clear communication on the timing of each item coming out, they also gave us some free desserts to sample. From the hostess to the bussers, everyone was so gracious and pleasant. Excited to go back again and try more!  The sorbet dessert plate was our favorite, great light ending to a plate of pasta for most of us.

Wolfgang puck always has good food.  I have been to a few of his places.   I just had spaghetti and meatballs but the meatballs were great. Service was excellent.  Dessert was tasty.  I would go again next time I'm in town.  My buddy would also and he is a local.

We made a reservation for a party of 20, but when we arrived at the scheduled time, the staff was still "setting up our table" so we had to wait for nearly half an hour to be seated. As we got seated, we had to wait another who knows how long to get some service. Some people were getting impatient, so they went to gamble as we placed their orders in for them. As we all got our food after the others returned, they assumed their orders were still being prepared. 10-15 min later, we had to wave the server down to check on the orders as well as refill our glasses. He comes back to tell us that their orders were never placed and forgets to get us more water on top of that.  The food was okay, but for the price we were paying for mediocre food, I wished their service was a bit more attentive. They also charged us a hefty cake cutting fee of $50. FIDDY! They didn't even cut the cake for us!

Made a quick reservation here on Christmas day and they were available for 5 people at 6:30pm. Honestly, the food was pretty good so I'm disappointed that there weren't a lot of people, but I guess in comparison to all the glitz and glamour of all the Las Vegas restaurants, this restaurant gets lost. (especially since its in The Shops at Crystals. The Shops at Crystals is like desert land compared to the Strip.)  Food: We started off with the minestrone soup and shared it between all 5 of us. It was decent soup. Couldn't complain. We also got the garlic bread since there was no complimentary bread unfortunately.   Mushroom Pizza: The mushroom pizza was flavorful. The crust was thin but not too thin. It had a fried egg on top, which I love.   Linguine: Solid linguine, fresh seafood.    Pork Chop: I'm not a big fan of pork chops as I find it too dry/dense sometimes but it was a decent dish. The polenta on the bottom was very well done.   Sea Bass: I loved the sea bass. It was very flaky and flavorful. The lemon-caper butter sauce was on point. The side vegetable was broccolini and that's my favorite, so I am a little bias to this dish already.   This is a nice little spot away from the hustle and bustle of The Strip. Definitely recommend it for a casual dinner, especially if you're staying at the Aria next door.

This is my second time here. Food was really good. Had the margherita pizza, grilled meatballs, and a salad. Our waiter Quetzi was great! Super sweet. Would definitely make this place my Vegas regular spot

In the heart of the city center, we stopped in to get cool from the Vegas heat. The Moscow mules were good and in a copper mug. We shared a spicy pepperoni pizza (8 or so slices) and butter lettuce salad. So fresh and perfect for a lunch bite. $70 bill for lunch, but it's Vegas.
Tolles Essen und toller Service! Great food and great service!und endlich mal nichts frittiertes - And  finally nothing was fried :-)
Good location, and prices are really reasonable for Vegas. The service was great and professional. The food was OK--the pizza and the bruschetta were just fine. The sangria was good.

I'd prefer if they treated this place as casual dinner vs charging 25+ for a plate and to wait 30 minutes for drinks and food. Service was below average and food was good because it was extra salty.  I had a better experience at MGM Wolfgang.

This has become a frequent "go to" place when we visit Vegas. Food is excellent, with good pizza and great pasta dishes. I really enjoy the Rigatocini, my wife likes the Carbonara. Service the last visit was off a bit, but this was unusual.

Surprisingly VERY Good....you think with so many restaurants, things can get convoluted.  But its really really good.  Service on the slow side, but thats because we had a party of 20.    Food was pleasantly great, even for city center standards.  I'd come back in heart beat....

Hmmm... pretty disappointing dinner experience. 7pm reservations with prompt seating. Got water service right away but about 10 minutes more before our waiter came to take our drink order. Since we wanted to leave close to 8:15 to catch a show, we gave our dinner order at the same time.   I ordered the $35 dinner prix fixe (risotto app-yummy but like a full entree and this choice was an add-on price --guess I missed this), salmon entree (pretty good but also had an add-on price), and the donuts); hubby ordered the bruschetta app and the shrimp scampi (small shrimp more like a bay shrimp-the sauce was lacking garlic or anything flavorful); guests ordered chicken parm (seemed to be a huge portion with what I believe was a beautiful basil topping); and the kale salad (walnuts and other fab goodies), a side of grilled potatoes, and a side of garlic cheese bread. After about 20 minutes two of us received our apps. Then we waited ...and waited.   Our water glasses were kept filled but after another 15 minutes we asked about our order --which finally arrived a full hour after we placed our order or an hour ten since we arrived. Since this was the time we wanted to exit, we scarfed our meals. The waiter did not return to ask how our food was or if we wanted another drink or anything else. We asked our water server to bring a roll or bread to accompany the scampi, but it never came.   At about 8:30 we flagged our waiter and asked for to-go boxes for my entree and the desert. We paid for the bill (after sorting out the extra costs in the prix fixe order), and then dashed to our show... which we made just as the lights came down. Having been a fan of the original Wolfgang Puck restaurant on Sunset in LA, I am sorry to learn that his chain restaurants lack any of the wow from the flagship. ...sniff...

After our amazing meal at Puck's Bar and Grill at MGM, all we could do was lament that we hadn't discovered it sooner. Now we had family in town (who wouldn't be interested) followed by extended travel, when all we really wanted to do was go notch every Puck eatery that we'd ignored all these years on the grounds of Puck-the-man coming off as a bit of a wanker on TV. Cruel fate!  But one night mercy struck: our guests were occupied and we were hungry. Okay, where could we go quickly and casually? We bolted for the Pizzeria.  First came the bread. Not a delicate basket but a sliced mini-loaf with butter. Golden and crusty outside, golden and fragrant inside with flecks of herbs and some decent-sized holes in an otherwise tight crumb. (You can tell I've been reading bread cookbooks.) "Quite tasty."  Mike, his stomach keeping in mind our relocation from Vegas in the too-near future, ordered a starter of grilled meatballs, and we both got the butter leaf salad with Gorgonzola, hazelnuts, and egg. (Mike's with the customary bacon, mine without.)  Thumbs up from Mike on the meatbals. I liked my salad better than the Greek-ish one at the Bar and Grill - fewer ingredients kept the flavours from being lost, perhaps. Still, I've had more interesting and tastier salads at so many other places around town that this is part of the reason Puck loses a star here. As much as I love a good salad course, I wouldn't bother with one next time. Perhaps if you're not a vegetarian you don't feel so "meh" about what he offers. (That said, Mike liked the salad well enough but agreed it wasn't anything special.)  We each got our own pizza (partially because of our different preferences, partially because we were already excited by the idea of having some Puckian leftovers for the next day). Choosing what to get, though, was so hard. As a vegetarian, usually I have to pick between "variety of vegetables that will always include something icky," "variety of cheeses," and "Margherita." Here I could have Margherita, but I could also have "mushroom with bechamel, fontina, arugula, and thyme." Or I could have "eggplant with crushed tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and oregano." Or maybe I could try "Yukon Gold potato with mascarpone, Brussel sprouts, and rosemary, hold the guanciale." I hate Brussel sprouts and yet it still sounded good!  In the end I chose the "caramelized onion pizza with creme fraiche, arugula, and olives." Mike had the Italian meat, I think. Something with pepperoni, anyway. I don't recall because my pizza was So Darn Delicious that all other pizzas discontinued to exist. Oh, that fluffy, chewy, soft thoroughly cooked crust! (If you like it thin-and-floppy, this isn't your place.) The near-buttery onions that melted on my tongue without being greasy. The fresh little pops of the arugula. And the olives, so discreetly flavourful without being unpleasantly bitter. How would I ever be able to face little black rings from a chain pizzeria again?  The customers at the table next to us claimed no room for dessert, and I felt so sorry for them. People, this may have been only my second Puck experience, but even I knew you have to wear your eating britches and pace yourself because skipping dessert is just going to make the Baby Julia Child cry. But I understood their plight because pushing away that pizza when I was still hungry took previously untested levels of will power.   Our dessert choice wasn't on the online menu; we shared a piece of chocolate concoction that was like dark chocolate cake on the bottom and dense/creamy chocolate pie on top, with a nutty edge and served with cream. "Mmmm." "Mmmm." "Mmmm." "MMMmmm." Dinner conversation became a bit stilted for awhile.  Service was great; our waitstaff team of two was happy to answer questions and soda refills were timely. The seating didn't feel too crowded, even though the place was full and therefore we had to sit at a two-top. It would have been nicer if the tables for two were a little further apart (there goes the rest of that star), although I know my cultural need for that much personal space isn't universal. (But should I have been so aware about one table's decision not to have dessert, and another table's decision to have the same salad we did?) Still, not a dealbreaker.  And of course, the best part was driving home with our pizzas in the backseat. We couldn't wait to be hungry again!

We came here to celebrate my bachelorette party and had the greatest time. The food was good - but the service was fantastic. Our waiter, Apollo, went above and beyond to make my night special and memorable. Truly, that was the best service I've ever had - and I dine out quite a bit! The torchio (carbonara) was the best thing ordered, but both the bolognese and ravioli were good as well. I will 100% return here next time I come to Vegas! Thanks Apollo for contributing so greatly to an amazing night!

Happy Hour specials ALL DAY.  This is such an amazing find for Vegas--good prices in a clean, beautiful setting.  They have a handful of pizzas on the HH menu.  They are personal sized for like 7$!  On one visit, Mr. DJ and I ordered 2 of these pizzas and calamari--this was more than enough to fill us up.  On another visit we ordered one pizza and these fried mushroom risotto balls (all on the HH menu).  The risotto balls were amazing....you must order these.  Add a couple glasses of wine and you're good to go.  A HUGE plus for having the NBA playoffs on TV.  Overall great experience here...attentive/welcoming/friendly staff, pretty setting, awesome food for an amazing price, and playoffs on TV.

Wolfie, I gotta tell ya that you got 4 stars because the food was so delicious, BUT: 1. You didn't do the most basic of things any good host knows, which is to bring something for guests to snack on while they wait for their order.  2. You didn't bring the food out around the same time for everyone on the table.  3. You took almost 45 minutes to bring out 3 pasta dishes in a nearly empty restaurant.   If the food hadn't been as tasty, we were shocked considering the service deficiencies, you would have had 3 starts.

This was my first Wolfgang Restaurant, so I was super excited to experience everything it had to offer. Tony our waiter, was amazing, great positive attitude and Tony didn't skip a beat. He made our dinner very enjoyable, his energy is infectious and we loved the environment and food was perfect.   Cucina hit the spot and went above and beyond for us.

Italian food in a relaxed atmosphere,though very worn down furniture, at an expensive price point.  Take advantage of the great Yelp Check in option to score 20% off your check, now we are talking.  The pizza is thin crust and quite good.  Staff is friendly.

Hands down one of the best restaurants and service my husband and I have ever experienced! We sat at the bar for quicker service due to our cirque du soleil show that started shortly. The bartender and bar back were extremely efficient and friendly and did their job well. Not in Vegas often but will definitely visit the restaurant again when we do return.

Service was awesome!!!  For our party, we each did the prix fixe $35 dinner - EVERYTHING was lovely BUT the gnocchi. We all speculated that extra salt was accidentally knocked over into this dish as it made the dish inedible.
