Food was good (though not as good as i was expecting). Service was bellow average! During the whole dining experience the waiter only came to my table four or five times, those were to either bring food/drink or to take order.

We shared a bruschetta, a meat pasta, a pizza and a bottle of wine. The bruschetta was so good! The waiter was friendly and made sure to keep refilling our glasses. The restaurant is in the middle of a shopping plaza, but other than that it was a solid spot for dinner

I have a deep love for Wolfgang Puck's restaurants and this is the only one that strip that  I hadn't tried. Great service, from the hostess to our busser that I'm presuming was in training. He was doing a great job, but the manager was pulling him aside every once in awhile to clarify details. The food is always great, especially the pizzas, but I thought my salad was overdressed. Still it's never disappointing at any of his concepts. I'll see you again next time Wolfgang.
Great food excellent service. Nice views from seating area. Food is well worth the wait for them cooking it.

We stopped by for a quick bite before shopping. We walked in and was seated momentarily. We weren't expecting much from our meal here as it was more of a fast lunch for us. The food quality etc. here is a little better to what you would find at any California Pizza Factory. There was no "wow" factor to our meal, but it was still enjoyable.   Below is what we ordered for two adults:   Wood Fired Oven Pizza  Barbeque Chicken Pizza $16 (I no longer see this item on their menu) It was delicious!   Wood Fired Oven Pizza  Wild Mushroom, Bechamel, Fontina,Thyme, Arugula $14  This pizza was good too...great choice for vegetarians!   Caesar Salad Creamy Garlic Dressing, Parmesan Croutons, White Anchovies $12  Overall, The food was better than the service. The service was below average in my honest opinion. It wasn't busy when we went, yet we constantly had to flag down the server when we needed something because he never bothered  to check on us or refill our drinks etc. once the food was served. We would probably give them another chance as the food was good, and it's conveniently located in the Crystals.

We came here for a light dinner, and our group of four shared a pizza and an order of ravioli.  The bread (which was given to us about 15 minutes after we sat down) was good.  We ordered a pizza margherita, which was excellent.  We also ordered the veal ravioli, which two of us loved and two of us hated, so maybe it was just a personal taste issue.  I found it to be extremely over-seasoned (salt and pepper), and lacking in any other flavor.  I ordered an iced tea, which was extremely small at $4 a glass and no refills.    Overall, we had a good experience and would return if we were in the  area, but wouldn't make a special trip (i.e. leave a casino) to dine here.

While the service was delightful, the food was certainly sub-par with the exception of the refreshing bruschetta which was kissed with pesto to add some flare. The hubs ordered the pork chop while I had the eggplant parm. Both dishes had a heavy hand with salt, which nearly rendered the dishes inedible. If they had backed down on the salt, I think we would have had a pleasant meal. Notably, they had half off wine bottles when we went which sounded amazing. Sadly our Zin wasn't great, and the waiter brought it out in an ice bucket to keep it chilled. I've never seen red wine iced in my life...  While the location was convenient, we won't be coming back!

BEST FOOD I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE! I had the Gnocchi with a sausage bolognese sauce. Small-ish portion on that, but the other portions were great. My lady had the prosciutto pizza and we shared a tomato bruschetta appetizer. The cocktails were strong, the wine was tasty, and the service (Steven) was great. Best $77 I've spent in a long time.

The food is good, but I would put the price at $$$ and the ambience and service were a bit weak.  The Crystals shopping center is a strangely subdued place in general.  It doesn't even seem like it should be in Las Vegas because it is quiet and sterile looking.  Crystals has a great selection of high-end stores.  That being said, one gets the idea that nobody ever shops in them.  And as you look out over the mall from Cucina, you might catch yourself feeling a bit somber.  UPDATE: after re-reading my review, I have changed their rating to three stars.

Sat at the bar for St Paddy's Day to try their happy hour bar menu.  Had the wings, mushroom pizza and calamari and the requisite Guinnesses... Sounds typical like any Irish pub grub but with Wolfgang's restaurants, there's a refinement of "how can I do it better? The wings diavolo was infused with the right amount of spiciness and flavours rather than plain baked and bowl tossed sauce.  The mushroom pizza was great as well.  I believe (if I can remember the explanation from my last visit restaurant side) to be infused with honey.  My SO thought the calamari was fantastic as well(I'm not a squid) fan....

My friends and I were staying at the Aria (which by the way is the greatest hotel in Vegas), and decided to have a late lunch at this cute restaurant inside the Aria mall. The 3 of us decided to order bruschetta as appetizers and split two pizzas which were more than enough food for us. The bruschetta was delicious! The crostini perfectly toasted and the tomato and basil toppings were fresh and flavorful. The pizzas were delicious as well. We ordered the prosciutto and arugula pizza and the mushroom and carmelized onion. The prosciutto pizza was the best one. Thinly sliced, arugula, cheese, great combo. Considering its a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, we wouldnt have expected less of this place.

I'm so glad this place was inside the Aria because it made me fall in love and appreciate the architecture inside Aria just from sitting at the restaurant. The restaurant is simple yet classy. I love how they project old B&W films on the back wall near the bar, definitely different from anything I've seen at ANY pizzeria!  We started off with the Caesar salad and fried calamari. The calamari tasted surprisingly light, it was the best I've ever had. It also came with 3 different dipping sauces that varied from the Mild to Spicy type spectrum.  I ordered the lasagna and was not disappointed at all because it just felt so homemade and was well balanced in regard to cheese, herbs and meat. My boyfriend got the veal and mushroom ravioli and said he enjoyed it. Didn't end up getting dessert cause I was already stuffed and super satisfied.  I would definitely want to come back to try their other dishes! This was a perfect, random find.
Marginal at best. Egg plant was soggy. Ribeye was tough. Too hot in the restaurant. Highly recommend you go elsewhere.  Great waitress. Crappy, overpriced meal.

Came with 3 girlfriends and sat at a high-top table at the bar.  We shared an Arugula pizza, butter lettuce salad, Eggplant, and special Short Ribs.  The pizza was dry and disappointing but everything else was delicious.  Drinks were a bit expensive (martini $15) for a chain and the Short Rib portion was very small for $32 but overall the experience was very nice.
Food is good, pretty much anything you have is going to be tasty and the price is okay;

My friends and I were walking around Aria and found another Wolfgang Puck establishment in the middle of the City Center mall.   I've always been a fan of Wolfgang Pucks culinary style and dropped in for a quick lunch.   The hostess was extremely welcoming as she was able to handle a group of 12 with ease.   She seated us right outside the kitchen area w. the frosted glass and decided to order away.   We had the following dishes:  Crispy Calamari with Spicy Garlic Aioli:  4/5  the spicy garlic Aioli was delicious but portions were tiny.   One order only feeds two people at best.  Pizza Margherita: 1/5  the waitress warned us that these are appetizer portion...boy was she right, paper thin and definitely not worth getting.  Oysters:  4/5  they were fresh but where were they from?  gotta give me the locale, east, west? type? something.....  Main dish was Mussels w. Chirizo - 5/5  amazingly tasty.  Mussels were tender and that validates how fresh they were.  The chirizo gave it that little kick to enhance the flavor.  Ambiance: 5/5  great lunch spot  Service: 2.5/5  some of the dishes came out at odd times, they need to be in sync so they don't piss off the other half of the table.
The Rigatoncini, Piemontese Meat Sauce, Garlic, Parmesan Reggiano was absolutely delicious. The service was exceptional. My son's pizza was also very good.

a bit crunched on time, we ordered takeout to eat in our room from this restaurant.  everything was pretty smooth.  we ordered.  for larger orders. they take ccs.  we picked it up and it was delicious!    i thought everything we had was good!  we had salad.  the caesar was yummy.  proscuitto pizza was aweseom!  lasgna awesome!    as expected, takeout wasnt piping hot but oh well

I was really happy with everything about this place, except the serving size. The 20% off yelp coupon was really nice. Our server Vance was super sweet and very knowledgeable about everything on the menu, and he was really patient with us when we asked him to describe everything and we took forever to decide too. He also brought me yummy donut holes with dipping sauces for my birthday free of charge :)   My only complaint is that the serving size is tiny for what they charge you. My torchio pasta plate was tiny and $22... it was delicious but barely any pasta on the plate :(
Actually quite impressed with this place!  The decor is very chic, but comfortable, the service was spot on - excellent drink and food recommendations, and the food was quite good too!
Limited pizza menu to be Italian. Poor service, i only irdered water and dound my glass empty more than a few times, waiting for a refill. Beautiful bathroom, but dirty as a pigsty!

Came by because we were so hungry, just a group of young adults with a bunch of Fat Tuesday's.   I thought it might be a little inappropriate or weird considering it was a sit down place & we had like 6 fat Tuesday's on the table, but the hostesses were incredibly nice & so was our waitress.   We tipped them well :) I hate when places judge you based on your age & they definitely didn't do that.  Anyways we had the following, and everything was good & consistent:  Prosciutto San Daniele, Burrata Mozzarella, Cracked Black Pepper, Aged Balsamic (4 stars)= This was really good with the aged balsamic, needed something else though, maybe tomatoes or a pesto to balance out the dish, or just more balsamic :)  Margherita, Mozzarella, San Marzano Tomato, Basil (4 stars)= Really good flavor with the San Marzano tomatoes, those are my favorite!  Spicy Pepperoni, Calabrian Chili, Fresh Ricotta (4 stars)= Different and yummy, spicy pepperoni with the ricotta worked really well together!  Roasted Eggplant, Garlic Spinach, Fresh Mozzarella (4 stars)= Normally don't like eggplant, but this wasn't bad, the flavor was good!  I would come back if I was in the area for some yummy Pizza!

Neither of us were surprised that we walked away from our dinner here fully impressed by the food and the service. It's a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, after all, so right or wrong, you expect a bit more from one of his establishments. Or maybe that's just us.   At any rate, we walked over to this restaurant pretty soon after we pulled in to Vegas. It was a long drive from home, and though we were both tired, our need for sustenance trumped our need for sleep. We did a quick search of restaurants in the area (the map we had open looked like it had a bad case of measles, so many red dots appeared), and narrowed our choices down to two places.   On our way to Wolfgang's place, we passed the other restaurant we had been contemplating, but neither of us got the warm and fuzzies from it, so we kept on.   We didn't realize that the restaurant was located in what I can only compare to as the high-end shopping malls back home. Lots of glitter. Lots of bling. Lots of shops I can't afford. It was strange, but hey, it's Vegas!   Anyway, we were seated right away, and our waiter - friendly, knowledgeable, opinionated without being pushy - gave us time to settle in, browse the drink and food menus, and decide on our entree choices.   Truly, I wanted the grilled sea bass, but couldn't justify spending $32 on that dish alone. Normally I don't balk at food prices, especially when I'm on any kind of a vacation, but I couldn't get past it. So, I went with the Pappardelle, instead. Brilliant choice, as it turned out.   The pasta was fantastic! I had to force myself to slow down and eat like a lady, because otherwise I could have just tilted my head back and dumped the entire contents of the plate down my gullet in one shot.   The meat sauce was incredible. I've had some pretty tasty meat sauces in my life, but this one was by far my favorite. Tender chunks of meat married perfectly with the slight acidity of the tomatoes, which perfectly paired with the pasta and the cheese. Oh, yeah. It makes my mouth water just remembering it!   My husband ordered the linguine pasta, and he enjoyed that immensely. They loaded him up on shellfish, and he kept commenting on the flavor of the sauce and how tender the noodles were. At least, I think that's what he was saying. It was hard to listen to him over all the yummy noises I was making in my head, while consuming my own dinner.   And while the plates didn't look overloaded when they were set down in front of us, they certainly filled us up right.   Had we been in Vegas longer than the weekend, we absolutely would have gone back. Service and food quality will always bring us back. Serving bread with the meal would have been a slam-dunk, though.

Happy, Happy, Happy. I'm hoping every visit here will be as good as our visit today. We ordered, for our appetizer, the Salumi & Cheese board; for our meal, the Chicken Piccata & Broccolini; a side of Meatballs; the Margarita Pizza; & a fabulous dark beer ( Left Hand Stout). Our waiter Tony made our dining experience exemplary, as did supporting staff. The view of City Center shop was nice too. Price averages out to around $50 a person for dinner. We'll be back. :)

We had wanted a light lunch (the first morning after, ugh, rough..) and this was the perfect place for it. This Wolfgang Puck location sits on the second floor of City Center, kitty corner from Brunello Cucinelli for location reference. Clean modern open decor with a lot of light. Comfortable seating.  We were seated right away. Our server was very friendly and attentive. She introduced us to a few menu highlights and checked on us throughout the meal. I went with the butter lettuce salad topped with delicious Gorgonzola cheese, hazelnut, bacon and egg. Decided to add some grill chicken for protein (aka, coat the stomach for more drinking. Hey when in Vegas...). It was exactly what I wanted. Light, but tasty and fulfilling. The Hazelnut added a wonderful flavor to to the dish. Also on the table were the Endive salad, Chicken Piccata and steamed clams Linguine; all very well done according to everyone.   I highly recommend WP Pizzeria & Cucina for a light lunch or easy dining. Prices were very fair (compare to other established Vegas restaurants). I wouldn't say it's a culinary experience, but the food is well-done and the atmosphere and service were top notch.

Great pizza in a lovely and quiet place away from the crazy strip. If you're on your own, absolutely perfect to sit by the bar and all the staff will make sure you're not sat in silence for an hour or so. Great place.

The food here is excellent!  We had the Baby Kale Salad and 2 pizzas.  The salad was so delicious that I am trying to recreate it at home.  We ordered a plain margarita pizza then added our own toppings, my side was without cheese. It was consumed so quickly and seeing we had a long drive back to PHX, we ordered the same exact pizza again!  Its safe to say we were full.  The location is inside the Crystals Mall, which is a beautiful indoor high end mall.

They treat you like family at Cucina.  Absolutely a highly memorable night when we were served by Tony.  The setting is in a mall steps away from the Aria .  Fare is mid scale Modern Italian by perennial celebrity chef Wolfgang Puck.  Single page menu with pasta, pizza, and meat dishes.  I had the halibut and it was a small fish alive e over a bed of asparagus.

While we enjoyed the food very much (had a pizza and the porchetta sandwich), the staff made this a 3 star versus 5 star experience.  We went for lunch and the restaurant opened after posted hours(frustrating when you are on a schedule).  Also, the staff was much more interested in watching soccer on TV than getting/refilling drinks and taking our order.  Just not the service we expected.

The restaurant is inside the Crystal in great setting. However we were disappointed that one of the dishes that we ordered was badly overcooked. The pork was like rubber and hard to chew. The waitress took the dish back to the kitchen. Although we indicated that we probably wouldn't want to try the dish anymore, we were kind of surprised that there wasn't a single word from the kitchen or chef on the dish. Guess the chef must have thought that he cooked that way on purpose. When the check came, everything was charged although we did return 1/2 of the more expensive dish due to the poor execution of the dish. Just showed that they didn't care! Will never go to that restaurant again.

Can't really go wrong on Vegas strip for good food and Cucina by Wolfgang Puck is a good spot to go! Located in the Aria area, this restaurant is the Italian spot, not to get confused with the one in MGM, which is more American food. We called in ahead of time because we had a lot of people bug to be honest, it wasn't that packed when we got there anyways. Full disclosure, probably because of the prices. However, the service is very good here and very proficient. Although it not a huge restaurant, they can accommodate both couples to large parties. Food menu is simple and the quality is superb. Portions are on the smaller side but maybe that is for the best because of how delicious it all is! Definitely a place you could eat, chat and loose track of time. I have nothing bad to say about this place. Overall, any Wolfgang Puck is a good spot to eat and Cucina is a great place to do it, whether it be an intimate diner or a big party. Definitely recommend checking out!

Had a great experience overall! We had tickets for the 9:30 showing of Zarkana at Aria and we arrived at Cucina a little before 8:30. We mentioned that we were running late and that we had tickets to the show and they were very accommodating. Our food was brought out in less than 20 minutes (we ordered pasta and no appetizer) and it was delicious. Not the best Spaghetti Pomodoro I've ever had, but it was certainly fulfilling.  I was very surprised to see how empty it was at 8:30 on a Friday night, but then again, it was inside a shopping center, so it was a quiet escape from busy Las Vegas.
Soup was bland, cheese ravioli was tasty. We had to request bread, but it wasn't served like the pictures on yelp. The pizzas have creative ingre, but not all that tasty.

I had never tried a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, and I always try to have at least one nice meal while I'm in Vegas, so this seemed to fit the mold nicely. It was a nice experience, and although I'm not sure I would rush back, it is not because of the experience, but just based on the fact that there are so many other restaurants in the genre to try in Vegas.   I have to say, the one thing that absolutely made the experience was our waiter. The guy was good. from the very beginning to the very end, he was an absolute professional, and very good at what he did. His energy and enthusiasm did not wane, and he always made me feel as if I was his only table. That is the mark of a good waiter. He was also incredibly attentive and knowledgeable about his product.   The restaurant itself, depending on your perspective, is in a nice and accessible location. It is right in a mall between the Cosmo and Aria/Vdara. It is an upscale mall, and the atmosphere is very relaxing and low key. It is an open design restaurant on the second floor, and overlooks the mall, so there is plenty to look at, but the second floor location keeps it quiet and private. Overall, it is a nice spot as long as you're not disappointed that it's not right on the main strip or its own building.   The food itself was good. I have the woodfired sausage and cheese pizza, and I thought it was wonderful. My girlfriend had the egg plant Parmesan, and she thought it was good, although it wasn't the best she's had. The appetizer was a cheese and cold cut plate, and I thought that was one of the best parts! The prices were somewhat expensive, but I expected that being Las Vegas and a Wolfgang Puck restaurant. You have to pay if you want to play.   Overall, this was a nice restaurant, although I'm not sure I would rush back there on the next trip. I would, however, try one of his other restaurants!

This is an extremely pleasant place to dine in Las Vegas. Situated in the beautiful high end mall Crystal, you are away from the noisy machines and surrounded by lovely white decor.  We stopped in for an early dinner,  just on a whim as passing by.  We sat at the bar and were waited on by a wonderful, friendly bartender - Shawn.  We started out with a charcuterie for one (don't believe - definitely sharable)  $12 - what a deal!  We then ordered two misa salads with four meatballs and a small side of spaghetti . ALL were fantastic. Best meatballs I've ever had.  Of course accompanied with Chianti. Finished off with cappuccino which came with a delightful chocolate candy.  Stop by this place , you will not be disappointed! What a delight!
Loved the food and service. We had the kids with us and were worried whether they had a kids menu and if they kids would eat well but to our surprise kids had a great time.

This is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas.  I've been here several times and the service has always been good and the food excellent.  This time I was a little disappointed, which is why the 4 stars instead of 5.  The host was not friendly at all.  The server was very friendly and helpful at first.  Then he said, "If you need me I'll be around. I don't want you to wait for anything."  I got a bad feeling and sure enough, he disappeared and I had to ask a busboy to find him twice.  Anyway, the food was excellent.  They wine list is excellent and has one of my all time favorites by the glass.  Seghesio Zinfandel.  I will be back next time I'm in town.

It was my last meal in Las Vegas before I had to catch a flight and I'm so happy I stopped by Cucina. Service was great - my water glass was never empty. I ordered the rigatoni, a friend ordered the salmon, and another friend ordered the NY strip steak. We were all satisfied with our dish. My pasta dish definitely hit the spot and the pasta was cooked perfectly. The bolognese sauce wasn't too salty or underseasoned. It was perfect for me.   My friend who ordered her salmon cooked medium really enjoyed it and said it wasn't too dry or over/under seasoned. My other friend ordered the NY strip steak rare and enjoyed it. We were all very pleased with what we ordered and what was really nice is that the portions are perfect. It wasn't too small or too big - just enough to feel satiated. I will definitely come back again when I'm in Las Vegas!

This Puck's is in Crystals at City Center, a retail/entertainment mall. I had low expectations, but it turned out to be a good meal with equally descent wine/beer selection. Service was attentive. An upscale mall dining experience. I'd go again. Reservations accepted on OpenTable.

Loved the food and service here.  Can't remember the waiter who served me, but he was very receptive and aware (if my water was low) and was not intrusive but not non-existent either.  Pizza was delicious!  Crust was perfect- chewy but crispy and thin. The rigatoni and parpadelle was also very good.  A quaint place and they have a nice little bar inside the restaurant as well.  Would definitely return!

I was surprised that I liked this place as it was not my first choice but I was pleasantly surprised at the good service and great food.   The raviolis were out of this world and left me begging for a second plate of them.  I was a good boy and did not order more.  Great cocktails.  Cool view of mall from above and fun to people watch.

We sat at the bar for the all day happy hour menu! We had the margherita pizza, meatballs and sausage with peppers. The crust on the pizza was really good, the meatballs were good, but didn't wow me, but the sausage and peppers was better than I could have expected (I am not a sausage fan). I really liked it and so did my husband. The bartendar was very knowledgabel and friendly. We had a great time sitting at the bar and having some bar snacks oh and a glas of wine. We would return.
Service was great at first, then later inattentive.   Food was full of amazing flavors and pretty sizable portions.

This review is really a 4 1/2 star rating but the ambiance really pushed it up to a perfect rating.  My honeybabe and I came here for dinner on a late Sunday night. Despite this restaurant being at the ever-so-prestigious Crystals Shopping Center, prices for our drinks and entrees were not as expensive as we thought.  Honeybabe started off with a delicious soup that had chicken, vegetables and chickpeas in it. Very flavorful! For our entrees, I got Rigatoncini with Piemontese Meat Sauce, Garlic and Parmesan Reggiano. He ordered Veal Raviolis with Porcini Mushrooms, Brown Butter Sauce and Crisp Sage. We both LOVED our entrees!!!!!! Everything was cooked to our liking and service was attentive throughout the night.  One thing is for sure; this restaurant have perfect portion control. I'm an extremely small eater. Half of an appetizer and I'm practically full already. That's how easy it is for me lol. But that night, I was able to finish my pasta. Every bite. Done. AND....best part was, I wasn't overly full....I didn't feel fat and bloated.   We definitely enjoyed our food and can't wait to be back. Next time....we want to try their wood fried oven pizzas. I got my eye on that spicy pepperoni pizza. Yumm!!!!!!

Hands down, the best meal (and service) we received all week in Vegas. Definitely a great value for the quality of the food and will absolutely recommended everyone I know that's visiting Vegas to come here.

Just felt like a chain with good food but nothing special or memorable about it. I had the sea bass it was well prepared and crispy. The restaurant is mostly good pizza and pasta with nice decor but wouldn't go out of my way to have it unfortunately!

Lovely atmosphere and clean. Staff was attentive and friendly, always there to top off a glass or take an empty plate, but never seeming to hover.   Our group split three salads and three pizzas (my favorites being the bet salad and wild mushroom pizza), and they split every salad beautifully so that each player looked like it was a full salad. Lunch for six plus a bottle of wine was around $110, pretty amazing for Vegas. I've never tried Wolfgang's pizzeria before definitely will for a satisfying, delicious meal with menu choices to please everyone in your party.
The food was AMAZING! Phenomenal lobster special. Allison and Tony took great care of us! Would love to go back!
Tony is one of the best servers I've ever had. Very attentive and full of energy. He had great recommendations on food and drinks! Definitely will be back!

So many choices in Vegas. Nice location inside the mall. The Bolognese Rigatoni was served incredibly hot and fresh. High quality Italian food moderately priced for Vegas. Get 20% off your order when you check in with YELP!

Every time I'm in Vegas, I definitely try to come to Wolfgang Puck! Their linguine with clam is soooo good. One of my favorites! On my last visit, my friend ordered the veal ravioli and omg that was so good too! I must get that next time I come. I had another friend who ordered the rigatoncini and that was delicious and flavorful as well. YUM

I'm honestly perplexed as to why this place has 4 stars.  We came on a Sunday night at 730; the place was half empty which apparently means you get half the service and quality of food: -Waited 10 mins to get greeted and seated (had a reservation) -Wine and water glasses smelled like dirty dish soap -Noticed another table had bread, had to ask FOUR times before it was finally brought out - after our entrees arrived  -Both pastas - ravioli and carbonara - were basic and just barely edible -We saw our waitress maybe twice the entire meal I'd expect this quality of food/service at Olive Garden, but not for these prices or with this name attached. There are plenty of other great Vegas restaurants - try one of those.
Fun place, great food, drink menu, and dessert! The atmosphere is open and fun! The waiter was very polite and the manager helped us out as well! Overall a good experience for us!
The food was so fresh and the pizza was divine! We would constantly stop by this section of the Aria (where we stayed for the week) to grab a bite to eat! So convenient and quick!

Food was good but the service was horrible. We were seated at a private table behind a wall divider... I think they forgot about us.. Took 15-20 minutes to receive our drink order. We even made a comment to the manager but no change. Overall food was good though! Great meatballs and anti pasta salad! We split a pasta but I don't recall which one. I think we may have come on an off night based on the other good reviews.

Not sure what all the complaints about service here are about. We came in for dinner at 7:30 on a Friday night and the wait staff was VERY friendly and helpful. It was almost over the top (but not), they were checking on is so much. We both had the chicken parm, which isn't actually on the menu but had read about it in a review. It was excellent. All around great experience
Food was not what I would expect from Wolfgang Puck.  There are too many options in Vegas, especially at this price.  Some tasty food and some not so much.

My husband and I just returned from our Wedding weekend at the Aria and this was my favorite meal. It wasn't the fanciest ( we had dinner at Jean George and Social House), but it was the best.  We ate a late lunch on Sunday afternoon. I wish that I could remember our servers name, because she deserves special recognition. She was super friendly and welcoming, quick with gray recommendations and always checking on us to make sure that we were happy. She was great!  We each had a pizza. I customized a basic pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms and olives. It was fantastic! I ate every bite.   We saw a foursquare tip to order White Sangria. We had a pitcher and it was amazing. Even if you don't plan on eating here, go to the bar and have the Sangria, trust me.   My husband ordered the cookie selection for dessert and loved them so much, that we bought more to take home to California. They were the best ginger snaps that he had ever eaten.  Our server even gave me an extra glass of iced tea in a to-go cup.  Great service, great food and nice vibe. I look forward to dining here again!

Wolfgang Puck just might be my favorite chef of all time, or at least top 3 for sure.  Thankfully a city like Vegas has many of his restaurants.  Most palates nowadays are numbed down by basic ingredients that only appeal to fatty flavors.  Nothing wrong with that but it takes a true chef to bring together flavors and sauces to make a mouth of happy.  Enter Wolfgang.  This restaurant has only been open for around 2 years.  It is a great option to still have some of Wolfgang Puck's meals without the super expensive price tag.  The meats are fresh and flavorful as are the pasta's.  His Cesar salad is made with blue cheese and was one of my favorites.  You can get a pitcher of sangria for around $20.

This place is absolutely amazing,  we had the aged filet mignon with broccoli rabe with the silk potatoes caesar salad with fresh anchovies and a fresh crab cake patty. This meal was probably the best I've ever had, the bill was a little over 200 but worth every penny I really hate that I didn't take any pics but the lights were very dim and the service was great. We even enjoyed the  Parmesan crostini and the different breads they offered before our meal witch was brought out in courses. This place is a must try oh yeah we were at The Venetian Hotel Casino not MGM
Amazing food!! Everything from the octopus salad to the pizza and eggplant parm were out of this world! Great prices. Great music. Great service!! A must go!!

We came here for dinner the evening of my birthday, because of it's close proximity to Aria, and gorgeous location inside Crystals.   We started with drinks. My BFF got the agave julep which was fresh and tasty, but very sweet. I got the Drunken Pumpkin which was delicious, very flavorful, and not overly sweet. My BF and his BFF ordered a pitcher of beer. After about 10 minutes of the girls having their drinks and the guys waiting, a half pitcher came out because they ran out. They ordered another type of beer, and waited another fifteen minutes for that to come out.   For appetizers, my fatty BFF got the soup appetizer, which was good, but not $12 good. My BF and I shared the insalada mista ($9) with cherry tomatoes and shaved Parmesan, which was good but not extraordinary. They split it for us though, which was nice. The complimentary breads, especially the sourdough, were remarkable. I am a huge sourdough fan, and they sure did it right! It was fluffy and flavorful, and I would have been happy just eating that all night. :)   Our group loves food, so we all at least try, if not share, each others' meal. Our orders, orderers, and ratings:  - Eggplant Parmesan (BFF) (*****)  - Mushroom Pizza (BF's BFF) (****)  - Italian Meat Pizza (BF) (***)  - Swordfish Entree (Bday girl) (**)   My favorites dishes were the eggplant Parmesan and the mushroom pizza. The eggplant was lightly battered and fried, almost tempura-like, and not covered in sauce, but accented with sauce. There was such delicious flavor from the vegetable! The mushroom pizza was really flavorful, and the mushrooms went really well with the combo of sauces and cheese.   The other dishes, the Italian meat pizza and swordfish, were less impressive. Salami sounded good on pizza... turns out it's kind of a weird combination. They were also stingy with the sweet peppers which seemed to be the main source of flavor. I may just stick to pepperonis on my pizza next time. I would advise against the swordfish entree because it was somewhat fishy and a very small portion for $34.   The restaurant shared a complimentary dessert for my birthday, and I chose the tiramisu. It was light and tasty, and had little malt balls mixed in, which was unusual for tiramisu. I, of course, shared it with my best friends and they enjoyed it as well.   Service was good. Not our main waiter, but the back-up waiter (or whatever that title would be) was very helpful, efficient, and attentive. The regular waiter was not bad, but not wonderful.   I would come back here because the ambiance is very unique, the decor is beautiful, and the food was good. It was pricey, but we had a nice dinner together making it worth every penny!

This place drives me crazy. They disguise their 7 for 7 happy hour as a deal, but in reality it's a huge rip off. If they displayed their 7 "deals" and people had the option to see what they were ordering prior to putting it in, I can't imagine anyone in their right mind would choose anything from the menu. Their portions are beyond tiny, they are micro. A $40 bill and left still hungry. Save your money and the frustration. The quality of food is above average, but I need more than a spoon full.

Another boring celebrity chef in an overpriced Vegas restaurant.  I had lunch here with a large group.  The service was okay, not spectacular.  I had the porchetta panini with fries.  It was good, just not great.  And the fries were NOT homemade, really, Woflgang?  You can't invest in some tools to make real fries?
Tony was duh-best. All his suggestions were EXCELLENT from the main course to desert.

A really great eating experience.  I had ate in other of his restaurants and wasnt expecting the meal that I received.  One of the best Cesar Salads I have every had, dressed perfectly, crispy salad and yummy anchovies.   I also had a great mushroom pizza which was spot on.  Really great food for a reasonable price!!

First time here. Came with our bride before heading out to the club. Our bride to be was served an treated the best! Shout out to our server Apollo and his helper Adrian. Very tentative to meet in our needs. We were in a hurry so Apollo hooked it up in the kitchen and expedited our order. The margahretti pizza was delicious and we shared a cesar salad which they split in to two for us. The ladies enjoyed the service the atmosphere and attention we got. Will def return on a next visit.
Great food, great service. We had the prosciutto pizza, bolognese pasta, bruschetta, and tiramisu. Nothing disappointed. Would definitely recommend.

This place is definitly a semi-hidden Vegas gem. Easy to get in to with a cool vibe and great food. Our group had several of the pizzas and pasta dishes. Everyone shared and in the end we had a hard time agreeing on which was best. I also love that they take on line reservations. A big plus in a busy market like Vegas.

I stopped by here for lunch this past Friday afternoon with three other dining companions.  After a long night out we were looking for some pizza and this place hit the spot.  While I personally did not order a drink, two of my companions ordered the bloody Mary which one said was the best that he had ever had.  For my entree I decided upon the spicy pepperoni pizza.  I was also lucky enough to try both the Italian and the eggplant pizzas.  All were good but I really loved the combination of ricotta, pepperoni and spicy peppers that were on the spicy pepperoni.   The bottom line for me is that I would definitely head back here in the future.  All of the pizzas were tasty but be prepared to pay over $15 for a 9 inch pie.
Many Italian restaurants in New York, we went to. This Vegas one and we were delighted. Try it and enjoy.. Jay

In the mall upstairs overlooking Starbucks. This Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina is located inside the Crystals shopping center on the 2nd floor. The food is OK. You have so many better options in Vegas. They offer signature pizzas, sandwiches & other light fare. The menu has changed and now it's no better then your average papa murphy pizza at a $$$$$ price.  Wolfgang Puck is a ripoff!

Stumbled upon this place as I was looking for a bite to eat, desiring something quick that's not a burger.  Hopped up to the bar and enjoyed a mushroom pizza with braised leeks, fontina, and teleggio. Super tasty! At $16, it was plenty for me and my SO.  They also have a great happy hour menu with drinks for $4 and appetizers under $10. Highly recommend.

Along with Firefly, this is another of my favorite places for the business traveler looking for a comfortable place to dine alone.  I've gone in a few times for salads, appetizers, pizza, and cocktails from the $7 happy hour menu.  Everything I've tried so far has been great.   The ice cream assortment was great - fresh mango, pear, and other yummy  flavors - but the vanilla is absolutely to die for.  The servers and bartenders are knowledgeable and really friendly.  Nice ambiance, even the bathroom is beautiful.   I'll be going back.  update 1/5/11 - Went back for a business meal.  Was fabulous.  I had the swordfish, my colleague had gnocchi.  Will W. is an outstanding server, very professional, and I got more of that vanilla gelato.  Yummy!
Excellente cuisine italienne. Saveurs au rendez-vous. Pas de sucres ajouté. Pâtes et pizze comme à la maison. Pinot noir maison excellent. Ravis!

So I tried two entrees here during the three trips, since my friends are fans of this particular WP joint.   The Margherita pizza during dinner time was tasty, but didn't have anything differentiating about itself compared to Spinatos or Zachary's...it wasn't as "good" or "original" compared to those two. The cheese and the grease gave me a slight stomach ache.   The butter lettuce with the Gorgonzola cheese and bacon was phenomenal, however!   For lunch, the starters: Steamed Mussels and the bruschetta are worth a try. Those steamed mussels are pretty tasty; almost comes close to the italians seafood I've enjoyed in Boston.

the pizza is just ok. service is a bit slow.  service was weird everyone helps everybody - so you dont get a dedicated server they are all just running around trying to do everything which ends up being nothing.

Great location, excellent service! Reasonably priced, too! The linguine pasta and the prosciutto pizza were a little bit salty, and the spicy pepperoni pizza lacked a bit of spice. Still a great meal though!
We brought our 3 year old daughter and 1 year old son with us and our server Tony was great with them!  Great food also.  We would come back

We finally made it to a Puck branded restaurant and, overall, this was a very good and enjoyable meal.  We started with a Caprese "salad" which had a nice array of different tomatoes, but it was woefully lacking in fresh basil. It also included a decent portion of cheese, but they don't use fresh mozarella. I'm not clear what it was, but if definitely was NOT mozarella.  My wife ordered the Veal Scallopini which was very good. The melted mozarella over the veal was a nice touch. But it was just the entree, with a decent portion of mushrooms topping it. A bit of polenta, or perhaps steamed broccoli would have seemed fitting for the price.  I was lured into trying an off menu special consisting of a 12oz boneless ribeye with sauteed brussels sprouts and pearl onions. It was a VERY good meal. The steak was precisely medium rare, as ordered, and the flavor and texture was spot on.  Only few small knocks...   First, they should clarify and then be consistent with "Sunday Supper" being available for parties of four or more. The menu says no such thing. We learned upon by inquiring and didn't press the issue. A couple who arrived a few minutes later, and was seated across from us made the same inquiry and received the same response. However, seconds later the waiter (same as ours) said "let me see what I can do". A few moments later he emerged from the kitchen with news that since the kitchen was super busy they would go ahead and serve them the "Sunday Supper". WTH??? You made no such offer or effort for us Dave.  Second, its offseason in Las Vegas at the moment, but their website STRONGLY suggests reservations be made at least 48 hours in advance. We had no difficulty getting a same day reservation and the place wasn't even close to packed. It barely qualified as busy.  Finally, this is not really a knock against Cucina as it is against The Shops at Crystals. We're not wealthy, nor are we dirt poor. We're just plain, solid, working class souls. We dress, carry and conduct ourselves very well. Yet we were repeatedly snubbed and refused service or attention at all but one of the stores where we stopped to admire their wares. The shops are all super high end, and clearly intended for the upper class elite - but that doesn't excuse snubbing us. We felt just like Julia Robert's character in Pretty Woman. We were judged without knowing us. And, truth be told, we could have easily dropped many thousands of dollars in one or more shops that night - had we been welcome.

actual rating review: 3.5 Stars  I been going to Las Vegas for a long time. The entire time I have wanted Spago to be my first Wolfgang Puck eatery experience. But due to time constraints during my recent trip, we settled on Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina, located inside the Crystal Shops.  My friends and I ate here over Super Bowl weekend for lunch. We were quite surprised that there was no wait to be seated. We were promptly seated and introduced to our waiter. We ordered the following:  (2) orders of the Rigatoncini Piemontese Meat sauce, Garlic & Parmesan Reggiano.     The piemontese meat sauce (italian beef cut) was a nice change from the usual rigatoni w/ meat sauce I have had in years past. I thought the portion size was a little small considering its price point and there was no main protein present. This dish was decent, but not mindblowing; it lacked a gamechanging flavor punch.  (1) order of the Spaghetti, tomatoes, basil, garlic with house made meatballs. homemade meatballs? COUNT ME IN. These meatballs are the best meatballs I have ever had. Spaghetti cooked al dente. Now this is a dish I would come to WPP& C for!  Service was excellent and the food was yummy. Get the spaghetti meatballs, forego the Rigatoncini Piemontese.

Overpriced but what isn't in Las Vegas?  The restaurant is clean, elegant, quiet, and a bit secluded from the hustle and bustle of the strip despite being on it.    we went for a light lunch and had the margarita pizza. I love a good margarita pie and I enjoyed it but for my husband, it was just cheese pizza.

Food is decent and well-priced. I think they are understaffed since we have had an absentee waitperson for the last 45 minutes once they got busy. Cocktails are good and the pasta was delicious. Pizza is fine - not the best and not the worst. We'd probably come again, but might sit at the bar itself to get more attentive service.

Really great experience here, my husband and I both really enjoyed it! Great service and a fun ambience in the crystals shopping centre. The food for me was almost five stars - the only reason why I didn't give this review five stars was that I really didn't like the antipasto salad that came out with our mains - that was a really disappointment. The bruschetta was amazing, beautiful pesto & balsamic flavours - just stunning! I ordered the veal ravioli and it was beautiful - the sauce was amazing with the mushrooms, it was a great order. My husband had the ox tail Ragu - also really yummy. We had a great night and a very positive experience here - definitely try it out!!

I usually don't write a review of a restaurant "chain" but I'm going to make an exception for this Puck location. The pizza crust here is probably the best I have ever tasted. It's a very thin crust made from a sourdough base. Outstanding! My partner and I also sampled two different salads during lunch and loved both of them. The service was top notch and prices aren't that bad for a "Strip" location. It is located on the 2nd level Crystals. They offer an all day happy hour that features some drink and app specials. The restroom setup is a bit unorthodox.

I would trade my first child for some good polenta and here my first child would have to be given up to Wolfgang Puck. We came here on our last trip to Las Vegas and were very pleased. Probably one of of the least expensive places to dine in Crystals (which still will set you back $25-$30 a plate) and it also has a nice view to people watch while you dine. We made reservations before going and were quickly seated. The server was friendly but forgettable. I didn't partake in any spirits but my iced tea was very good. Everything on the menu looked splendid but I ended up settling on the Veal Scallopini, Mushrooms, Artichokes, and Parmesan. Since this dish had very little carbohydrates and my fat stores needed further fuel I decided to order their creamy polenta with Parmesan reggiano. Yum Yum. The veal was very good but not the best I have ever had. Cooked perfectly though. I had to steal some bites from my fellow diners and the sea bass and lamb were some of the best I have ever tasted. No room for dessert. Probably one of the better meals I had in Las Vegas but not quite enough for that coveted 5 stars. If you can't afford anything in Crystals you can at least eat here and pretend you are rich.

I'll start by saying that I've dined at my fair share of restaurants, some high end and also bar fare included. Cucina far exceeded my expectations in every way. The staff were all friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome. When it came to the menu prices were typical being a more upscale place and the location along the strip. The food itself was phenomenal and some of the best I've ever had. I ordered the ravioli and it was so delicate and delicious. The meatballs were also prefect and mouth watering with an amazing sauce, so good my friend wished she had ordered them herself.  Just thinking about it now makes me wish I could go back right now!

This place was disappointing. The Service was excellent, but my pasta was extremely salty and I couldn't help thinking that although the others in my group enjoyed their meals,it wasn't good enough for the prices. They did give a complimentary dessert to apologize for the salty dish which i appreciated. Probably wont go back though..

Just call it Wolfgang Suck.  We stopped here for dinner before the Zarkana show. We shared the bruschetta appetizer, the fiancé had the chicken piccata, I had the margherita pizza. I wish I had taken a picture of the pizza!!! It was a greasy cheese pizza with 3 slivers of basil on top. A boring greasy mess. The fiancé liked the piccata but found himself on the toilet within the hour. Ack!!  We drank water and ice tea. With the bill totaling nearly $70 I am super disappointed.
This was so good!! I was here on a Sunday evening, so it was pretty quiet. The staff here is very friendly,and the food was just superb. So glad Wolfgang Puck opened another restaurant here!

The Jidori Brick Chicken sounded really good but it came out dry. The chicken didn't seem freshly made and the skin on top was like a sheet of rubber. I've cooked chicken and froze and reheated chicken before and it never comes out this dry. How do you make a leg of all things dry? My waiter did check on us and I informed him about the chicken being dry but that was that. I do have to say the mushrooms and corn under the chicken were outstanding, I did enjoy them. The potatoes tasted like box potatoes but might have been fresh?  My husband had the veal osso bucco and he said the veal was dry and disappointing but the gnocchi were good and light.  I don't know if they were having a bad day or if they are like this all the time. My husband was here before and thought the wild boar ragout was really good here before but the waiter talked him into trying the osso bucco that was dry.  Wolfgang needs to spend less time on the shopping channel and more time in his restaurants.

Cucina was our first dinner when getting to Las Vegas and we couldn't be more pleased with our choice!! We were pleasantly greeted by Tony, our server, who provided not only a delicious meal, but entertainment as well! He answered all of our questions and made our night very special - we were celebrating a bachelorette.  I had the New York strip, which was AMAZING. Others tried the pappardelle (Tony's favorite) and the sea bass.  All excellent choices!! Don't forget about the garlic bread. Agh the garlic bread. And the zeppoles. Will definitely be back!!!

Went there for lunch, decided to sit at the bar and watch games.   Our server/ bartender was very friendly, introduced us happy hour menu, regular menu, and drink menu, said the happy hour menu was good, small but very good. the regular menu and specialty cocktail menu looked very nice too.   I ordered braised baby artichoke, white sangria and passion fruit Cosmo from happy hour menu, and Steamed Mussels, Chorizo, Marjoram, Grilled Ciabatta from regular menu, bf ordered soup of the day and Linguine, Steamed Clams, White Wine-Garlic Sauce, they offer complimentary bread too.   I liked my food a lot, they were very delicious and flavored, the sausages in my steamed mussels are particularly good,  just one problem, they were very very salty! Glad we were a little hangover, so we could finish the extremely salty dishes there.   I wouldn't go there for dinner, just a casual lunch after a little bit too much drinking the previous night. the portions are so big, even good for sharing. the price is not cheap, our tab was around $78. A little more for a casual lunch , but its Vegas and its at Crystals. SO... :P

Certainly one of my favorite restaurants on the strip! (And it won't break the bank!)  The service was awesome. I'm not sure of my server's name but he was a nice guy who was very attentive and really kind. I was surprised not to see him blow up after trying to handle a major language barrier while trying to take a drink order. I would've lost it and gave up, but he was nice enough to work with the party next to our table.  I came in with my girl and her sister to enjoy a nice dinner so we stopped here because Wolfgang's restaurants are always consistent. We started with the bruschetta, fried rice balls, and calamari. They were all amazing. Calamari was perfect and tasted fantastic. The pesto bruschetta was one of the best I've ever had and the fried rice balls were out of control delicious. Outstanding flavor in such a small ball.    We also ordered a mushroom pizza, just because i was so eager to try it. It was amazing. Great mushrooms and the pizza was done perfectly! We each had a slice and took the rest home. Moving further, I ordered the beef lasagne, my girl ordered the SeaBass (substituted for something different) and our third ordered the Veal lasagna. All were great, although my girlfriend was little disappointed that the menu description didn't include olives or the tomato sauce that was under the description of her entree. She's not a fan of either. She said the fish was just OK. But was pretty much already stuffed from the appetizers.  Shockingly, we found room for dessert and ordered the fresh Strawberry cake thing? and the tiramisu. I'm not a fan of fruit in my desserts but I was told it was delicious and the tiramisu was amazing. The light crunch in the tiramisu was unlike anything I've ever tried and really closed the meal out great for me.  Overall, I know I'll be back. This restaurant is one of the best Wolfgang Pucks in town and certainly the best option inside of Crystals shopping center. (Unless you want to spend $75/person at Mastro's)
Awesome meals and the chocolate gelato tastes like Abuelita hot chocolate. (YUM!) Our waiter, Tony, was amazing! He was able to accommodate a picky palate.

Having spent a week in Vegas with kids, this was the BEST restaurant we visited...and we ate out 2-3 times a day.  Great service, outstanding food (we raved about EVERY dish), kids loved splitting the linguini and clams. Fantastic location, ambiance, access to sports in the bar.  Reasonably priced as well. We'll be back!

FANTASTIC!!!!! The best meal we ate in Vegas!! My baby has severe/anaphylactic allergies to eggs and peanuts and they went above and beyond in feeding him a SAFE meal. He gobbled up his kids pizza. The wine, Amura Malbec, was delicious. Went perfectly with our caprese salad and pizza cippo (without meat, we had it with red onions instead). The caprese had delicious flavor and the tomatoes were perfect with the mozzarella cheese. Very very fresh and refreshing after being outside. The pizza had a perfectly cooked crispy crust. Very thin and cooked just right.   The service was amazing!!! Apollo was incredible, everyone was super attentive and amazing! I wish I knew all of their names to say thank you. The restaurant is also impeccably clean.   If I come back to Vegas, I will visit again. You will not be disappointed! Visit this restaurant if you want a really yummy meal!!!!
Really great food. High quality pasta. Defiantly come here again. You get a nice view of the mall below.

Fabulous experience! Needed a place where I could sit down and have a reasonably priced meal close to my company apartment. (When I'm in Vegas for work I'm looking for efficiency over entertainment or a "dining experience.") Staff was all very professional and the food was really fantastic. I got the arugula salad and it was one of the most delicious salads I've ever had with peas, radishes, burrata, some other goodies, and a lemon vinegarette. The dessert (pistachio bundito) was pretty good. The cocktail (old fashion) was average. The prices were on par with Vegas, I didn't think anything was outrageous at all. The quality of the food and the flavors are of course what Wolfgang is known for, and I was not disappointed. I'll be back when I'm on business!

Our group went to Cucina Wolfgang Pack. We were served by Tony. His recommendations for our entrees and wine select were in point. Very well verse in all their good selections! Tony your Da BOMB!!! Thank you for your 5-star service! Aloha from Hawaii!!!

Just ate there this past weekend on a girls Vegas trip. The service was good, made a reservation on Open Table with no problem, and the rescheduled us when we were running late. The restaurant is in a great location and doesn't get too packed which is nice. As for the food, it was very well presented and was very tasty. Not too big portions also! So over-all good experience!

Excellent is all I have to say. We had nearly half the appetizers on the menu and a variety of dishes and everything was excellent. I mean really excellent quality food and my mom is from Italy and is the biggest food snob and had fish and cleaned her plate. The veggies were delicious and fresh. Our server was top notch! Even the busboys (is that the proper name?)...we had a water spill and before I could say anything he cleaned it and brought a hot water pitcher so we wouldn't have any spills. It was a more than pleasant experience considering it was a last minute decision. The pizza...exquisite and the fish...absolutely fresh and tasteful... I can't believe how great our experience was. Must go here!

Located in the Crystal Shopping Mall, Wolfgang Puck's Cucina is a good restaurant for quick eats at affordable prices.  I came here on a Friday and had the Lobster special which included a (thin) half lobster and a sizable lobster mac and cheese. Since bread is not complimentary I also ordered a side of garlic bread.  Everything tasted as good as it looked.   Overall the meal was good and the service was satisfactory. I recommend.

Just returned home from a visit to Las Vegas. My friend and I happened upon Cucina and had an amazing experience. Nick was an extremely happy and attentive waitperson. We had two of the happy hour drink specials and some appetizers. Incredible drinks, classy atmosphere and the food is fabulous! This restaurant has happy hour all day long and each item was no more than $8! We couldn't get enough so we went back the next day for more. Nick was there again with another server Matt. Great service, upscale drinks and beautifully presented food. Next time we're in town, we'll be back for more at Cucina!

This is my favorite all-around strip restaurant in Las Vegas.   The caprese salad ranks amongst the best caprese salads I've ever had. The margherita pie is a goddamned wok of art. I'm a sauce guy and this tasty, slightly sweet sauce hits the mark perfectly.  Pizzeria & Cucina has a light, open air atmosphere and prices so reasonable that you may forget that you're in one of the most expensive shopping malls in America.  Protip: Happy hour is all day at the bar. The $16 pitcher of sangria you get with this deal is delicious and more than enough booze to get two people nicely drunk.
Has the braised veal osso buco. Awesome. Prices fairly priced. Recommend.

Yas this place is pretty empty but the food was really food. We went during HH and got the $6 pizzas, $6 wings and $6 calamari. It was all really good and hit the spot. The calamari was fried perfectly and it was really big pieces. The pizza came out piping hot and with gooey cheese. I also had the $6 red sangria that was delicious! The service was great and fast, we sat at the bar and the bartender was really nice and attentive.

This is a regular for us when we want simple, Italian food without a lot of fuss.  They have a great selection of pastas and pizzas in a very bright, clean open air restaurant in the Crystals Mall.  There are lots of Italian places in Vegas but many of the ones off strip are old school, dark, and a bit over the top.  We love the food at Wolfgang's. The starters are all fantastic, love the carbonara, and the arugula pizza.
Really great pizza, and the red sangria was yummy.... me and my husband ate there for lunch and we going back on our last day here before heading back home it was so good

I am not one to complain about money when it comes to dining. I think I work so that I can eat at nice places and yelp about it. The sad part is, I wasn't kidding. Hey, we all have our priorities! My deck at home could flake off but my tummy is always happy.  However, Vegas and food are ridiculous. I just dropped $18 on a sad breakfast sandwich and a coffee. It's insane. It should have been just $8! So, last night's dinner at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria and Cucina was a real treat as I didn't have to worry about the check.  My company took me and my colleagues for a very nice dinner at a private room here. It was so much fun as we have worked all day on Sunday and it was fun to see everyone at one place. Beer, wine, and cocktails were flowing and before we knew it, we were laughing and having a blast over heirloom bruschetta, calamari, and meatballs. All were tasty.  After that, we had a pasta course of bucatini with wild boar ragu that was to die for. It was  really delicious mix of thick savory tomato and jus mixed of a sauce with shreds of tender wild boar, kale, and hand rolled pasta. Yumm!  Though I was getting full, I still enjoyed the flat iron steak with potato and broccolini. The flat iron steak was surprisingly tender with great flavor on the meat. There was a salmon selection that looked good as well but I think I made the right choice.  Dessert was also surprisingly deeelicious!! It was an individual pie with peach filling with almond paste served warm with ice cream. That was a perfect combo for me. I don't believe I have ever loved a man more than I love a great warm pie. Well for one thing, the pie never argues with me. That's a big plus.  The room we were in was very nice and spacious enough to house all of us. There were over 30 people and it was just fine. The service was also impeccable. It was well done.  I am lucky that I work for a great company and my coworkers are just really awesome people. I really had a blast over Moscow Mule and Hefeweizen. Plus, no check to swipe a credit card for. Yay! I could make up some of the other meals since I saved tonight! Yeah, life of a per diem traveling worker! However, can't complain really.. Not tonight because yes, I am working but I am working in Vegas!!! Whoohoo!

Dinner here was very enjoyable. We came on a Monday night and made a reservation and got sat easily. The food was great. I had parsnip tortelino. The waiter warned me it wasn't a large plate, however it was just what I was looking for. All of the ingredients flowed well together. I believe it had a sage brown butter sauce. We ordered a pitcher sangria. It was affordable prices for around $24 and we each got about three glasses. Good choice for a nice dinner but I wished it was a little more romantic. I should have considered that it is located in the crystals shopping center.

I was really impressed by this place. I took my boyfriend there for his birthday and the service was phenomenal! I made a reservation through open seats, but at 6:30 on a Friday night, it was surprisingly not busy, so reservations weren't necessary. I ordered the brick chicken. It was full of flavor and very tender. My boyfriend ordered the chicken parmigiana. He thought the chicken itself lacked flavor, but paired with the spaghetti, was just right. We ordered the zepole for dessert and it is served with white chocolate and raspberry sauce. It was amazing, and the best part is they didn't charge us for it because it was my boyfriend's birthday! The servers kept the bread stocked and the drinks filled. It was an overall great experience.

My group and I were left completely unimpressed by this place. Speaking for myself, I was expecting more since this place has "Wolfgang Puck" as a prefix in it's name.   The server was nice, although I forgot her name. The food took for-ev-errrrrrr to get out to us. The eggplant parmesan (my dish) was a-ok. My cousin had the mushroom pizza, which was OK, as well. I am a huge fan of arugula and when her pizza came out, the mushroom was baked within the pizza as it usually is, and the arugula was just sprinkled on top with what looked like olive oil sprinkled over it. She wasn't happy. I think she was expecting it to be baked with the whole pizza, but whatever. I ate it all anyway. Another one of my friends ordered a pepperoni pizza sub pepperoni for chicken, because they don't pork. The server was kind enough to do that, however failed to tell her that there would be an extra charge for chicken. One would think since you're subbing the item, it would be an equal exchange if you weren't notified of a price difference. We didn't want to complain or argue, so we just paid the difference and left it at that.  Everyone left the restaurant unhappy and with complaints. Bad sign. We probably won't come here again next time.
Really good food, get the chef's plate, great combination platter.  The service is very nice too!

I had no idea Wolfgang Puck was so upscale! The only Wolfgang Puck I had ever eaten at was in Macy's food court. I have to say I'm quite impressed.  We told them we had a show to catch, so they were extra quick with service.   My mojito was yum. The bread was tasty. My favorite was the one with raisins. My pizza was huge! I had to give my bf some.  I probably won't seek out this place next time, but I know I don't mind coming back.
O.M.G.!  I went out on a limb and ordered the pork steak and it did NOT disappoint!!  Tender & delicious!  The service from Juan was impeccable.  This is a destination from now on!!!

We were looking for a casual dinner spot for our first night in Las Vegas. The menu at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria and Cucina appealed to everyone in our party. The food did not disappoint. I had the caramelized onion, guanciale, and goat cheese pizza. The crust was light and chewy, the toppings were delicious. Husband was very happy with his Italian meat pizza. Other entrees enjoyed were the eggplant parmesan and linguine with steamed clams. Service was excellent. And the people watching opportunities were fantastic.

What a disappointment.  The restaurant is located smack in the center of the premium shopping center, Crystal's. That being said, the prices are surprisingly reasonable, or so I thought before I ordered food.   Service is great; friendly staff who deal with tourists every single day, and are still able to serve you with a smile.    Now on to the 'edibles'.  Ack, what a disappointment.  I ordered a citrus tea to drink, which was supposed to be an iced tea flavoured with a mint syrup. I might as well have ordered an Arizona iced tea. It was overbearingly sweet and tasted like store bought bottled tea. Why would a chef put his name on this stuff?  To eat I ordered the baby artichokes. These were quite fine. Tender, well seasoned, and refreshing as a antipasto.   For my main I ordered a prosciutto pizza, thinking it would be the smart thing to order at a pizzeria. The prosciutto was of great quality, sliced very thinly and was very fresh. The rest of it was horrible. The dough was flat, dense and chewy. It clearly was pre-rolled and refrigerated. The cheese was quite off-putting, it was coagulated in all the wrong places  and full of little holes; bland and flavorless.   It was quite a shocking pizza, as a fellow yelper commented, dominos would make better pizza. I don't understand what the massive kitchen is used for, but there is clearly no fresh dough being kneaded and no wood-oven in it either. Thankfully the bartender took the pizza off the bill when I questioned whether the pizza had been made that day.   I would not recommend this to anyone, except maybe for a cocktail as it has a nice view and a kickass decor. For 20$ a pizza, it is not a good value at all, which is saying a lot as that is quite cheap for Vegas.   I would not recommend this to anyone, except maybe for a cocktail as it has a nice view and a kickass decor.

I'm addicted to 'shrooms, and Wolfgang Puck kindly catered to my addiction by offering the most brilliant flatbread pizza I've had the pleasure of chewing. These mushrooms lacked all of that woodsy-dirt flavor usually accompanying my bad habit.  The buttery umami mushrooms were adorned with slightly bitter, yet still crisp, dark green arugula leaves, which rested atop a gossamer glaze of béchamel and shiny fontana cheese. Lightly salted, when dunked in a sweet side of red sauce, you're mouth is in for the most psychedelic flavor trip of its life.

We had dinner on 11/9/14.  No wait for a table.  Great ambiance in what I consider one of the coolest buildings/malls in the country.  Take special note to the wooden stair cases throughout Crystals.  Absolutely stunning carpentry, sky lights and walls/lines and floors.  Anyhow, after we were seated, with not a full house, it took an unusually long amount of time for our assigned wait person to arrive and intro himself.  Anyhow, we split the kale salad, which as fantastic.  We got a Margarita pizza and a rigatoncini.  Both were quite good, although we felt the pizza wasn't anything to write home about where the other was really good.  It took a long time for a glass of wine and pineapple mojito to arrive.  We had to ask for table bread too.  We asked what the WP label was - meaning what label is it that WP puts his sticker over.  No one in the restaurant could answer the question. That seemed a bit weird.

This is our first trip to cucina but we've been to crystals at the city center several times. It's very nice and modern. I had the raviolis and my wife had the prosciutto pizza. We shared and both meals were very good. If you have time go to a tux 4 tonight stand and get the 25% off your bill voucher. It only cost $2 to save 25%. It's a great deal!

Accidents happen. Management apologized. Refunded our meal and gave us a gift-card for a future meal. We appreciated everything and feel that this was a fair response from management. More then anything we hope it was a learning experience. Besides the allergic reaction, the service and staff were all great.

As with most Wolfgang Puck restaurant they serve great bread , as they do here. We started with Butter Lettuce salad, it came with Gorgonzola, bacon , pistachio and egg. The dressing was just OK. We then had a Italian Meat Pizza, which came with Pepperoni, Salami, Sopresatta and sweet peppers. The crust was the star. Service was average I couldn't get my drink refill all meal. Great location upstairs at Crystals shopping center.
Excellent pepperoni pizza and bolognese pasta. Staying at the Signature at MGM and the restaurant is a short walk away. Would go again!!
Slow service,  average food.  In fact, I had a 100% better Cesar salad at pub in Seattle. Lame. The restaurant itself is nice and the bar area looked pretty lively.

Beautiful restaurant inside the even more beautiful Crystals, without the high prices.   First off, the service here was very impressive. For a party of over 20, service went smoothly from the the taking of our orders to the splitting of the checks and everything in between.   In addition to the service, the food here was wonderful. The server brought out two types of bread- Ciabatta and a fluffier, more rustic bread that everyone seemed to prefer. We asked for more of the good stuff, but the server noted that they were all out since it was close to the end of the night. Bummer!   No need to pout, however, as our food arrived just in time. I ordered the Steamed Mussels- 15 or so mussels from New Zealand steamed in a delicious white wine/tomato sauce with diced chorizo, garlic, and marjoram (herb), served with a grilled ciabatta slice lovingly brushed with olive oil. The mussels came out bubbling in a cast iron pan, remaining warm till the very last mollusk. The only hiccup of this dish was that two of the mussels weren't open. Other than that, I enjoyed this dish and thought it perfect as an entree.   I also tried a bite of the Sea Bass dish, which was delicious. The skin of the bass was pan seared beautifully, resulting in a crispy skin that was good and contrasted nicely with the meat of the sea bass, which was so tender and melt in your mouth. Adding to the delicateness of the fish was the cream sauce that lay on top. I also tried the Italian Sausage Pizza- Rapini (Broccoli Rabe), Carmelized Garlic, Sausage, Mozzarella Cheese and Pecorino Romano atop a thin, soft pizza dough- which was flavorful and delicious.   One of my favorite parts of the meal was how the checks were split. Each check had 5/6 people's orders, and each order's total (including tax and tip) was separate from the other totals. This made paying very easy and hassle-free. I didn't have to do any calculations, except counting the money for our table.   Can't wait to try out their happy hour!

Fantastic service provided by Quetzi. Stopped by here with the family for dinner. Personally ordered sea bass and the mates ordered spaghetti. On top of everything went into a food coma. Thanks so much.

Went here for a moderately priced and easily accessible food joint with my friend who works in the Crystals Mall. The last pizza place I went to owned by a celebrity chef sucked balls (SERIOUS PIE SEATTLE), so I was a little apprehensive when sitting down and looking over the menu.  HOWEVER  We ended up ordering the Prosciutto, Smoked Chorizo, and Italian Meat pizzas. Each were unique - herby - meaty - awesome. By far, the Prosciutto was the best, but I would order any of these pizzas again. As for pricing, it was fair and we all ended up spending around $12ish.   Ambiance was also really nice. Actually, upon reconsideration, all new Vegas restaurants have to look good or else it wouldn't be Vegas.  Overall, I highly recommend this place if you're in the Crystals mall and looking for good food.

Dinner over Memorial Day weekend with my family of four.   Short story, the dinner was pretty good.  We started with some salumi and cheese, served with olives and chutney.   Tasty stuff.  My son ordered the "meatlovers' pizza and said it was good--nice crust.  My daughter had a half order of the carbonara which was kindly prepped without the zucchini.  She's not a huge eater but she polished it off.  I had the chicken piccata which was a huge serving over nicely cooked broccolini and my husband had the pork milanese (aka schnitzel) which was also huge, serviced with a really lovely arugula and fennel salad.  We shared the chocolate cremosa for dessert which was (frankly) just OK.  The teeny scoop of espresso gelato served with it was the star of the show.  It was the absolute essence of coffee, seriously.  This could have been a four-star meal; however, the service was jinky.  It took a while for the waiter to come by and see us after the hostess dropped us off.  He was nice but he didn't seem to know much about the menu.  I asked if the fritto misto was floured / battered and he was confused by my question and answered that it just "came out of a bag."  Um, that's not what I asked and certainly not what I want to hear when dining at one of Wolfgang Puck's restaurants.  The restaurant is located in the Crystals shopping mall which felt cold and deserted at 730PM on a Sunday evening.

What a fabulous evening and experience! Came here on my birthday-eve and was wowed from the moment we arrived. The staff here is amazing and very knowledgable. Adam, our server, was spectacular- hard to determine which was better - the delectable food or attentive server!   We started with the small meat and cheese board, which was the perfect amount for two to share. For our entrees we had the chicken piccata and the pappardelle. Both were delicious! We were treated to complimentary dessert (zeppole) in honor of my birthday. Oh my goodness were they yummy!!! Make sure you save room!!!  We will definitely return on our next trip to Vegas!

We stayed at Aria and went to Cucina twice. Loved the selection, the service and the specials. Their $25 three course lunches/$35 dinners are great. The staff was super friendly and accommodating with our toddler and ours friends' 5 year old. The kids menu is great and they even helped us clean up our utensils so we didn't have to carry a smelly bib with us all day  Bobbi Jo you rock. Thanks again

Great place for some italian good.  The caramelized cauliflower was amazing and the pasta dish I had was delicious.  I think the bruschetta would be amazing if the balsamic was a reduction instead. Not that I'm Wolfgang or anything haha.

We had a wonderful meal here.  The service is professional but not stuffy.  The prices were very reasonable considering the location and quality of food.  The bread came out piping hot, and was some of the softest fluffiest bread we've had. Sooooo good.   The beef carpaccio and tartare were superb and the salad of blanched spring vegetables was perfection simplified.  The only disappointment was the sausage pizza which was soggy and not all that great. The crust was pretty flavorless and would have greatly benefited from a little more time in a wood fired brick oven.  I'd definitely come back, but not for pizza.

We came here as a big multigenerational group for an early dinner. I have eaten at several Wolfgang restaurants before so was super excited to share with the big group. Not busy at all. All the dishes were delicious. We had the prie fix meal. Adults enjoyed several pitchers of sangria. Kids all ordered pizzas. However where cucina fell short was on serving size and service. Serving size was small on all shared dishes even for the salad. Dessert was laughable 2 tiny gelato balls for 5 adults ( the same size they brought out for table of two nearby). If not for the adults snagging some of the kids extra Pizza, and several extra desserts ordered for the kids, we would have left hungry.  The service was spotty, definitely not attentive or forward looking. No serving silverware for family style platters. Slow refills on water,  no refills on kids drinks. No clearing of dishes. We had several different servers  yet none really delivered and restaurant was not busy. Eggplant Parmesan was the fav but overall meal was below expectations. The kicker- did not honor yelp coupon because summer dinner special.  Loved the gender neutral bathroom! Loved the easy and free valet parking! Bummed the value and service were not to expectations.

Was not impressed.  Food was mediocre.   Won't be back.   Service was great.  Atmosphere was a nice break from the loud, craziness of the strip.   We got the Calamari and vegetable appetizer combo.   Husband got the fettuccini noodles with seafood and I got the gluten free Capri pizza.   We also got the broccolini side dish.   The best tasting dish was the broccolini.
