Cooked perfect and flavorful.   The pizza was the worst I have ever had.   My husband wasn't impressed with his fettuccini dish or disappointed, it was just "alright".   Same opinion of the Calamari.

Went here for my birthday dinner/one day trip to Vegas with my wife. Didn't want to go too crazy expensive or with long waits and crowds. Cuccina was perfect. We shared the small salumi platter which was generous and delicious. Wife had the pappardelle and I had the sea bass. The pasta was fresh and delicious, and the sea bass came out like a Branzino and was well cooked and nicely seasoned with the vegetables. They gave me a free dessert which was greatly appreciated. And service was exceptional.   For a Wolfgang and Vegas restaurant, this is a bargain. Better than LA prices for the quality.

The linguine carbonara is one of the best dishes I've had in my life.  Thick, fresh made noodles....chunks of bacon....just rich, buttery pasta goodness.  We had excellent service and the prices were very reasonable for the quality of food we received.  I loved it here.

Great experience! Went on a Wednesday night and had no wait.. our waiter, Tony was fantastic and knew the menu items very well!  Had half price off bottles of wine MTW & also used 20% off coupon  We got sausage pizza & meat pizza. Both great depending on type of meal you are looking for  Definitely recommend :)

Meh. This is elevated Mall food. Not anything special.  The prix fixe lunch is a good deal but I got the appetizer and main that had extra charges. The prosciutto was decent sized but the extra charge made it less of a value and the steak was medium when I asked for medium rare - very very medium, almost medium-well.  Both were disappointing given the extra I paid.   Best thing was the simple Greek yogurt dessert.   My other dining partners had the other pasta items. No one was wowed. Or even remotely satisfied. Let's just say no return visit is forthcoming.   Would be 2 stars but our waiter was excellent.

Excellent bruschetta. Children's cheesy pasta amazing to be sure. Be sure to have the sausage with onions and cherry peppers pizza.  It's the thinnest crust of your dreams!! Excellent service too.  Final note I was glad to see Wolfgang hadn't gone cheap on the kids crayons. He still used Crayolas.  :-)
Both my wife and I LOVED this place. From the Kale salad to our main entrée it was a hit for us!!
Had Salmon with asparagus and capers. Fresh fish, lovely preparation. Pizza was good too. No complaints!

We had such a good time at Cucina. The food was great, and the staff was even better. Our waiter Tony was great, and so were the folks around him.   Not too crowded, reasonably priced, EXCELLENT food. Can't ask for much more.  The burrata/prosciutto/grilled bread was great, the chicken piccata was better than what I eat at home, and the little donut dessert really finished it off with a bang.  Seriously, we had a great time and will be back.   PS - Wednesday is half price bottles of wine. Lucky us.

This is located in the Crystal shopping center.  Not very busy so we got seated right away.  The food was very good - it is a 4.5 star.  The 1.5 star knocked off was the waiter service.  We had two kids and he never offered us a kids menu.  After we ordered, the food started to come, I asked the busboy if they have a kids menu and our waiter brought it over and say "you wanted a kids menu?" The menu was folded and gave it to us.  BTW out kids are 6 and 9, so it wasn't like we had big kids that kids menu doesn't apply.  The menu is super limited - even after I mentioned it, the waiter still didn't say anything.  After our food came, we overheard the table next to us, a different waiter was telling the customers 3 different specials that was not on the menu - 2 different types of steak and the Gnocchi specials - which was never mentioned to us when we were ordering.  It's a shame we never even had the opportunity to try the special - oh wait we didn't even get to hear it!  The restaurant was 20% occupied and the waiter never came and ask if everything is ok?  We have to wave the busboy for more water.  Correction - the waiter took our order, gave me the kids menu after I requested it and gave us our check.  Also, no dessert was offered at this Italian restaurant- at least no option was offered to us.  We felt discriminated!!  Absolutely a terrible experience.  We will never come back or any of the Wolfgang chains even though the food was decent - there are so many other options in Vegas.  This is when I don't agree with the 15% tips!

Before heading home we had a great girls night dinner here. There were 8 of us and we sat in the "centerpiece" table. I had the veal ravioli which was delicious, with a side of brussel sprouts.  I tasted my friends' dishes - and they were all good, great portions.  Who would think, in the Crystals mall - the best mall food I've had. It wasn't crowded and great for groups. All our food came out together, and the staff keep our glasses filled.

The food was great! I had the fettuccini and my wife had the ravioli. The ravioli was amazing!! The fettuccini was a little on the dry Side for my liking! They add a bread crumb to the fettuccini that makes it great! Also the portions are a little on the small side! Overall the service was great, crystal helped us!

We came to Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria and Cucina for a small meal before hitting the strip, it was 9 PM on a Friday night. We were seated immediately by a friendly hostess. Dave came shortly after we were seated and brought water and took our drink order. He recommended the Joseph James Wiseguy heiferweisner (?), a local beer which was really good! We ordered the starter prosciutto and the sausage pizza.   The prosciutto was so, soo good. It came quickly, the bread was warm and the mozzarella was cold. The dish had just a little salt, which really made the mozzarella delicious. The servers were quick to take our used plates and utensils. The pizza was really good, the pickled peppers were just spicy enough. It was medium sized pizza, but thin crust. Splitting it was a good small snack for 2, or a whole meal if you were hungry.   The vibe was casual, and it was right in the middle of the mall so if you were seated at the edge you could look out at the rest of the shops. It was pretty calm when we went, but if it were a busy day the restaurant would've probably been pretty loud with all the ambient mall noises.   Only gripe: the bathroom needed attention. It was nice, but the mirror was dirty and there was no soap. Other than that, it was pretty cool!

I made a reservation here for my sister-in-law's 30th birthday dinner. We were able to be seated right away and had a great night. The food was delicious (most folks had pizza)! I especially loved the cauliflower side dish. The chilis were an awesome touch! Initially, the service was a little slow but once our food orders were taken the staff was around constantly for drink refills and the like. They also provided a yummy birthday dessert for the guest-of-honor. I would definitely go back!

Tried twice to visit Wolfgang Puck's in Las Vegas (City Center) and L.A. (L.A Live). Both times we arrived 90 minutes before closing time and we were told we couldn't have a table because it was too late! Their lack of professionalism it's incredible. They shouldn't Write a closing time if it is not going to be implemented! I'm sure that the neighboring restaurants appreciate this apparently sistematic way of managing their businesses.

Service was great from the start, as it should be. Ordered pizza... Spicy pepperoni, the pepperoni had a good flavor. As for the dough .. bland, I could bet the pizza sauce was basic tomatoes puree. Lack of seasoning overall. The price is what it is but please ....

We chose this place based on Yelp rating for a Thanksgiving Day dinner.  It was a mistake.   The restaurant is in a shopping mall, but it makes the best of this location: Ambience and decoration are nice.   We made a reservation through OpenTable, but it turned out it wasn't necessary, as the place was semi-empty. The hostess seated us right away. We asked for a high chair, she said she would bring one right away, but we never saw her again.   Things started badly with a wobbling table. A waiter tried to help, but he could not fix it completely. Note: A restaurant of this class surely can afford to fix wobbling tables.   We ordered the prosciutto appetizer, the fettuccine carbonara, pappardelle with meat sauce, and some pasta with cheese for the little ones.   The $18 appetizer had some of the smallest, and certainly the thinnest slices of prosciutto I have ever seen. I like prosciutto sliced thin, but this is ridiculous. Just barely enough to taste the meat. The burrata that came with it was excellent, though.   Now, the big downer: All pasta dishes (including the plain spaghetti with cheese for the kids) were ruined by the massive, excessive amount of salt. I am not someone who avoids salt, but this was clearly too much. Maybe the B-team was in the kitchen on Thanksgiving Day, but still, there's no justification for serving such dishes.   The carbonara dish had nothing resembling classic carbonara. It felt like an improvised recipe without much coherence. The pappardelle with meat sauce were better (if you can forget about the salt).   We left without even thinking of ordering a dessert course.

The food at this restaurant is top notch! Eating here has been one of the best experiences of my life. The food and service was impeccable!!! My boyfriend ordered the bruschetta as an appetizer, and let me tell you that it was the best bruschetta we have ever had!!! It had fresh pesto, basil, tomatoes, and shaved parmesan! So delicious!  Since I am a vegetarian, I ordered the eggplant parmesan and it was so good! My boyfriend ordered the sea bass and he loved it as well. We couldn't stop raving about how good everything was!!!   For dessert, we had the flour less chocolate cake and it was amazing. Everything was divine from start to finish!   My boyfriend and I are starting a new tradition where we make it a priority to eat here every time we go to Vegas!
Great vibe. Great food. Butter lettuce salad was perfect.

Went here to kill some time. Located in the Crystal Shops in front of the Aria. Hip looking place with a good sound track playing (very important). Ordered a Green Flash West Coast IPA, always a good selection, and also the Pork Belly Sliders. The sliders are tiny, tiny one bite size so beware.

This place is home to me. I love everything about this restaurant. I eat here every other day. The food is fantastic and the staff is amazing very professional.  Things you should try is definitely the pork belly panini

Decent food, convenient location if you're at the Aria, and plenty of seating.  It's one of the places on the strip that don't charge you and arm and a leg and the perfect setting for a first lunch in vegas that goes right into a bit of shopping at the mall.

Really enjoyed my dining experience here. We were looking for a nice relaxing place to eat before the Britney Spears show and we're able to get a last minute reservation on a Saturday night.   After hitting up a buffet for breakfast that same day,  I was looking for something light and flavorful. I ordered the minestrone soup and a salad with peaches and tomatoes. Both dishes were great,  but I really enjoyed the salad.  The prices were reasonable, the menu was well-rounded and the service was quick and attentive.
Me and my wife tried the NY steak... it was poorly made and had zero taste, and it costed us 41$ a piece.. there must be better places in LV for a good steak.
Salad needed more dressing. Pizza was good.  Canoli was way to hard!

The happy hour was great! The appetizer plates were very diverse and filling. The raspberry lemon drop was delicious not too sweet just right.  The staff was attentive but not hovering. Really nice environment for a late lunch.

LOVE LOVE LOVE their bruschetta appetizer!  Whenever I visit Las Vegas, I always stop by in the Crystals shopping mall to dine at Wolfgang Puck.  The restaurant is very relaxed and comfortable.  I usually dress casually when dining here.  Definitely recommend trying the veal ravioli; it is amazing.  I've tried one of their pizzas which has the crushed red peppers on them.... THEY ARE SPICY! Super super spicy so watch out.  The price of the food is a bit high but they do have happy hour items served specifically at the bar seats.

Rude staff and unaccomidating to their guest.  We simply wanted to have a beverage in their empty restaurant as I was with my elderly parents.  They insisted we could only sit at the bar (which both of my parents would clearly have much difficulty with). If they had more than 2 other tables in use I would have completely understood, unfortunately MOST of the tables were empty.    Do Not spend your money with people like this!

Amazing as always. Apollo was an amazing waiter, service was perfect and food was delicious.  One of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas by far.   Eggplant parm is some of the best I've ever had!  We always make a stop here when we are in town!

This place was so good we ate there twice in one trip. Their Pizza is to die for. The food was big enough to share between two people. This is a place I could have eatin at every day if I had the chance. Their bruschetta was unlike any other I've every had. Everything tasted fresh and new. I love it! I will be eating there again the next time I go to Vegas.
I love all Wolfgang Puck restaurants. always so delicious. I got the mushroom pizza and the eggplant parmesan. So yummy. I also wanted some meat so I got one side of their meatballs. It was so good.
We had a great dinner.  Nice spot inside a beautiful shopping space.   Great, well rounded, menu to fit all appetites and budgets.   Superior drinks, attentive service.
Inside city center and this place can be hard to find. Food, service and atmosphere were all good. Looking forward to going back.

If you're looking for an excuse to go to Crystals and actually spend money on something there, you can thank Wolfgang Puck for making it possible.  Now, if you really want to hardly spend anything, there is also The Pods by Wolfgang Puck right beneath it, but I'd opt for the Pizzeria & Cucina.  The big question I had before going here was: is it better to go here, or the Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill at the MGM?  After now having gone to both, I'd much rather go here.  The ambience is far superior here, it's totally better to be at Crystals looking around than basically next to the casino floor at MGM.  I opted to sit at the bar, where it is happy hour all day and I felt like I could relax there all day. The bartender/server was helpful, personable, and even made a recommendation that helped save me money (he basically told me to just refill up on regular tea for free, as opposed to the one I ordered which costs $4 w/ no free refills).  Although I sat at the bar, there's a great variety of seating options all around, I'm a real fan of this layout, especially the white couch/booth.  My favorite thing I had was the Zeppole (see pic), even after eating all that food I was able to finish these 6 donut holes. When it was set in front of me, I thought there was no way I had room left for it all, but they were so good that I did!  They really do taste best if you put the caramel and gelato on them at the same time.  Their Spicy Pepperoni wood fired oven pizza is hard to resist too.   Easily one of the most awesome affordable places to go on The Strip for a meal or just snacks and drinks.

It's a nice restaurant with decent price. We thought this restaurant located in such a good shopping area, it should be very expensive, and especially it's under wolf gang puck. But the bill was nice for us. With checkin at Yelp, we got 20% off of our entire bill. It's good.  -service: our server was nice and efficient. He came to us to take the orders and food was served within 10-15 minutes. -Cesar salad was good. Every leave was covered well with the dressings. It's fresh. -piazz: it's full of cheese, and the sausage mixed well with it. The pizza dough wasn't too thick.  -pasta: the sauce for the pasta wouldn't make us feel too heavy and the meat portion was decent.  It's a good
I am now a fan, the flavor profiles on the different courses were unbelievable.  I now have to go and try all his restaurants even here in DC.

For us, the main attraction was the shopping mall (City Center) where this place is located.  We parked in the Aria hotel lot and took the Tram into the Crystals drop in the City Center.  At the top of the Tram station you can look down into the Aria swimming/relaxation village - that seems to be the most hip place for the under 30 crowd.  Lots of great scenery!  As for the WP pie, it was nice.  I would recommend one of the pastas over the pizza, which was great but not my first choice.  Pizza just doesn't need to be so gourmet.  Except I Yelped Pizza and so that's why we ended up there.  Coulda just had a slice instead of the whole $18 pie which I threw most of away.

This restaurant is conveniently located in the Crystal Shops next to Aria.  I stayed at Aria, so we decided to try this place.  It has a pretty casual vibe and has a clean look to it.  Even though it's located in the mall, it's pretty peaceful.  This mall doesn't have as much traffic, so it's a nice setting.  Service from the staff was awesome.  Our main course did come out on the slow side though.  Food, at least, tasted awesome.  ANTIPASTA SALAD: They don't have side salads, but they have half portions.  I had this and it was awesome.  This salad has salami, provolone picante, red onion, and red wine vinaigrette.  The picante and red onion add just the perfect spicy little kick to this.  RIGATOCINI: I loved my dish and fished the whole thing!!  It's made with Piemontese Meat Sauce, Garlic, and Parmesan Reggiano.  I am a red meat sauce type of person and this nailed it for me.  Added crushed red pepper to this dish for an extra added kick.  Portion size is on perfect so that you're not overly stuff, yet satisfied.  SPAGHETTI: This dish comes with tomatoes, basil, garlic, and four big homemade meatballs.  This is definitely a safe dish.  I took a bite from my mom's dish and it came nothing short of expectation.    SIDENOTE: We had to ask for bread and butter. So if you're a carb lover, feel free to ask your waiter and they'll be glad to grab it for you. (:

Made reservations and got seated once we got there. Ordered antipasti salad, seafood linguine, torchio, Margherita pizza with pepperoni, brick chicken and a side of broccolini. Everything was delicious and seasoned well. The chicken was juicy and tender. Broccolini was so so garlicky and cooked perfectly. I showed the server my Yelp check in and got 20% discount. Love getting discounts for using Yelp!
Food awesome. Service average. Waitress was a " drive by" waitress. Stopped by often enough but only to ask the obligatory question and often times never stayed long enough to hear our answer.

I don't understand how this place got a 4 stars. I had great expectations cuz it said WP, omg... I am so disappointed!!!!  I was imagining Cucina in Irvine spectrum, but definitely not the same category. We ordered the kale salad that I am surprised to say that Wendy's apple salad is much better. And their pizza was ehhhh. I'm just surprised how low quality the food was. I will never go back by my choice. Sorry, I try not to leave too negative comments on these, but this one had too big of a difference between the star numbers and what was actually provided.

There is too much good food in Las Vegas to eat anywhere mediocre, so I was super hesitant to eat at a restaurant in a shopping center.  But I was jonesing for a spaghetti carbonara and after a quick Yelp search, Cucina was at the right place at the right time.  and WOW, talk about surpassing expectations!  Their rendition of a pasta carbonara is the Torchio, which had recently changed and differed than the pics/reviews on Yelp.  I probably would have preferred the original version (with peas), but this dish was very very good.    But the real MVP was the Pappardelle with Wild Boar Ragu.  It was ***spectacular*** (sent with fireworks).  The pasta was delicate and perfect, the sauce was delicious, the meat tender.  If it had a little less salt, it would have been flawless.  Portions are not over-sized like at most restaurants so the entrees might seem small to some people, but these two dishes are worth every cent.  Oh, and I almost forgot to mention... they have a Yelp check-in discount - 20%!  I will definitely be back!
So awesome! The cuisine was thoughtful creative and delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed our server, cocktails and dinner. Prices were reasonable for Vegas.

Great place to grab lunch. I don't know if I'd go there during Dinner on a special occasion, as it's kind of casual. I'm sure you'd have picked that up already since it's in a mall.  I will say that this place could easily be a stand alone spot off a casino floor though.  Food was really good. I had the cheese ravioli. Portions are small, but a fair amount for the cost to taste ratio. I would highly recommend you keep this place on your top 20 when going to Vegas.

I give it a 4 only because of the food, however if you are starving and want your food fast DO NOT go here. They take about an hour to get you food and service is a bit slow with drinks. I would have loved if the waitress came and let us know that it would take an hour to get our main dish and 45 mins to get our appetizers.

Delicious meal! Started off with "night at the burlesque" cocktail (5/5). Then had the meat and cheese board (4/5) and completed the meal with pappardelle pasta!(5/5) I would have brought it home with me if I had a fridge and microwave!

Although this restaurant is tucked away inside Crystals it is SO worth the trip.  The Old Fashions are habit forming as well are the Cosmos.  From the minute we entered we had the BEST service staff...friendly, courteous and very attentive. So...the food?  We tried several apps off the menu which were better than as described on the menu...came out very timely and served with class.  My party also tried one of their pizzas...with a little extra KICK of heat...WOW  it was oven hot..spiced just right..crust was cooked to GBD!.  My party split entree orders to some off the menu and some ordered the Chef's Specials.  My meal was a special and put together beautifully...the ingredients were delicious together...lamb sausage, fennel and broccoli rabe all served over pasta. The portion was not skimpy yet not overboard.  When I looked around the table there was hardly any food remaining on the plates that appeared to not need washing! The steak was perfect as well as the fettuccine dish. BRAVO to the Chef!  Regarding the dessert....their house-made Gelato sampler was to die for......But... Their zeppoles were the BOMB.  Now, Im originally from NJ where zeppoles are a staple at just about every pop up carnival, church function and San Gennaro festival..not to mention the shore areas. These were the best I had in all my xx years.  They were hot, not dense and sugared to perfection. I recommend the Raspberry dipping sauce which was out of this world...if only they jarred it for sale!  I would certainly visit this restaurant often...moderately priced, upscale atmosphere and great food and service. Cant ask for anything more!
Made a reservation for my wife's birthday and the food and service was top notch. Party of 8 and everyone was very satisfied.

Food was mediocre, I think you're really just paying for the name. I ordered the salmon and it was OK but for the price tag I had higher expectations.  Wasn't bad but not worth the price and don't get me wrong i am willing to pay a little more for good food but this wasn't worth it.

Puck's new Brasserie is amazing!!!  Had lunch their 3 times now and will go back all the time.  One of the best burgers I've had in town, fries are seasoned perfectly.  Also the sliced steak sandwich is amazing!!  Flavorful and great portions!!!

All our food was perfectly cooked and the flavors were complex, yet not overdone.  We had a breaded pork dish that I would never usually get. It was very good.  My wife had a lemon chicken dish that was also nearly perfect though texture was slightly off.   Dessert somewhat disappointed.  Pumpkin cannoli was overcooked.  Italian doughnuts were good though, with the exception of the caramel sauce, nothing special.  I'd go back for sure.  What stopped a 5 for me was value.
Food was good, service was very slow.   The kitchen took 40 minutes just for the appetizers.  I will not be back.

Food was good, service sucked. We had to ask our waiter to bring us plates and condiments for our pizza after waiting and realizing that he wasnt gonna bring anything unless we asked. The girl in the front was rude. There are waaayy too many restaurants on the strip to waste your money on bad customer service - wont be coming back.

Came here to find some "alone time" during a week of meetings in Vegas.  Good for small groups but perfect for solo dining.  Simple trendy Italian menu that's worth it. Comfortable, friendly, and a really good meal.  Trendy environment, but not pretentious.  Great calamari, salads and personal pizza. People watching is fun as you gaze around the Aria mall at tourist.  Noise level is average so you can hear yourself think.  Flow is quick and fun.  Great staff, great food.  It's a find outside the craziness on the strip

Vegas restaurants are usually a hit or miss; most of the time mid-priced restaurants are more a miss since they are often overpriced and their food is mediocre at best. However, this place was a pleasant surprise. The prices were higher because they were on the Strip but the food was delicious and the service was so attentive and friendly. Plus, apparently they have a happy hour at their bar that I failed to miss but their dining room service was great for me.   Mussels appetizer: This was DELICIOUS! The mussels are good but the sauce is what made this go from "pretty good" to "omg delicious" Plus, it was a generous amount that was good for the two of us there.   Lam Chorizo Pizza: Pretty good, loaded the top with lots of stuff and really flavorful   Mushroom Ravioli with Goat Cheese: YUM!! I love that it came with dozens of regular size pieces--I hate when I go to a restaurant and they give you 3 giant pieces of ravioli which you have to cut up at eat. This was really good and left me really full.   Caramelized Brussel Sprouts: True story--I've never had brussel sprouts before because Asian families don't serve it at home but the waitress kept raving about how these were better than what most people hate. First impression--it's not bad but it's not great. I'm sure it tasted better than the regular kind but ehhh I'll pass on this next time.   Good choice if you're not feeling like getting dressed up and emptying out your wallet for the fancier places but want to eat at a nice place. Plus you can use restaurant.com coupon here. Win

Came to the bar and ordered a carafe of their red wine sangria and a margarita pizza.  Bartender was cool, I had a question about a particular beer they had on tap and he provided me a sample.  Service was very good, pizza was very good and so was the sangria.  No complaints from me.

Sorry Wolfy... I never got past how terrible the seating was ...low ottoman's that were more suited to Roman style "eat lying down" than an actual meal...(I must have missed the "servent with fan feeding me grapes" option?)  ...so low that you felt your knees were in your chin...not a good way to eat.  There was a variety of heights in the restaurant,  up to tall bar-stool style...but what we were unfortunate enough to get was awful and uncomfortable.  What were you thinking man? I spent half the evening trying to stretch my legs out to relieve the cramps .  Oh yes...and they also had food and wine there.  Sent the salad back as the vinaigrette dressing was so tart it made me spit the salad out!   Ravioli was edible.    wine selection and pricing was the best thing there...not overpriced for once (that earned you back a star)

The set up was beautiful overlooking the Crystals shops in City Center.  Started with the shrimp scampi which was absolutely delicious, the perfect mix of spice and garlic with elegant presentation. While the service was attentive and the environment very calming, it seemed easy and enjoyable to take in the moment.  We decided to go with the margarita pizza, and when it arrived at the table it was hard not to be eager for the first bite.  You could taste the freshness of the ingredients, and the flavor of a true gourmet pizza was delicious. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to any travelers and locals looking for an intimate, and affordable, gourmet experience.

Excellent server! Gave great recommendations and the food was excellent! Super friendly staff and clean. Made sure our soda was filled and checked to make sure we were happy. This will be a restaurant we frequent in the future! Our appetizer was amazing!!!!

Made a reservation here, because apparently reading comprehension isn't my strong point in Vegas (read from this what you will) I thought we made the reservation at the Wolfgang restaurant in MGM, but it turned out for the best!  Our reservation was for 7, arrived just in time and were sat almost immediately. We all ordered pizzas, and they were the perfect size for us (with no leftovers which is a blessing as hotel rooms are not equipped with microwaves.) The prices are pretty reasonable for a restaurant with a well known namesake, and the people watching is OK in the middle of the mall dedicated to high end fashion.  End note: You can tell people you ate at a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, and let them assume you spent $$$$, pizza is always a good time.
I ate the Asparagus Salad, Parmesan Panna Cotta, Prosciutto dish. Was it AMAZING!!!! It was light and perfect for a late dinner. I would go here again, definitely.

Went here with the boys in Vegas one weekend.  Being hungover and miserable on a Vegas Sunday is the usual for me and this place got my taste buds rolling!  Their pizza is fantastic, the meat and pepporoni pizza is great and they will put on as much fresh grated parmesan cheese that you like!  The calamari was just on point too.  I really enjoyed this place because its smack in the middle of the MGM Grand Casino on the way towards the Garden Arena.    Very casual place to walk into and have a great pizza!

I'm only giving one star BC you can't give a half one! Our server was beyond the worst! It was like he was some sort of sociopath. He got the WORST attitude when my friend's food wasn't right. He didn't even care to right the wrong. No one said it was his fault but if the order wasn't right, fix it! Thank goodness for the guy in charge of the beverages. He was very courteous and professional.

This place is way over priced for what you get. We had a terrible pizza and the pumpkin tortellini, which was tasty but dainty as hell for a $17 entree. There were 5/6 tortellinis! I asked the waiter to bring me bread (it was cold) because I was still hungry after the tortellini :-/ I don't recommend unless you're cool with ordering a bunch of sides. The pizza was just eh. The Caesar salad was also just ok. I wasn't impressed with the food, especially since the prices are on the high side. I was expecting more flavor in the dishes but was disappointed so I wouldn't come back. The staff and atmosphere were nice though.

We'd had a big lunch that day & we're looking for something a little less fancy for dinner.  Wolfgang Puck's hit the spot!  Started with the Burrata starter -- delicious burrata and tomato bruchetta (for lack of a better way to describe it).  Yum!  Had a pizza and a pitcher of beer.  Go figure -- but it was perfect.  The pizza (it was the three or four meat one, I think?) was great.  Nice thin crispy crust, the meat toppings were crispy and cheese was bubbly and nicely browned.  High end ingredients makes a difference.  Service was good and relatively quick on the refills, clearing the appetizer plates, etc.  Definitely will go back when looking for a less structured meal in the Bellagio/Crystals area.

I'm surprised at all the rave reviews of Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria. Was it awful? Nope. Was it great? Nope. I guess I'd go with somewhere in between.   The restaurant itself is located in a great spot. It was a lot of fun to dine in the new and super upscale shopping area at City Center. The atmosphere of the place was nice...I would have liked to sit in the bar area.   We made reservations for our Saturday night dinner and there was definitely no reason to. There were only a few tables full when we arrived at 7pm. Maybe we were there a bit early? I don't know how dinner in Vegas usually works. Either way, the place was fairly empty for a Saturday night. We were given our table immediately and the server greeted us shortly after.   I have to say that if this review was based solely on service...it would get a much higher rating. Our servers were incredibly attentive: our drinks were always full, plates were removed quickly, and the servers were friendly without over-doing it.   Unfortunately, that's where the good news ends. Our food was incredibly disappointing. It wasn't disgusting, but it lacked flavor and quality. The prices weren't overly expensive (especially for Vegas), but I was expecting much more. I have had many a pizza in Phoenix that could easily kick the ass of the margherita pizza I ordered. The mozzarella wasn't fresh and the whole thing tasted fairly commercial. Wolfgang...you really let me down on this one.   So to sum this up...  Service = 5 Stars Atmosphere = 3 stars Food = 2 stars  Would I go back? Maybe...but probably not.
The food is definitely good. Unfortunately the place was nothing amazing. However the steak was on point and our server Tony was extremely friendly and helpful.
This place has great food  their quality of their food is superb  they also have special menu for lighter food .

We liked the menu. We didn't like waiting 30 minutes for our Drinks. The server was nice but nothing came out right.  My soup must have been under a heat lamp bringing out...it was hot on one side and lukewarm on the other. There was no soup spoon on the plate.  My eggplant parm was ordered with no parm!! Of course, it came out covered in parm...my husband ordered his spinach on the side-his salmon came on a bed of spinach.  Our server Bobbie Jo apologized and said she would report to her manager...she NEVER DID...when I asked why the manager never came over after she gave us the check, she said she never told him or her!! All in all, very disappointing.

Great Italian restaurant hidden in the Aria Crystal Shops. Probably the best bruschetta we've ever had. Both the rigatoni and spaghetti entrees were delicious and the sauce was super flavorful. The service was notably good, our drinks were delayed so the waitress comp'd desserts for our group. Overall a great experience.

Words cannot express how in awe I am of the food here.  Came here after my boyfriend's roommate said he'd comp our appetizers as he's a manager there.  Started with the white sangria, which is the best I've tasted in Vegas. Lots of alcohol, not too sweet.  Waiters brought us apps on apps on apps.  - Mussels in chorizo sauce was BEYOND MAJOR. At first, I wasn't even going to try it because I don't like mussels. Tried the mussels and was in like. But, THAT SAUCE blew me away. It was so hearty and flavorful, I wanted to bathe in it. Waiter even asked us if we wanted more bread for it. - Pork and Beef meatballs. Ridiculously juicy and no need for the sauces they came with. - Pork belly. Not too salty and the picked garnish it came with went sooooo well with it. My 2nd fave after the mussels.  After all those apps, I was too full to even order anything. My boyfriend ordered the salmon, which is a never fail at any restaurant. The pea puree it came with was weird to think about but, tasted amazing.  Shockingly ordered dessert after all the food; and so glad I did. The donut (holes) were steller. I think they were lemon flavor bcuz of the bits of rind in them. They came with a chocolate and carmel sauce -- THAT caramel...SO GOOD!   p.s. Get a booth by the outside. Views of Crystal are pretty!
Fantastic food, great service!  The best meal of our trip at almost half the cost of other swanky restaurants on the strip.
Service was poor and food just ok, especially for price. Also, they refused to honor Yelp promotion.

The food is good, better than average--but not stellar.  I had the yukon potato pizza, which was nicely executed and tasty.  2 others at my table ordered pasta dishes, which were OK--again, nothing to write home about.  Service was so-so: impersonal, perfunctory, the wait staff didn't seem to care whether you were there or not.  You could do worse; but you could do better, too.

The food was good generally but the service was not very good. The best dishes there was the rigatoni which was really chewy in a good meat sauce and the minestrone soup which was flavorful with chewy pieces of small, tubular pasta.  My spaghetti was pretty good too and the ribeye was decent but not amazing. Our server only came to greet us and take our order and then give us the check in the end, but throughout the meal, we had to ask the various bus boys and runners for various things. They mistakenly gave us an extra side dish which we never odered. Our food came out very slowly too even though we were one of the few people in the restaurant when we ordered.
we stopped here for a quick lunch and it was better the expected, great and very helpful service, we ordered ravioli and we got a pizza, ravioli was good, but the pizza one of the best!!!
Food was amazing and service was great. Our waiter was friendly and hilarious! Definitely recommend the sopressata pizza. Perfect crust and perfect flavors.

My wife and I stayed three nights in Vegas, and this was hands-down our best dining experience, both in terms of food quality and service quality.   Food: We had lamb ravioli (a special) and a chicken caesar salad (which was well above par for a caesar salad) and shared both the gelato and tiramisu desserts. All of the food was excellent. Portion sizes are a bit small for the price, but more than made up for in terms of quality and flavor! In fact, this was the only meal we had in Vegas that we thought was worth what we paid for it. Moreover, this was the perfect place for dinner just before heading into the ARIA to catch Cirque du Soleil's "Zarkana;" it also allowed us to avoid the restaurants within the ARIA itself.   Service: Our server was extremely knowledgeable and was able to describe each dish's preparation in great detail - it was actually very impressive. He was polite and prompt, and he and the other service staff kept our beverages consistently topped up.   Ambience: It's sort of in an exposed position in a mall, which you might think wouldn't lend itself well to an intimate dinner, but we were very happy with it. We had a table for two at the edge of the restaurant overlooking the lower level of Crystals. Noise levels were low (because who can afford to shop at Crystals? There's no one in there but store clerks!) and we were able to have a quiet, enjoyable dinner.  Overall, we had a great time and were very, very happy with Cucina - it's what I expected from the Wolfgang Puck brand.

Food was very flavorful! And decor is eloquent. Portion size are small for price.   Staff is very pleasant . I had the salmon and the broccolini. Wish it came with another side but I was content. My friend had the chicken Parmesan and it was a good portion and looked really good.

Surprisingly good and affordable, for a nice casual restaurant in the heart of Crystals.   They offer happy hour specials all night at the bar, which was actually convenient to sit at with our party of 4 as we grabbed a corner seat so that 2 people sat on each side and we were able to talk to each other easily. The happy hour menu offered some pretty good deals, a pitcher of sangria (red or white) for $18 and pale ales for $6. The handsome bartender was extremely friendly and chatty as he refilled our glasses of sangria and beer.   The food we ordered was surprisingly good. We had mushroom arancini for just $6 off the happy hour "bites" menu, calamari fritti, a insalata mista with grape tomatoes and parmesan, and a margharita pizza. While the pizza may not compare to the stuff in NYC, the marinara sauce tasted surprisingly fresh and tangy.   It was definitely nice to rewind here and get our buzz going after checking into the Aria without breaking the bank.

Located at the CityCenter Crystals shopping complex, Cucina by Wolfgang Puck caters to your drinking and food needs.  When I arrived, I wanted to cry.  I had myVegas loyalty points I could have used up here...... :'(  Got the white wine sangria. It turned out to be the best drink I had all vacation. It has fruit slices. It brings white wine and makes it sweet. Omg it tastes REALLY good and it still has the alcohol taste in there. I think it was during happy hour, so I got a dollar or two knocked off its price. I don't think I would have enjoyed the red wine sangria as much though.  Friendly service and friendly bar service as well :D

Went here with my family for an early dinner last week.  I must preface this review by saying that our waiter, Paul, was absolutely amazing.  He was attentive and knew the menu inside and out.  He recommended the chef's choice antipasti so we went with it.  It featured a number of random antipasti items on a platter to share.  It was unbelievably good!  For my entree I went with the fettuccine carbonara with a side plate of meatballs.  The carbonara was stellar and the meatballs were about as good as you can get.  The next time I visit Las Vegas I'll definitely be back for more! Highly recommended!
We came for lunch and loved it. Our server was Tony and he was amazing. The large meat and cheese board was perfect for two, and the rose was great. Highly recommend.

MEH! This place looks so fancy and all but the food is just not worth their prices. I got the clam linguinis and I simply wanted to change it to shrimp since I didn't like clams but they told me that would be an extra 2 dollars! I was like no TY since the linguini was already 14 dollars..... I  also didnt like the fact that they had happy hour but in order to get happy hour you had to sit at the bar. I mean my group was like 8 people and there was no way we wanted to sit at the bar AND eat food. I guess they're just losing business.  The bread was good though!

Outstanding! Starting with the seating all the way to the check, this restaurant is a gem! Friendly and smiling faces all over, doubled by high professionalism. Design with taste in the beautiful Crystals Shopping Center. The restaurant screams quality!  Our server, Paul, was more than just tending to our order; he really wanted us to have the best to pur taste. He suggested drinks and brought samples for whichever we wanted, to help us decide. He engaged in pleasant conversation, making our interaction with him a plus for the restaurant!  Food was beyond expectation. The antipasti are worth it: the soup I had was a perfect meal starter. But, the meal in itself was beyond doubt one of the tastiest I ever had. Marguerita Pizza for the win! The crust, the cheese, the tomatoes...there's no words for it! And you get to see your pizza in the oven. Just ask for a sneak-peak.    I still cannot explain how such a fine restaurant could practice such affordable prices. If ever in Vegas, don't miss it! We'll definitely go again!
Excellent service!! The prociutto and arugula pizza was delish!! A nice casual place for a late night snack.

My girlfriend and I came in on Tuesday (09/09) and sat at the bar around noonish. This is our first trip to Vegas And had no idea what to order. Our bartender Kristine recommended a couple dishes so we Split the minestrone soup and caprese salad which was AMAZING! Since I was still hungry I then ordered a sausage pizza And we split a pitcher of Hoegarden beer. The place was packed and seemed busy but our experience was a good one. Even though our bartender was busy she took care of us and made sure we had all we needed. I don't normally leave messages on help but we both felt that she went beyond the norm and I'd suggest to all of my friends to visit her and the restaurant. If it wasn't for our flight we would have stated longer! Can't wait to try more on our next visit!

This is one of our favorite restaurant stops! However tonight made us love it more!!! Everything in the menu is top notch!! The Chefs are super friendly!!  I recommend this restaurant and you must ask for Tony!! He's the hidden treasure! Thank you Tony for making our dinner perfect!! Xoxo Jersey loves ya!! -Giada
Turkey panini was good but they served my coworker a chicken panini that was raw in the end. Service was ok. Wish they would've checked it better. That could be dangerous.
Great food and atmosphere. The pizza and the meatballs were delicious. It took a while for our food to come out so that was the only drawback considering it wasn't busy. I'd eat there again.

Fantastic! Delicious!  Eye pleasing! Nice atmosphere!  Good service!  We had lunch there. We didn't order any meat. We had mushrooms pizza,eggplant with pasta,espresso and Pana cota for dessert.  No leftovers!

We come here for happy hour and sit at the bar. Our favorite drink is the red sangria. We usually get a pitcher. It goes down easy. The bar food off of the happy hour menu is always good. Items change every now and then. We love the Arancini. It is a nice open space st the center of city center.  The deck is wide open with a great view of the shops. The bathroom is very nice with a common wash area that is stylish.

Server Tony is a credit to the entire service community!! His menu knowledge combined with his genuine warmth will dazzle you from the start!!  The food-- omg the food will last in your best memories for a long, LONG time!!  Chef Scott has a top rate facility with an amazing staff that will make this one of best dining experiences you will ever have!!!
Came here and had the happy hour pizza and zeppole. The pizza is thin and crispy which is not the style I like but it was ok. The zeppole was ok as well. Both dishes were not good enough to return

Had margarita pizza and fries.  Wasn't to impressed with either one.  Was average at best.  Guess I was expecting a lot more because of the name, was super excited!  The worse thing of my dining experience was the service.  Me and my girl sat at the bar over 5 minutes without anyone acknowledging us!! Their was just one guest at the bar.  Will not be back!

This is one of the BEST places we've been in terms of both food and service!!! Aside from the very attentive and knowledgeable staff, the food was not only aesthetically appetizing, but delicious as well!!! Love the ambience!! And special mention to our amazing waiter, Sean!!! Highly recommended!!

Great food and stellar service!  Went for a late lunch with my family. Our server was very attentive and sweet.  We got:  Parpadelle - flavorful and delicious, meaty marinara sauce with thick and chewy noodles. 5/5  Prosciutto pizza - my favorite type of pizza did not disappoint! They could've been a bit more generous with the arugula though!  Italian fennel sausage pizza - great as well! The broccolini was a great addition:  The crust on both pizzas was great! Very chewy and not rubbery at all. My favorite part is when they came with a big Parmesan wheel and shaved off some for our food :)

Ate at this wonderful restaurant for our last dinner in Vegas. We were in the mood for Italian, and wanted a memorable last meal of our trip. We had contemplated eating at other restaurants owned by celebrity chefs, however were discouraged with reviews of small portion sizes and the expense. This restaurant I think is an exception! We had an absolutely wonderful, hearty, filling meal for less than $75 (2 entrees, dessert, one glass of wine) which I think is pretty hard to find in Vegas.  I had the rigatoni which was amazing! My husband had the pork scalopinni which was also very, very good. The gellato-so good and creamy. Our waitress was friendly, professional, and gave very good meal suggestions. Would highly recommend!

Decent fare. Nothing to rave about but nothing to really complain about.  We had the antipasti platter, seafood with squid ink pasta, and the Sea bass.  Skip the antipasti unless you really want something to nibble on. Nothing on the board was a standout.  The pasta was good. A bit salty but still good.  The Sea bass was good. Great texture, nice seasoning.   Overall decent, and with the yelp check in, a great price for a nice meal.

Came out stuffed and had a great experience. I came here for the first time for my first time in Vegas and I would have not have picked another place to eat. Our server was great and the drinks were on point. We had to get drinks and food while we were dinning in.  I don't remember the exact name of my plate but I just remember it being super good the pasta is amazing.

A bunch of my friends were all gambling it up at Aria and decided to walk over to the City Center and spotted this place. Looked like a nice spot to grab lunch/dinner. We came for lunch. We had a large party of about 11, so it took them a few minutes to set something up for us. Our waitress seemed nice at first, but she kept mixing up orders. 5 people ordered a salad, but only 4 came out and she said she thought that person wanted his salad as an entree. This happened multiple times for various things up and down the table. I am not sure if anyone came across rude to her, but I detected a hint of sarcasm in her tone later on.  We ordered some oysters - they were pretty fresh and standard also the calamari was very tasty. I ordered the Frisee salad with poached egg, lardon and bacon. This salad has to be one of the best salads I have ever had. This salad alone pretty much gives me a favorable view of this restaurant.  This next dish, I had some mixed reviews on. It was mussels with fries and the typical slice of bread. But the bread had this disgusting sauce smothered all over it. I can eat anything, but I had to tell the waitress that this sauce was a little overwhelming. Next time I ever order this, I would ask for no sauce on the bread.  I would definitely recommend this place but maybe for smaller groups. Also the price was a little steep for a lunch but hey it's Vegas.

Great service and the food is excellent. Perfect size crowd for a Wed night. Not too busy, not too dead.  I am sure it gets pretty crowded on the weekends. Awesome job on the drinks too. Tito's & tonic mixed very well!

Stopped here for dinner with my family. We had reservations through OpenTable, and although we got there early they took us right in. Service was very friendly and quick. We had two pizzas which were both very good. Also had salads which were quite tasty.   Like everything in Vegas the meal wasn't inexpensive, but the food and the excellent service made it worth it. I would go back.

3.5 Stars, Overall quite nice, but a few elements were lacking.  I went to two different places with WP in the name, and they couldn't be more different from each other. One was in the airport and was a huge disappointment. This place however, is located in a mall on the strip and was quite good for a place within a mall (very upscale).  We ordered the mussels as a starter,  two pizzas, and few sangrias. The drinks were good and very refreshing.   Were were served bread and butter to start. The bread was warm, soft, and crusty, all the qualities that good bread should have. The butter was served cold, I dont know if it was because we walked in two minutes before the kitchen closed or if that the way its normally served, but that was a negative. But the bread easily made up for this.  The mussels were steamed in a chorizo and garlic broth, and were served with some garlic bread. (picture included). The chorizo pieces (of which there were plenty) were almost better than the mussels, and ofcourse this lent to and excellent broth which we sopped up with the bread.  One of the pizzas had excellent quality toppings and both were well made. I personally prefer dough which is more chewy, but the way they cook it here is not too bad either. One pizza was a margherita, and the other had arugula and mushrooms. The margherita pizza, even though it was made on a technically good base,  was a huge disappointment.  It looked like a premade wood fired frozen pizza with a chiffonade of basil thrown on top. The cheese was also not very good, and it was definitely lacking in the tomato department.  The arugula and mushroom pizza was actually quite good. We all enjoyed it. I dont know all of the factors which made it so much better, but the cheese was completely different, and the drizzle of olive oil didnt hurt either.  The service was pretty much flawless, which is a pretty big deal given that they were just about to close when we walked in.  I would definitely visit again.

Oooh! A Wolfgang Puck restaurant!! First time eating at a celebrity chef's restaurant. We made reservations through OpenTable, love the points!   This restaurant is located inside the Crystals shopping center on the 2nd floor. You get a nice view of the shopping area too. Fancy! We were seated right away and our order was taken by the manager. Nice to know he participates. Sadly they ran out of the duck pizza. We ended up with the mushroom pizza instead.   I had the salmon with potato puree. It was lovely. Cooked perfectly still juicy and so so flavorful. My mouth was in love and wanted more. I enjoyed their complimentary bread too. Hands down the best bread I've had. Fluffy and bouncy on the inside and crunchy crisp on the outside. More please!   The pizza was so so which was sad to say since this place is supposed to be a pizzeria. They had 4 different kinds of mushrooms which was impressive, but the flavors did not excite my taste buds or put me on the edge for more. The bf had the same thought as well. Too bad we couldn't try the duck.   Tip: check out the Tickets4Less booths along the strip. They sell discounts to restaurants and can make reservations for you! We got 20% off the whole bill for $4.
I did not have food but the happy hour sangria pitchers totally worth it! Justin is awesome !

A friend was in town and every spot in Aria was completely booked... So we decided on this spot and I have no regret. Amazing!! Ordered the trout and broccolini - perfectly prepared, not oily and well plated. Thanks Wolfgang!
foods is good. casual restaurant but atmosphere ... all staffs are looks very busy.

For a popular named chief we expected more.  The environment had the feel of an American cafe rather than an Italian restaurant.  The mussels appetizer where good and the linguine with clams, shrimp and calamari had a nice spice.  The Carbonara pasta had too much salty Panchetta overpowering the sauce. The desserts were well presented and very tasty.  The waiter was very pleasant and the pricing was reasonable.
This was a delightful second floor Italian indulgence!!  I was happy the entire time I was here. First time trying eggplant and it will def NOT be my last.

I've tried this exact location twice-- first time amazing. That was in 2015.  I just tried this again in 2017 and could not have been more disappointed. We waited way more than 25 minutes to get our food. They couldn't even cook a steak correctly. Every chef should know how to cook a steak medium rare-- If you can't, I'm sorry but you don't cut it. We both ordered steak and both came out with almost no pink-- I didn't want to eat it. Not when you're spending over $40 for a NY strip.  They tried explaining to us that it is to temperature as if we were stupid.. So they cooked two new steaks, told us it would take 12 minutes. SHOCKER since it took more than 25 minutes the first time. We get the second round and we decided to eat it even though the meat didn't rest AT ALL and you could tell by the look of it. It was slightly more pink than the first one. My SO and I switched plates because his was better looking than mine. (eventually, with resting it, it looked fine) but completely mad they didn't know what they were doing. They have 6 or 8 Entrees, pasta, and pizza--how is this complicated?  I felt bad for the waiter but we were there for almost an hour and a half. To me, in Vegas, that's the last thing I want to be doing--waiting around for someone who can't cook a steak.

We go to Cucina (Wolfgang Puck Crystals Mall) often.  Most often we sit at the bar for drinks and supper.  It feels like HOME in all respects.  Good food, warm and generous service and smart pricing.   Love love the Wild Boar Pasta, Caesar Salad, meat balls, bruschetta, shrimp scampi and calamari.... trust me I have eaten a lot of Italian food everywhere and this particular restaurant keeps pulling us back in.   I would make one suggestion:  add a scoop of homemade ricotta with the meatballs.   The manager always remembers us.... AND my Favorite bartender in all of Las Vegas is Matt!

Is there a better restaurant-mogul than Wolfgang Puck?   Forget the Batalis, the Minas, the Emerils, and the other also-rans. No contemporary american chef has had the impact that Puck has.  Brasserie Puck is another home-run for him. It's in the middle of the City Center mall, Crystals. A pleasant atmosphere, excellent service, and great casual french-bistro food combine to make BP worth the very long walk from the parking lot.  I had the Bistro Burger that comes with fourme d'ambert, my favorite cheese. It's a mouth-widening creation made with house-ground prime filet, and I never thought I'd say this but it's a serious threat to Bradley Ogden's rein as the best high-end burger in town.  The wine list is full of well-chosen, fairly-priced selections. And the management/service aspect is terrific. (My waiter had actually tasted every wine-by-the-glass on the list and therefore could make thoughtful recommendations.)  On top of that, there is a 25% discount for locals until the end of April, which makes Brasserie Puck an even more appealing destination.  I'm planning to go back soon because I've heard their Tuna-Burger is to die for.

This is one of the nicest Wolfgang Pucks in the Vegas area. The ambiance is amazing and it's in Crystals where everything is nice so it helps. The menu is a bit different from some of the other Pucks and the Spaghetti & Shrimp is my favorite. Service is usually good but can be spotty. I live at Veer condo right above Crystals so they give me 20% off. I think they may extend that courtesy to all locals. Great place to have both a business lunch or a romantic dinner.  UPDATE: I had to downgrade my review because this place is inside Crystals and Crystals is not a place that is very welcoming.
Great meal - we had spaghetti and meatballs, pasta puttanesca, chicken parmigiana. All fabulous. Great waiter, Tony. We will be back soon!!

I just had a beer and salad for quick bite. Ate at the bar - bartender was friendly. The menu looked pretty good but I just had the salad before going to a bigger dinner.  It was a basic green salad with very sweet tomatoes - very fresh and tasty. I will be back to try some other items.

Located at the Crystals Shopping Plaza at the Aria, this restaurant is one awesome spot.  First off, I love the Aria already.  Everything about it screams class and beauty.  This restaurant is no different.  The host was exceptional, the waiter was one of the coolest I've met during our stay in Vegas.  He was courteous and actually pretty fun to talk to as we conversated about my awesome watch for a good 5 minutes.  Needless to say, service is awesome here.  As for the food.   I decided to pick up the pasta linguine while my friend had the Sautéed Chicken Piccata.  Both our dishes were absolute delicious.  The downer was my pasta was a bit bland in terms of flavor but overall everything else was solid.  The shrimps and clams were so freshly made.  The texture was beautiful and the taste was pretty good.  We kicked it there for a good hour plus just hanging and talking.  Then the dessert menu came out.   I actually forgot what the name of the dessert was but its basically 3 scooped flavors of ice cream or gelato and they tastes really good.  Actually really really really good.  I could have eaten them all day but goddamnit I was so full.  Well done Wolfgang Puck.    Overall this was definitely a great dining choice on my part.  Great service, excellent quality food and a great ambiance creates an incredible dinner experience for my friend and I.  I will definitely be back here again next time I'm in town.  Too good to pass up.  Give it a try.

Surprisingly food.    1. There is an all day happy hour.  Not the best deal but $6 beer and wine is not bad.   2.  Happy hour includes a few appetizers. 3. You can order half portions!  Half a salad, half pasta/pizza.    Since you are in the Crystal's, it is a bit quieter.  I had dinner around 7pm on a Thursday night at the bar with a Sofia Loren movie playing in the background.  It was a lovely meal.    By the time I left around 8, it was starting to get a bit crowded.  But food, ambiance, and staff were all pleasantly surprising.    Having been to many a "celebrity chef" establishment in Las Vegas, I was not expecting the affordable, pleasant meal I had but it was great!

HUGE TURN OFF when your waiter asks how your meal is, and you inform him that your steak is tough & seems overcooked...  AND HE RESPONDS WITH, "Guess it wasn't that bad, you're still eating it."  Uuhhhmm, okay?!  Thanks for making my Bday so memorable, I guess.   +++Too bad he had nooo ideaaa of the previous restaurant ordeal & how I didn't get to eat at all so I was STARVING out of my mind!!  I DO NOT send food back to be re-fired or re-made; I send it back to stay, period.  Hence my tummy situation when we got here for an early dinner.  Our lunch experience elsewhere was such that the kitchen failed to remove the melted Swiss cheese from my dish despite my clear request & our server's acknowledgement that the ticket stated this... meaning the kitchen simply made a mistake.  It happens.  But I can't do Swiss cheese!  So even though I was hungry, I literally could not eat it.  It was sent back & I sampled my friends' dishes to hold me over.+++  Having been to Ramsay's restaurants, Nobu, & others of culinary genius, we came to (Puck's) Cucina with high expectations.  Ordered the calamari & a pizza for appetizers.  Both were yummy.  Real talk, I'd come back for that pizza!    I ordered the ribeye special cooked medium-rare.  Now I don't know what was wrong with this steak, but ribeye is my cut & I make a mean cast iron seared, oven broiled ribeye at home.  ***This was theee absolute toughest, chewiest, bubble-gummiest, spit-out-several-bites-because-I-was-tired-of-chewing-est, most bland ribeye I've ever had!!***  Like, beyond being overcooked, the texture was such that I THINK THEY RAN OUT OF THE RIBEYE SPECIAL & tried to pass off a cheap chuck steak, bottom sirloin, or other lower quality cut.  It was sooo tough, but looked only slightly overcooked.  I didn't understand at all.  But I was so hungry by this point, I just enjoyed my side veggie & ate what I could of the horrible steak as opposed to sending it back to stay.    I had to ask the waiter's assistant for salt because our server went MIA for a bit after bringing our food.  Others in our group also needed salt...  namely, the salmon entree and the pasta dish, both of which I tasted.  The chicken parm was tasty as-is.    Later when our server came over to ask about the need for salt & how our meal was tasting...  I was honest.  Mine was a bit bland, very tough, and appeared overcooked.  Funny that even the waiter commented, "Maybe you just happened to get that one weird ribeye."  Yeah, I bet.  Then he added, " Guess it wasn't that bad, you're still eating it."  I didn't even bother explaining to him that (1) I have a rule about sending food back to be re-made... (2) how I was pretty hungry from my earlier fiasco... (3) we were in town celebrating my BDAY!...  since he clearly wouldn't have cared anyway.  He did end up bringing a complimentary dessert item for my troubles.   Given his "I really don't care about you" attitude, I wish I had sent it back & gone hungry a little longer so as not to pad his personal bottom line (tip)--  the ribeye special was $55.    I would only come here for appetizers & drinks... and even then, they would need to address the terrible service/ attitude I received.

This is a great little pizza place in a great location as others have stated.  The food is good with a mix of great, OK, and so-so foods that we ordered.  Service was very good and is a place well worth going to for a nice lunch in Vegas.  My family ordered calamari for an appetizers that was good (3 Stars).  For our main course we ordered the cheese pizza (4 stars) and the prosciutto pizza (3 stars) for five of us, and some chicken fingers with fries (4 stars) for our 3 yr old.  Everything came out in a timely manner other than the chicken fingers that took a little longer.  Service was good with water in cups and making sure everything was OK.  Overall a 3.5 star place with good service so a 4 star eating location.  This is one of the cheaper nice locations to eat at too in the area.

My girlfriends salmon was good and the service was pretty satisfactory. Just consumers beware of the steak! I had to spit out and cut off about 3/4s of it because it was so fatty. Perhaps it would have been better had I not gotten the steak.

Wow, I was pleasantly surprised. I came here thinking that it was going to heavy, unhealthy and greasy food. But it wasn't. The food was delicious. The server was very attentive. Great dinner after all.
Expensive veal scallopini tasted like it was from the OLIVE GARDEN. The service was a little slow. Overpriced.   They need a menu do over
Great food  Great service Amazing time! Ask for Apollo. Great guy with great service!  Highly recommended!
The speciality Italian meats and cheese platter appetizer was amazing. The spaghetti and meatballs was also really awesome. Definitely would recommend!

So my sister was leaving town last Friday and we had not made our way to Crystal's (City Center) right next to Aria Hotel. Is it Crystal's?  Is it City Center?  Too many names and confusing!  Anyway, we sat at the bar where HAPPY HOUR is offered all the time.   Bartender took his sweet time to take our order and there were only two other people sitting at the bar. It was only like 3 p.m.    It took him 15 minutes to get our drink ORDER.   We were sitting at the bar?  FINALLY he took our order, I ordered the stuffed peppers with goat cheese.  These are tiny nibbles so don't expect a huge portion. The pepper is the size of a grape.  But the flavor is fantastic.  I LOVE GOAT CHEESE. They drizzle some olive oil on it so for me, it was perfect.  We had some red sangria which I recommend and the pizza with Arugula and mushroom. That's always my go-to.  I do have to say the next bartender that came on shift was a delight and seemed more on the ball, so the knucklehead that was there earlier gets a one star!   They do serve gluten free pasta here too.  I think next time, I'll sit at a table!

Totally underwhelmed. Chef Boyardee wouldn't can the ravioli I was served. First I was upset by the small portion, then I was grateful for the mercy of it. My wife's carbonara was equally bad. No creme, no flavor, all oil with a ton of pepper. Vegas mall foodcourt quality at best.

Thanks for the Yelp app and OpenTable.com available on my phone, I ended up here with the family for Christmas Eve dinner. I liked how I made a reservation online while standing outside the restaurant; yay points!  Anyway, I read fellow Yelpers' reviews sounded and it sounded promising although I usually avoid Wolfgang Puck's restaurants (haven't had a good track record.) For starters, the service was sub-par; yes I understand it's Christmas Eve but common, 40 minutes for thin crust pizza. The people around us came in later and were on dessert when we got our food. (Side note: the salad and calamari appetizer; YUM; came very promptly.) Then it took forever to get the check, then even longer for the receipt. Plus the manager went around to ask other tables how their meals were and to wish them happy holidays but not us.   Sorry I digress, back to food. The pizza was not very tasty. The prosciutto was so bland and the lamb chorizo was...okay. Sadly I will not be back.

i've been to some pretty underwhelming puck joints, but this one was fantastic. truly great pizzas, balanced in flavor. great crusts, i mean really great. i had the side with the beans, peas and mint and it was delicate and wonderful. great service and kind of a fun thing to eat in that interesting space.

this is a great place to visit while shopping (the ambience in city center can't be beat, in retreat from hordes of tacky tourists on the strip). the pizza is not exactly of must-taste caliber. ingredients here sound interesting but don't deliver anything too memorable. nevertheless, i can't stop dropping by-it's like she's my vegas trophy wife.  sit at the bar and get a pitcher or two of the tasty(authentic) sangria-strong and sweet! service is always great. prices are surprisingly low whether or not you make it to the bar(nothing on the bar happy hour menu jumps out, so far).

I was reeled in by all the good reviews of this place, so while I was in Vegas I dropped by for a bite.  While the service at the bar wasn't that great (we weren't drinking, so that may have had something to do with it), the food was excellent.  I went with the gnocchi, which I read rave reviews about, and it was delicious.  The bread, of course, was great, too.  The prices, for Wolfgang Puck's name at Crystals in Vegas, are actually quite reasonable.  This place has my vote.  I will definitely drop by again next time.

This place was amazing, food was great and the service let me tell you it couldn't get any better than that. Oh and can't forget we had an awesome waiter named Tony his service and staff were amazing.
Ordered the ribeye steak.  It's been dry aged and really yummy!  The doughnuts are also great!

Happy Hour: All day at the bar HH Specials: $5 sangrias, $7 select cocktails, and lots of small bites  I want to preface that this review is only for their happy hour/bar experience. I got both of the sangrias and shared a plate of wings and tiramisu. I was not a fan of either sangrias but if I had to choose, I preferred the white one because the sprite complimented it much better than the red. I'm not a fan of carbonated sangrias and almost wished I asked about it before ordering.  The wings however were delicious! Reminiscent of the seasoning in Thai MAMA noodles. They were fried to perfection and was properly seasoned! The tiramisu was a little disappointing. I get that HH food is usually smaller portions with less effort but this baby tasted like it was popped out of its packaging and stuck on a plate.   All in all, it was an okay happy hour. I'd love to come back to actually dine in to see if the experience is different.

So Wolfgang Puck...isnt he suppose to be some outrageous mastermind Chef. which recipes exploding with flavor? I dint know I think I might of missed something because I was not in pressed.   Our party was huge so we had the VIP area. The location is in Crystals which is a very nice upscale shopping center. The service was very good for such a large party. So thumbs up to them.   So lets talk food...my husband and I both ordered pizza. We were both disappointed in the pizza. It was very very plain and lacked that explosion of flavor you would think Wolfgang Puck would have. Our friends ordered lasagna which looked very good. There were also various pasta dishes ordered as well within our party. One thing that surprised me was the potion sizes. They are very small. But I guess you pay for the taste not the size? I was still hungry.  You may like this place. SErvice is great, prices are not to high for the area and you dont need to be to dressy, but that doesnt mean wear flip flops and shorts. And I am sure there is something better than pizza on the menu for your dining experience!!

Amazing! Apolo, our server, was very accommodating and nice. He let us know the right wine for our meals and was super knowledgeable about the food. I loved the flavors of the dishes. I had the Ravioli with bolognese sauce that was very succulent and rich. I would totally come back again on our next visit to Vegas. Perfect Italian flavor in good portions -- well done Wolfgang !

This place was a huge disappointment! The service here as terrible and the lady at front desk was snotty. Our server was even worse and you could tell that he hated his job. He took forever to take our order and didn't come around very much to check on us. The food was ok and nothing special. The food lacked so much flavor and was very bland. The bill was pricey for crappy service and crappy food which I hate paying for. The area that the place is located in is in the crystal shops mall and is is really nice but that is the only thing that is nice about this place. I would not come back to this place. You have been warned!

Decided to grab something to go and while we waited I got some bruschetta which was ok..i wouldn't get it again nothing special but the white sangria was delicious and it sparked up a convo with the three guests next to us.  We ordered the calamari with i think a basil aioli sauce? it was DELICIOUS!! i sure loved it over the normal marinara sauce. We also got the spaghetti and meatballs which i highly recommend! I cant wait to go back i wish they had one closer to home!

The hostess was extremely slow, but other than that we had a pretty good experience.   My boyfriend and I ordered: Calamari Prosciutto pizza  What we loved: calamari, lightly battered, lightly fried, very very tastey.   I loved my experience here. All the staff was very friendly and tentative. We rarely get service like this back in the city, which makes me love this place so much more. The food was delicious, but I do have to say it's a little on the pricey side.   Next time I come, I'll definitely check out what the happy hour is all about.

Had Lunch here. Located in the Crystal Shops, its a charming little spot with friendly staff and good food. There was plenty of bread, but it was rather hard, and not freshly baked.   I ordered a calamari appetizer which was great! The caesar salad and Scampi  dish were well done, but not outstanding. I would certainly dine here again.

I only came here because it was open and it was close to my hotel, and I'm glad I did!  We had the duck confit pizza, the caramelized brussel sprouts, and a risotto special.  The duck confit pizza was delicious, but the brussel sprouts are to-die-for! I normally don't like brussel sprouts, but my sister loves them, and the waiter was sold on them, so I thought I'd open my mind a little and give them a try. They blew my mind away! This is one dish that shouldn't just stay in Vegas!!!  The risotto special was just okay - I don't even remember it much - that's how memorable it was.  Moral of the story: TRY THE BRUSSEL SPROUTS!

The pizza here is really good!  Also try the Red wine Sangria...it was amazing.  The only reason I give 4 stars is that after ordering a $8 bottle of san Pellegrino, I found an oily film on the surface of my glass, it was probably parmesan.  I informed the waitress and she could have given us a new bottle or taken it off our bill.  Pretty much half the bottle had to be thrown out.  The food was great though and I'd recommend it, nice location and ambiance as well.

Perhaps this is more of a "quick tip" than a review, but here's what I can say: Sit at the bar.  Order the small bites and a pitcher of sangria, and escape the tremendously high prices around you with above average, branded food at above average prices.  WPP&C has a happy-hour-esque bar menu with small bites--like stuffed peppers, mushroom pasta balls, and small-portion paninis.  Prices are reasonable, and the food is tasty, if not particularly different from food you could get at a Wolfgang Puck in an airport.  3.5 stars, rounded up because everything else in Crystals includes prices that makes one's head explode.

OMFG, the food here is freaking delish!  Came here for dinner with the parents.  Had a bad tummy (yeah, shouldn't have had froyo since I hadn't had dairy in like 2 weeks, Pepto didn't help).  Got the pizza with a few modifications (no dairy & no leafy veggies).  Had to get something a bit on the low fat side (high fat intolerance).  The Italian Sausage pizza did the trick.  The roasted garlic added a certain kick to the pizza & didn't over-empower the dish.  There was constantly someone walking around to see if customers were happy.  Love, love, love that!  I got a ginger lime soda or tea of some sort.  Sooo delish!  The food came a bit out late, but was well worth it.  The food is a bit pricey, but worth every penny for the fresh ingredients & the well balanced dishes.  Ambience was cool & airy.
The beet salad with goat cheese was sweet and had perfectly blended flavors.  The atmosphere is okay as it is in the middle of a shopping area; our table was right by the escalator.

Cute place at Aria. The food was OK but I wouldn't name it one of Wolfgang Puck's best restaurants. The beets on my salad were a little bland. Also, the server kept pouring wine on our glasses as if he wanted us to finish the bottle quickly so we could order another one. On one occasion, I had to actually stop the guy because my glass was more than halfway full. There was no need to continue to pour wine in there. Finally, my pasta had great flavor; however, it was a bit too salty. I do have to say that everything had a beautiful presentation. Would I give this place a second chance? Possibly.

I order 2 of each dish for Togo... after 45 minutes, I only received 1 of each order... they at least charge me correctly... I'm not about to go back again and take another order and wait for another 45mins...
Apollo was our waiter and he was just fantastic. Would come back again. Food was phenomenal.

The food was delicious and the service stupendous. I'd go back anytime.  We started with the Sausage Pizza andbit was very good with sausage,  broccoli florets and Green Peppers. We had a side of meatballs that was delicious.
Ok not what I expect from the name Wolfman Puck a good chef. Food very like going to Denny's or Applebee

The place is pretty dead but the food is great. If you want a casual lunch with great food, i highly recommend the place. I got the spaghetti and added meatballs which were delicious.  Meatballs were very soft and tender and the spaghetti sauce was on point.  Add in great service and this place gets 4 out of 5 stars.  We also split the caesar salad to start which was also great. A little light on the dressing so we asked for more

We did a dinner for 4 here and went with a family style pre-set Sunday dinner menu of various things they brought out including desserts.
