Was overall real good with appetizers of calamari, artichoke bruschetta and salad, then came mains of raviloi, a real good white fish, super good spicy chicken cooked under a brick a noodles in a meat sauce.Dessert was an apply crumble thing and little donut balls to dip in vanilla sauce. Not crazy expensive but plenty of food for everyone. Good service too.

Decent place on the Las Vegas strip. I wasn't impressed for the price, but that's the Vegas mark-up, I guess.  I ordered the gnocchi in bolognese, which was solid if plain. I expected a bigger size for the entree, especially compared to my friend's side dish of mac and cheese, which had more than twice the amount of pasta. That struck me as strange. I'm also not 100% convinced that the bolognese is totally authentic, but I may be a stickler for it since I make it, myself.   The sangrias are cheap and yummy.  I would not return - there are so many restaurants on the strip, might as well find one I actually really enjoy!
Great wait staff, amazing barrel-aged Old Fashioned, delicious meal. Thanks again!
It was the meal Friday night. I ate the meal. The meal was pleasant. It did not have the flavor of saffron. It was still pleasant. Thank you.

Five stars don't cut it for this restaurant. This place is crack. They lure you in with their amazingly cheap prices and you get the biggest trip of your life. I tend to walk around my chair when I get a dish that is tasty, well here, I walked around the bar... TWICE!  I went for lunch and they have this great deal for a prix-fix for $25. Choice of three appetizers, 3 entrees and 2 dessert. The fact that I'm writing this review after the entree, means that I know dessert is going to be stellar.  I started with the prosciutto which was accompanied with a burrata which was to die for. Very creamy served at the right temperature.  The entree I went for basil ravioli. I don't know what it was filled with, but I do know that I cleaned my plate... The sauce, the filling, everything was just great.  Now I just did my third lap around the bar after I tasted my tiramisu. Light and delicious, perfectly balanced.  Did I mention everything is dirt cheap compared to other "good" restaurants in Vegas? Prosecco for $9, all entrees below $30.  Sherlynn was a great bartender. Easy to talk to, sweet and on point  For a moment, you think your no longer in a mall, but it brings your senses to Italy. They should change the interior and music a little to match the Italian lifestyle

Had lunch here, actually was trying to find somewhere a little different but ended up here - WHY?  Because I've NEVER had a bad meal at a Wolfgang Puck restaurant.    The food was fantastic, we started with a Prosecco and wanted to keep it light (so we could hit the happy hours later....).  We shared the muscles with Chorizo.  They were perfectly cooked and the chorizo was excellent in the sauce.  Not over powering, just flavorful.  If you like muscles, a MUST TRY.    We then shared a Prosciutto Pizza with Mascarpone Cheese, Arugula & Aged Balsamic.  WOW - Light, flavorful and everything was great together.  I wish I could buy the balsamic they used, not overpowering at all.  The Mascarpone cheese on the pizza was also a nice surprise.  The ingredients were fresh and the food was simple, that's the sign of good Italian food!  I'll definitely try to recreate this at home.    I've eaten at the Airport Wolfgang Puck Express restaurants, Spago and many in between - he's done a great job at keeping the food consistently great at every level.

Good food.  Enjoyed a great pizza with pesto and prosciutto; good spaghetti with meatballs; and  so-so tomato caprese salad.  That said, the atmosphere was as cold as this beautiful but frigid designer mall.
Great food. The pasta and bread is so filling. Their wine selection is really large and quite good. Like the location (no smoke). Atmosphere is really nice. Great service. Will definitely come back.
Delicious food and great service.  We went with a big group and were not disappointed. Pizza is yumalicious.

We came in because we had a bogo from myvegas. It was a Tuesday evening and we were the only people there. I was kind of hoping for pizza because they looked really good on the pictures i stalked on yelp. However, the bogo was for the meals. I ended up with the burratta raviolis and bf had the chicken piccatta. We really liked the attention to detail. At one point, our waiter came by and said he had the kitchen redo my bf chicken because it was overcooked. It seem a bit strange since the kitchen was not busy but i did like that our waiter didn't wait for us to complain about it. My raviolis were really good but I think the sauce could have been better. Our waiter did a great job recommending wine. I normally don't like merlot but he recommended one. Since I mentioned i dont usually drink merlot, he asked if i would like to try a couple. He gave me a blind taste of a few, and lo and behold, I liked the merlot best.

Best restaurant experience I've had in Las Vegas - ever. Apolo was our server and he was so fantastic. There were five of us and we got an assortment of things across the menu. We took advantage of the half price wine list that runs Monday through Wednesday. The mozzarella in the caprese salad was unbelievably fresh and the salmon was the best I've had in a very long time. If I could give more than five stars for Apolo's friendly demeanor and amazing service I would. Can't wait for our next trip to Las Vegas, because this is definitely somewhere we will go again.
The service was nice, food took a long time to come but that's not the issue, the issue is quality. Pizza was okay for the U.S. but from such a name and such a price I expect excellent.
Yummy the linguine clam. We have lunch there today, good view and ambience. The dessert tiramisu is also great. The location is also good, and this should be one of the best choice in this area.
Food was delicious. Our server, Javier, was friendly and knowledgeable. Tony the manager was personable and hilarious. 13/10 would dine again because y not.
Un des meilleures restaurant à Las Vegas. À part que le resto est dans un centre d'achat. L'ambiance est bien mais la bouffe est merveilleuse.

I was so fortunate to stop by last week. I loved the new iteration of the mushroom pizza with leeks, and the old fashioned was quite yummy. I might have to make this my new go-to spot at Center Strip!

I stopped here because my brother had recommended it to us. Our waitress, Lauri, was amazing, she took time to teach us a bit about wine, which was pretty neat. She even gave me a special birthday treat. :) Our portions were great, food was good...Maybe a bit too salty on one of the dishes, but that would be our only complaint.

I went here to kill some time while the wife shopped; have some sangria at the bar and had a long conversation about food with the bartender.  The sangria was little too sweet so he took it off the bill and made me another delicious cocktail.  I finally ordered a few apps which were good but the one that really got me excited was pizza lardo.  It's cured pig fat on top of a piece of pizza dough.  Its sounds gross but since I never tried it and I'm a big prosciutto fan I figured I should give it a try.  It was amazing; I actually went back the next day to order it again but it was a special and they didn't have anymore.  Great service, good food and a new experience gives it 4 stars.

I enjoyed my dinner a lot. I ordered the linguine and the prosciutto pizza. Both were very tasty. I especially recommend the linguine!!  Other than the food, the service here is very on point. Theres also happy hour all day. The drinks are very affordable. Overall, this is a good date spot. When I was eating here with friends, there are many couples enjoying their time at the bar.

I came here for a celebration of my girlfriend late birthday and it was a great time. We told them ahead of time that it was her birthday and they treated us very well. They even printed out personalized menu's for her birthday that had the specials.   The food was great as well. Me and my girlfriend shared spaghetti and meatballs and an Italian sausage pizza the spaghetti was very flavorful and the meatballs were perfect. Tender and tasty. The pizza was a good thin crust and a pretty decent size.   Thanks for taking care of us Evan
Sat at bar. Good meal. Pappardelle as my main course. Solid dish.

Great place to grab a bite if youre around the Crystals shopping area/ Aria proximity. The restaurant is situated overlooking the Crystals shops which gives you near perfect view for people watching!  Food was pretty good, def worth trying/ coming here for a meal.

The place was very good, but one of the waitresses gave special recommendations of food which is see food plata, it turns out so dry see food with out any sausage and when we want to lay it was so expensive 95$ which doesn't deserve

Our first time at this Wolfgang puck cucina and from reading all the reviews, we did expect good food and surely Wolfgang did not disappoint.  Pros:  happy hour at the bar all day, so some food items, wings, cheese, meats for $6-8 and drinks (sangria -white/red -$6 and three varietal of wines ranging from $5-8 a glass as well as beer)  Pasta dishes are pretty amazing, we had the pappardelle and linguine with seafood and white wine.   Cons:  the pizza we had was nice and crispy as requested but wasn't amazing - margarita - possibly the prosciutto with arugula may be a better choice or the mushroom with a hen egg.  The free bread is also quite fresh however our server was pretty slammed so we had to request it rather than getting it while we waited, we actually got it after getting our pizza and we sat for about 10-15 minutes before we got that. So that takes it down one star and I had to ask multiple times for a water refill. So although service is decent when he is not slammed but over the impression that there was more care to the four top next to us because they had a lot of specific needs.   Pricing wise- it's decent for the location, considering every store in this mall is high retail and brand name only. You would expect clientele that can afford to be in there.
Attentive staff. Fancy pants place but the price is right. Not cray expensive. Pizza was good.

After wandering around the Strip aimlessly for a half hour looking for decent places to eat that won't break the bank and that aren't filled with all the crazies that hit up Vegas on Memorial Day Weekend, we ended up on Wolfgang's Pizzeria in the Crystal's shopping center between Aria and the Cosmopolitan.   It wasn't my first choice since I've eaten at his restaurants several times before, but his restaurants never let me down.   I forget which cocktail I had exactly--just remember that it was good.   We had the Italian Cured Meat Platter with pepper relish (which i could have eaten by itself with a spoon) and the Wood Fired pizza with sausage, ramps, and peppers. Both were classic and delicious as expected.   Our waitress was friendly, easy-going, and prompt. And the atmosphere was very chill.

A group of us had been pretty much drinking and walking around the strip all day until we got hungry and stumbled into this place.  (i dont even really remember where it is).  I think we were attracted to all their tvs showing the NBA playoffs.  Its a pretty fancy spot with a nice, intimate environment and elegant decor [I think].    I ordered the veal ravioli and a side of carmelized brussel sprouts.  I devoured my delicious baby cow stuffed pasta within minutes and shared my brussels, which the whole table agreed were amazing.  They were the best brussel sprouts I have ever consumed in my entire life (sorry mom).  But I seemed to be the only person super impressed with my meal. Everyone else seemed to say their food was just OK.  Aside from the food being good, the service was kinda wack for a nice restaurant.  The dude spilled hella our Sangria while he was pouring it, even on one of the girls legs, and on top of that, they took forever to bring just a side of ranch.  If you go, order the brussel sprouts and pour your own drinks if you can.

Food was mediocre and, even though our waiter was nice and attentive, he was so dang animated that it grew tiresome. He greeted us with what seemed like a song and dance show. However, the low star rating only reflects the food. The linguine was a bit flavorless and the pasta had a texture similar to whole wheat pasta, so I didn't really enjoy that. The chicken was nice and tender and flavorful. We also got the appetizer mussels and bruchetta. Mussels was in a red sauce that I wasn't too fond of and they only have two small slices of bread to dip the sauce in. The bruchetta had a great flavor but I didn't like how the bread was so thin, the sauce ws quick to soak up the bread and sog it up. Prices here are pretty decent compared to other Vegas places, but it's not some place I'd crave for.

Great service. Disappointing pizza. Luke warm, unimpressive, bland...not up to WP standards. Nothing close to the beautiful pizzas on this site. Far better options nearby to give up a good meal on this choice.

I give then 3 stars based on food and drink quality. It was our service that was awful. I had to call to our server at nearly every point in the meal, from initial drinks, starters, main meal, follow drinks and the bill. To sum it up, no chance we'll return. The pear martini  was very good, I had 2 of them.

An excellent start to Restaurant Week! My friend and I had a great meal and I look forward to returning to Cucina in the future.  We shared most of the Restaurant Week menu and added an Italian Meat Pizza. I loved the freshness and flavor of everything we tried.  *Summer Panzanella Salad- fresh ingredients with croutons that were slightly softened without being soggy from the dressing *Sweet Corn Ravioli- amazing, the flavor was on point and I loved the burrata in the middle of the dish *Chicken Piccata- one of the best piccatas I've had with a great tasting sauce and delicious vegetables  *Italian Meat Pizza- delicious meat and olives on a nice, thin crust *Tiramisu- perfect texture and taste *Chocolate Budino- loved the chocolate flavor and the firm chocolate cake pieces with the delicious cherries  I loved the ambiance of the restaurant. The restaurant is in the middle of the Crystal shops with a bright, open dining room. The service was attentive and friendly. No complaints on the service.
Great great service, Jeremy at the bar was awesome!! Manager on duty was also super friendly!!  Recommend pork belly slider on happy hour menu

After doing some major shopping damage at Crystals, my friend and I worked up an appetite and ended up at Cucina by Wolfgang Puck.  They offer all day happy hour at the bar, but we opted for a table to try their menu.   Bruschetta (Special of the Day) - It comes with 3 pieces of bread, drizzled with balsamic and pesto, topped with cherry tomatoes, cheese, and greens.  Great way to start the meal!  The pesto was a nice touch to make it unique.  It's crunchy, a little acidic, fresh, and sweet.  Frito Misto - Fried calamari, shrimp, cauliflower, shishito peppes, onions, and slices of lemon.  My favorite dish that we had that day.  Everything is lightly coated and fried to perfection.  The two aioli that comes with it is a chili aioli (orange colored) and a lemon aioli (white colored).  Both pair beautifully with everything.    Fettucini Carbonara - The noodles are made in house.  You can order either a half or full order of pasta.  We got a full order and the server brought it out in two plates so we can share, which was very nice of him.  The fettucini comes with pancetta and zucchini with a light cream sauce.  Half an order is a good amount for one person!   I had a great experience during lunch!  The food was really good, everything is reasonably priced, and our server was spot on with his recommendations and service.  Definitely excited to go back and try other things on the menu!
Food is great, service is great.  Classy place to eat. Had lunch here with a friend, more quiet than places on the strip.

I came here for a birthday party and they did not have many dairy free options for me . I believe there was only one entree which was the fish and that same night I got terribly sick from it . I paid a lot of money to get sick from a place that only had one option for me . Servers were very nice though that's why there's a star .
Stopped in on one of the few rainy days in LV and could have spent the afternoon. Small plates were great. Try the house aged ole fashioned and ask for Tony.
good for groups, staff is pretty understanding and patient. they have a full bar and is reasonably priced. great place to hang out before you dance your face off at marquee

I wish I could give more than 3 stars for Cucina by Wolfgang Puck at  Crystals, but unfortunately I cannot.  Let me start by saying that the food is very tasty.  My husband and I ordered 2 pizzas (Italian Meat and Mushroom), and a Caesar Salad.  The food came out hot and delicious.  It's the service that brought down my stars.  We were greeted when we walked in and seated.  Sadly, our server never once came to our table.  I can't remember his name, but he was nowhere to be found.  If it wasn't for the server assistant who provided excellent customer service, we would have left.  In fact, when we were finished our lunch, we asked to speak to the manager.  We didn't really complain to him, we just wanted to make sure our tip and recognition was given to the young man who helped us and not the real server.
Great spot to catch a brew and watch a game, ask for Billy he's a great bartender and super friendly. Excellent food and calm environment to relax and eat. I recommend to anyone

Delicious!! I got the Caprese salad (best tomatoes I've ever had, super flavorful pesto, ok mozzarella), and my dining partners each got a pizza- eggplant pizza and the mushroom pizza was fontina, both of which I tried and loved. Service was excellent, water refills like clockwork...really, really impressed!  I am a total celebrity chef whore anyway, but this was legit good.

Very good unprenentious Vegas restaurant. Good Italian food in the middle of the Crystal shops/upscale mall. Open plan and good service. The pasta is good here and the value is decent compared to most overpriced places in Vegas!

We stumbled upon this place by accident. I was alittle skeptical about this place (we've tried Puck's before and found it generally over-rated). We were pleasantly surprised! Although it was fairly empty, the ambiance, service, and menu compelled us to try this place. I had the Tuna burger. I have to say that it was the best Tuna burger that I've ever had. The flavor and rare cooking with perfect. It was served with "promme frite" fries cooked crispy and perfectly seasoned. I can only imagine with the beef burger tastes like. This place is a must if you're in the City Center located just outside Aria (skip Todd English's pub)!

A VERY SOLID EXPERIENCE...  Cucina saved the day...on a crazy Saturday night in Las Vegas we booked another $$$$ restaurant, with the expectations that it would be as good as Friday's dinner...well Yellowtail at Bellagio really sucked...and we left hungry and frustrated that our (lofty) ideals for Vegas eating were not met.   So we decided to stroll through Bellagio and then in Vdara (to see a condo unit), and finally into Aria (and Crystals Mall at Aria) to shop...our tummies were grumbly and we were sore over dropping $200 on NOTHING, and so we went back to Cucina (we had been there last year), and were greeted immediately by a smiling hostess, seated right away, and got Tony as our waiter. We ordered two handcrafted pizzas, and chowed down...DAMN THEY WERE GOOD.  - One was Italian sausage, greens, and hot peppers. - The other was margherita, tomato, and basil.  Both were LIGHTS OUT GOOD.   - Service was fast. - Food was amazing. - It was a simple follow-up plan after an terrible $200 dinner.   Could not go wrong here and we ate for $40 and should have gone here in the first place. Oh well, live and learn in Vegas!  ENJOY!
Great Pizza and the asparagus was fantastic. Would eat here again in a heartbeat. Good service and reasonable prices for Vegas.

Came here for a business dinner while in Vegas. I would have given them 4 stars, but the service was inattentive.   I ordered the Fettucini Carbonara, which was fettucini with zucchini and pancetta in a cream sauce. The pancetta was very flavorful and brought a smoky flavor to the dish. The prices are a bit high for Italian food, but what do you expect for Vegas and a Wolfgang Puck restaurant.

Situated near the Aria gateway of Crystals, Wolfang Puck is pirched on the second level near Cartier & Harry Winston. They carry an all-day-everyday happy hour at the bar, and there's a variety of small plates and bigger dishes & cocktails ranging from $4-$16.  We decided to pass on the hh and split the eggplant and garlic spinach pizza with an add of chicken, $20. The mozzarella was light so the pizza didn't feel heavy to eat. The pieces of white meat chicken were delicious - perfectly seasoning with a subtle smoky flavor. The spinach, slightly crisp, had a mild garlic flavor that wasn't too overpowering. While the eggplant was tender, it was a little watery and lacked seasoning. That would probably be my only complaint, in addition to perhaps wishing the pizza was a little crispier. Either way the pizza makes for a simple, delicious meal that's perfect for sharing.  Service was very nice. All of the staff was very attentive without hovering too much. Wolfgang makes a perfect stop to refuel between stores.

This might at first sound like a generic choice for lunch or dinner on the strip. However, it's not. Simple ingredients cooked well. I always enjoy eating here. There was a pizza we liked that had corn on it but they don't offer it anymore. Last time I had salmon and a side of cauliflower. Simple but cooked to perfection. I highly enjoyed it.

We had a great dinner at Cucina! Our reservation was for 8:30 pm but we were already in the area around 7:30 & they were able to accommodate and seat our 8 person party at once! The food was delicious, and the service was wonderful. I ordered off the prie fixe menu and highly recommend the artichoke bruschetta and salmon. Definitely grab dinner here if you have the chance!

outstanding customer service.. however we did go too vegas for five hours only... lol anyways the pizza was great.. very big portions!!! just make sure you heat up the pizza before you eat it the next day .. haha.. the manager there was great.. he knows how too be a good host.. however he did steer us too a club that was closed....

What an amazing experience! The food was outstanding; exceptional flavors. The bartender and our waiter were extremely friendly. The bread we were served was delicious. I love the prociutto pizza and the chocolate glazed hazelnut mousse. Scrumptious! Strongly recommended. Don't miss out on this place!
This is my second time here in 2 days! The food, drinks and service are great as well as the location. Definitely will be back on my next visit to Vegas.

having only an hr or so to eat before we went clubbing, this place was close by to the Aria.  We sat at the bar for their HH.   We ordered pork belly- recommended by the bartender, one dish has 4 sticks, pretty good, well caramelized and yummy. these...mushroom ball things- they were okay. calamari- they were okay, I didn't like them that much, felt like I tasted the oil... the italian sausage pizza- kinda strange flavors...didn't really like it... the mushroom pizza- it was good, but maybe the flavors were standard and typical, so that's why i liked it.  overall, wasn't too impressed with what we had. one bartender (the one who sat us) was kind of rude. once he gave us our menus, he practically ignored us. yes he was making sangria, but that shouldn't be your priority. the other bartender Chris, was much nicer...a little weird, but had personality and tried to make convo.  Around $80? for 4 ppl. eh, i wouldn't be back...not really.
Very good! Great service! Great food! Decent prices $20-25 per entree! Would recommend!

We had the antipasti dish for 4 people: JUST DELICIOUS! Real Italian meat, cheese and vegetables. We order NY Strip, Spaghetti with meatballs and hamburger (actually only on lunch menu). The meat and the hamburger over the top. The Spaghetti a little over cooked and the sauce was too sweet, but the meatballs were perfect. The bill was really fair for so much quality

First time here, we stopped in last night because there was a sign that said "Happy Hour every Hour"...Could not pass that up.  The Happy Hour menu has a few selection items of food and drink but there was a Grilled Cheese on there to die for...OMG, Amazing Cheese, Bacon, Avocado and Tomato on a crestless bread, just WOW...  I have never come across a bar that did not have Tuaca though.  For the massive bar they have here to not have a very popular alcohol was very odd to us.  None the less, the assorted cheese tray, the desert which like a turtle pie but WAY BETTER to the Grilled Cheese, it was a good time.  May go back again for happy hour another day, but for this trip, this place turned out to be ok.  It was a good choice.

The atmosphere of this restaurant is very nice.  Crystal mall is very beautiful and this is one of the places to eat floating around the middle of the mall.  And considering that this place boasts the name of wolfgang puck and its surrounded by shops that sell shoes and hand bags for no less then 3000 dollars.  You might think its expensive but its not.   We got a pitcher of some wonderful pale in a nice round bottom pitcher.  An order of the fried calamari which was fantastic. and the proccuito pizza which was also very good but on the salty side.  the bill came out to around 50 dollars.

Love this place! Ever since my first time coming here, I make sure to come here whenever I'm in the area.  The establishment itself is really clean and the decor is quite nice. They also play pretty good music here! Service is ok, the food tends to come out a bit slow, but it's not too bad. The best thing about this place is the food! It's pretty amazing. I honestly haven't had anything that I disliked here. My favorite dishes would be the calamari appetizer, lasagna, and the pasta with clams and garlic sauce. I've also tried the spaghetti and meatballs as well as the chicken piccata, both were pretty good. I tried the four cheese ravioli, it was good but it wasn't as good as I had expected it to be, so I probably wouldn't order that again.   This place would get a full 5 stars if they brought back the lasagna. Seriously, why would you guys take that away?!? That was the best lasagna I have ever eaten and it was the best thing on the menu! The ingredients were so fresh and the flavor was just perfect. I really miss it. Lasagna is such a staple item that I'm confused as to why it was taken away. So bring it back and I may bump up my rating.

I would like to give this place 5 stars, on the basis of their accommodating and welcoming attitude to my 3 kids. However, the food and service has to be absolutely impeccable for such an accolade. It was very good mind you. BUT, I've had better crusts on wood-fired pizzas and much nicer fish and chips. That said, their wood-grilled salmon was lush (not sure why they choose Scottish over fabulous American alternatives - and I'm a Brit myself!) and everything was so fresh. They were charmingly flexible, when one member of our group wanted banana rather than berries on his ice cream, for example. I'm happy to continue eating here for the duration of our stay.

Nice place for a casual early dinner, if you don't want to get dressed up or want a pretentious atmosphere.  Staff was friendly and attentive but not overbearing. Food was great for the price. I had the Gnoochi and I am very picky about my Gnoochi. This was top notch in texture and flavor. The procuitto was great, a little difficult to eat but the flavor profile with the mozzerella was excellent. KP had the ravioli which was good, not spectacular but good nontheless. Recommended for a nice early dinner if you don't have reservations or don't want to spend 200 plus. Our check came out to just over 90 bucks including wine and desert. Tipped heavilly as the staff was great.

I've been home from vegas for a few days now, and I am still fantasizing about the lamb with fettuccine, and the goat-cheese stuffed peppers. 9 of us went to dinner for my cousins 21st celebration, and none of us left dissatisfied. We did the set family style menu. I could almost hear the grumblings from my sister, the worlds pickiest eater. Even she left happy. Sure, she didn't like the lamb or the goat cheese, but she said the ravioli and the chicken was to die for. What can I say, when I eat, I go for the weird stuff, not the stuff you can get anywhere. So I trust her judgement. One of our appetizers was an antipasti tray (its where the goat-cheese pepper came from ) and it was amazing. The meats, cheeses, and peppers were all beautifully prepared.   The service was good, nothing spectacular but overall very good. Our desserts came out disproportionately late...as in 45+ after our main course was cleared. And were not even offered coffee first. Additionally, I was a little weirded out by the location,,,I am not the biggest fan of feeling like I am in the middle of a mall (oh wait, I was). I think the ambiance could be a smidge better.   Overall, wonderful experience. I'd come back in the future, but by the time I get back out West, I will have another 30 restaurants I'd like to try first.

This establishment has lost a lot of its quality in terms of the food they serve. I used to come before and the establishment was much better with several other dishes that were delicious. Why they decided to remove them from the menu was beyond me. Their salmon was dry and the lemon sauce bland and watery, the desserts and appetizers did not impress me. Their chicken Parmesan, a simple staple in Italian cuisine, was dry and bland as well. This restaurant does not keep up with their competitors on the strip in terms of pricing and quality. The only upside was the service. Someone always came by to refill waters, check on our dishes, and they were always friendly. Though we only saw our actual service twice throughout the entire meal..

I was not impressed. The sangria was the only thing that I would rave about that we ordered. My salad was boring & pretty bland. My husbands pasta was really really salty. One of our friends also commented that her pasta dish was super salty. Wasn't the worst dining experience I've ever had. The place is decorated well & our server was great, the food just left a lot to be desired.

Great place in Vegas to eat a great dinner, without spending a wad of cash! We had the following items:  Appetizers Tomato and pesto bruschetta- awesome pizza with onions, arugula, etc- awesome prosciutto and burreta cheese- good lettuce salad with gorgonzola- very good.  Entrees Osso bucco- excellent lamb- good

New chef.  I've been here 20 times.  But probably won't come back.  Changed the carbonara/ why?   No one was there and cokes not refilled.  Lots of staff just hanging around talking to each other.  There were like seven in a group bee boping - yet cokes empty.   Just totally different.  I won't come back.  Management seems to not make the staff know customers are important.  Too many other options on the strip.  Sad sad sad cuz this was the place I ate every single first day I arrive in Vegas - both personal and business.   Just not anymore.  Maybe the staff knows the place is going down hill.  Again mr new chef, the old menu preparation was better.  My partners food was over cooked by the way.  The whole place was a let down after five years of constantly going there.  Very sad.  No more my go to place and no longer the place is take visitors.  Both dishes weren't even plated nicely. It was just put there on an oval plate, the proper way to serve an Italian dish like carbonara or spaghetti is in a bowl or shallow bowl.  Flat linguini on a flat plate.  Makes it like someone with no culinary experience did this.  The whole thing / meal didn't make sense. It was like before it was high end - now it's like silly run of the mill.  Service bad.  Meal bad.  Plating bad.   Four cubes of butter with bread where any wolf gang puck elegant meal would have like oil or some butter mixed with something to be special.   Nothing is special about this place anymore.    Again sad that after 20+ times of coming here I have no desire to return.  I've brought so many guests here too.    Bottom line - from elegant and special to run of the mill blah.

I've been to a few of Wolfgang's restaurants on the Strip, and this is ranked somewhere in the middle. Nothing remarkably memorable, but nothing that left a bad taste in my mouth either. We shared the octopus appetizer, prosciutto pizza, and the veal ravioli. All three were solid dishes-- the octopus was grilled nicely and packed a good punch with acidity and flavor, the prosciutto pizza had a good chewy crust and flavor, and the veal was tender and the ravioli itself had a good bite. The veal was definitely the highlight. We also got a fruity rum cocktail that was pretty good too.  If you are around the Crystals, a good option. Otherwise I wouldn't make this a destination stop.

Located inside the Aria I like the set up of the restaurant, simple yet classy. The gf likes it because they play old school black n white movies on one of the walls Service was great. They constantly came around to check up on us Ordered the caesar salad, pretty damn tasty. Ordered the fried calamari, they were flight and not heavy on the batter. Best calamari I've had. I enjoyed the green dipping sauce. Dont really know what it's made from, but it was good I ordered the veal ravioli with mushrooms. Pretty good, a bit salty but very filling GF ordered the lasagna. "Feels homemade. This is how lasagna should be." Her words, not mine Was going to order the tiramisu but GF ran out of room. But I saw someone else ordered it and it had a side of chocolate dipping sauce. Looked good  Overall great experience. Kind of pricy, but it's expected from since we were in vegas. Randomly came to this place because we were getting hungry and chose this spot. Great gamble!

Came here for lunch after walking around the CityCenter.  Do we have to ask for bread nowadays? This was the case here and other restaurants I visited during my recent trip to Las Vegas. However, the staff was still very attentive.   For appetizers we ordered the calamari "fritto." Tasted great and loved the garlic aioli and the spice of paprika. For my entree I had the mozzarella panini with tomato soup and side salad. I loved that it came with all three. Honestly, you cannot have an italian restaurant without amazing, melt in your mouth, tomato soup. The soup was heavenly and tasted great paired with the panini. The side salad was great as well; however, some bits tasted a bit too... freshly picked? Well, you know what I mean. Considering we already had breakfast and this was just a, lets sit down my feet hurt  whimsical eat, we did not order dessert or anything after our entree. Overall, everything was delicious and I would definitely come back after a day of shopping.

You must come here to experience the ambiance. It's strange to be nestled in the middle of a mall and be struck by the architecture.   I loved my butter lettuce salad and caramelized onion pizza. The sweet iced tea my sister ordered (can't remember which flavor) was the best I've ever tasted!

Adam was the best server!  So nice and really took care of us as we celebrated my parents' anniversary.    We ordered a glass of the Beringer Cabernet, a glass of Chianti, a Virgin Bloody Mary, two of the special tomato bruschetta, the sea bass, and the mushroom pizza with arugula instead of the hen egg.    Wow!!! Food was fantastic.  Loved the bruschetta...very refreshing.  The pizza was delightful as well.  I have been to Spago in Caesar's, Postrio (now closed) in the Benetian, and the Wolfgang Puck in the MGM l.  I usually like the MGm location but I think this is not my fav spot.  I like how it's great for people-watching but you get better service, a more chill ambiance, and, in my opinion, slightly better food.  Will be back! Thank you, Adam!

We ordered the antipasti platter with various meats, cheeses, and marinated veggies.  We were talked into the grande, but the smaller platter would have sufficed.  Almost all of it was consumed post haste along with our wine and beer.   It was a wonderful way to start.  We had to request a child's menu for the tween in our party and she ordered the spaghetti noodles with butter and Parmesan cheese.   She enjoyed it.   For our main entree, we shared a chicken parmigiana.  It was fresh and tasty, and was plenty to share since it had two chicken breasts.  The only downside to the evening was the first batch of bread...   it came out burned on one side, and it was plated burned side down.  The waiter said it was supposed to be that way, but brought out new bread that want "well done". We enjoyed our visit and wouldn't hesitate to visit again when we want Italian food.    But with all the choices on the strip, there's not much here that leaves us with an urge to return.

Quetzi was the most amazing server!!! She is a true asset to Wolfgang's restaurant!!!  Margarita pizza, caprese, & bruscetta were delicious. Chocolate dessert was awesome presentation & decadent! Cozy setting.

Really beautiful place for lunch. The light comes through wonderfully in the Crystals shopping mall and this creates this wonderful open space. Love the modern design. Service was really top notch (the kind you would get at a $$$$ dinner) and the food was good. Ruben and I started with drinks - I got the Pineapple Ginger Mojito, refreshing, light, and delicious. We shared the Calamari served with marinara and pesto aioli. A tad salty, but the breading was lovely and the sauces were wonderful! Then we shared one of the wood-fired pizzas with spicy pepperoni, ricotta, Calabrian hot peppers, and oregano. The dough was delicious and I loved the crust on it, however, the toppings were not as exciting as it sounded on the menu. And I was torn between three selections. For dessert, we shared the tiramisu and it was fabulous! Definitely one of the best tiramisus I've had yet! The mascarpone cheese had little milk chocolate balls suspended in it and those added an unique texture to the delicate dessert. It was a wonderful experience and I definitely want to try other pizzas and maybe some pastas next time, however, I had to give it three stars right now since comparatively to other Italian or pizza joints, not my favorite execution.

This is more of a reflection on service than food. So, not impressed. They have no understanding of how to accommodate allergies and in no way made it easy. I had to spell it out for them and basically create my own dish based on the menu. For the price, I expected more.   I had to clarify about my food 4 times before getting it right. I asked for a suggested wine and was extremely disappointed.   In the end the food was good once we finally received it, but for what it is worth it was still a let down.   I expected 4 star from the reviews and instead it was as less efficient than red robin.

Came here for a relaxing dinner on a Tuesday night. The place was only about 50% filled so we were seated right away.   Our waitress was really great and came to our table right away to ask us about drinks. She also had what I like to call "The Sense" which is that she knows how often to check in rather than too much or too little. I've mentioned this before checking-in sense before in previous reviews. Overall she was great. The bus boy was also pretty on point about filling up our waters and bringing out bread. Service was A-OK.  As for food, the calamari w/ garlic aioli appetizer was definitely a good choice. Awesome to share between 3-4 people. Unfortunately, it was just me and my gf so we got a little bit filled up from it that we weren't fully hungry for our entrees. I ordered the pesto lamb which was tasty but just a little too salty for my taste. The mashed potatoes and spinach it comes with were really good though. She got the prime rib which she really enjoyed and I took a bit and it was legit.   Overall it was a good dining experience. Food was a little too salty for me and a little pricey for where we were but the service was good. No need to come back but a solid choice nonetheless.
This restaurant is amazing. The food, the people, even the drinks were perfect.  Edgar & Apollo were the best. Love this place!

Had two meals here during our stay. Both were very good. Sometimes with restaurants associated with well known chefs can kind of be hit or miss especially when said chef is not on the premise and has MANY restaurants nationwide. This location of Wolfgang Puck happily bucks this trend.  The kale salad is super yummy as is the antipasto salad (although I ate around the salami) we shared a pizza (basically because we had our eye on dessert) although you could pretty easily consume one all by yourself.  The tiramisu was very artfully plated and different than many preparations I have had.   The four cheese ravioli is really yummy as well. The wine/cocktail list is fun.

Let me first start by saying I love wolfgang puck. My sister and I always enjoy going to the one at the MGM when we visit Vegas. This last trip, however, we stayed at the aria and tried this location out. It was the worse experience I've ever had. We had just drove in from Orange County, so we had on some comfy active wear(I mention this because it felt like they were judging our outward appearance). Right when we walked in we were given dirty looks by the staff. It took a few minutes for us to even be acknowledged and seated, when the entire restaurant had roughly 3 tables filled. Once seated it took over 15 minutes for our waiter to come over. He had the snootiness demeanor that I've ever encountered. Not once we're we approached with a smile or warm disposition. Each waiter that passed by our table was looking at us like we have 2 heads. We felt extremely uncomfortable and by the time our food came we requested to eat it in our rooms. I don't know what is wrong with the staff here, but they need a lesson in customer service. I will never return to this location again and advise others to do the same. This happened over a month ago and I'm still upset with how poorly we were treated.

Went here to eat before hitting the club and cant say I have ever had better egg plant pizza. Didn't sound to good but after taking that first bite, WOW!!!!  The bruschetta was very very good and so was the free bread.  The service wasn't so great. Our server had a big party so he never checked up on us. Which I understand if you get a big party but dont forget about your other tables.   The bussers were more helpful. Always asked if we were doing ok and serving us water.  Other than That it was really good for.  Definitely will return again!

Oh ma ma! Lip smacking delicious. We ordered a cheese platter and it was well laid out and contained a good mix of aged and new cheese. I ordered the mussels starter and it was delicious. Delicate flavored handled to perfection. My husband ordered a pizza and that too delivered on taste. A lovely goodbye Vegas meal. Now I will look for a local restaurant in my city ...  Visit 2 was on a my brother in laws 50th birthday !! The amazing food which was flavored delicately was a hit with our palette. Ryan our server went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. He was patient in explaining the food and its ingredients. So glad we came back here. Thanks Ryan you made our day!

The absolute worse meal I had in a restaurant in years.  EPIC BAD  Had pizza here once before and the place was quite good. It was clean and had friendly service.    After my last stop, I will never eat here again.  In a party of three, we order apps and simple dishes.  Again, the waiter was very friendly, that was the high point.  The apps were ok, nothing special.  The main meal was HORRENDOUS.  The absolute worse meal I can ever remember having out.  The dish was spaghetti and meatballs.  It is the most basic dish one can serve.  Any beginner can serve a half decent dish of it.  It started off with the staff handing one member in our party their meal 15 minutes before they served our meal (one person ordered the same thing). The meal was cold, the spaghetti overcooked and the sauce was can quality.  It was basically eating Franco American spaghetti from a can but 10 times worse.  The meal was sent back and another attempt at it was made.  The same exact dish came out.  It seemed like the spaghetti was sitting in water for a 1/2 hour, it could literally break apart in pieces tapping it with a fork.  My meal had the same exact problem.  I asked the hostess if I could speak to her manager and she told me she's in the back and I'll call her.  She never answered and she told me she probably left for the night.  I sportingly paid my whole bill even though they should have paid me to eat there.  I called again the next day and asked to speak to the manager to tell them how atrocious their place is and how I never want to see any customer served that rot, I was put on hold and hung up on.  The cowardly manager didn't even have the class to answer their phone.  STAY AWAY

Service was so slow that I got up and got a pitcher and filled up all four of our glasses.  Then, we got the bill and the wine wasn't discounted.  When we inquired he said it was bottles only.  When we asked where it says that (see pic) he said it doesn't. He gave us the wrong change for the bill we paid cash for. The neighbors bill also had to be sent back.  The food was ok but the service was unacceptable. I won't be back and I wouldn't recommend.

Wolfgang Puck has never disappointed me. I try to hit up a Puck restaurant whenever I'm in Vegas. We were there celebrating my birthday finally & after reading so many Italian restaurant reviews, chose Cucina. Nice ambiance, I'm big on people watching, especially in Vegas, & being located in the Crystals shops gives you a good view, without being super noisy or close to people. We had this delicious squash bruschetta, chicken piccata, & braised short ribs. But the star of the evening was our server Tony. You know the one, he's Yelp-famous.. :) With his recommendations & attending to our needs, he really was spot on with everything & what a nice experience it was to have him serve us! In Vegas, with so many different restaurants, when you pair great quality of food with terrific service, that's when you have a standout place. Check out Cucina, make sure you request Tony. :)

After our first long day on the strip,we were starving. Wolfgang has never disappointed me at any of his locations. The Food and service were both amazing. Fresh baked crusty bread to start,calamari, octopus, spaghetti, and the chicken piccata were all delicious. Service is perfect and friendly. I made reservations early to get a nice romantic table. This place can't go wrong!

Service was very slow. The table next to us was seated after us, but got their food 10 minutes before we did. They offered a Prix Fixe lunch menu. Calamari was very over cooked. Too much time between courses for a lunch.

In the beautiful Crystals shopping center. We tried a couple pizzas that were excellent. The Italian sausage with red pepper and basil was a nice mix of tastes. The service was excellent. Definitely worth a try.

We stopped for an early light lunch. Their all  day happy hour is a great choice. The Nduja Crostini was excellent and unique. All the happy hour menu items are 7$ or less. Great deal. Nice open air decor. Very friendly waitstaff.

Came by for dinner the night and was pleasantly surprised as this is a chain!  Started off with the butter lettuce that Yelpers suggested and it was fresh, light and tasty! The waiter made my salad a half order as apparently others eat this as an entree?!?  The ribeye this year was fresh, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The mushroom topping did help out the flavoring!  The broccolini was also decent, fresh and flavorful as well!  Service was okay, on par with a chain Americanized restaurant.

I love this spot. Bartenders professional and very friendly, the bar is well stocked with a wide variety of poison. Deaths door gin is definitely a must try for gin lovers.   Food here is amazing, the happy hour items are very reasonable and the entrees are well priced for Vegas.  I have no idea what it is but Crystals and this open air bar delight the sense with a perfumed but subtle smell, its delicious.  If you're in the area and hungry, this is the spot to be!

First night here at Vegas and to celebrate anniversaries and engagment so friends and I wanted to go to a "classy" fancy restaurant. Searched and searched around for a good restaurant and finally decided to just go to this place since it is a branch of the Wolfgang Puck chain of restaurants. This place is located in the Crystals shopping area and it was fairly quiet because it was proabably a Wednesday night. Got seated and the menu isn't big, but had a good variety. Waitress was very helpful and so were the people refilling our water. My friend wanted the water with no ice so they always accomodated every time she needed a refill. I ordered Ravioli with wild mushroom, husband ordered Salmon with rosemary, friends ordered some pasta dish. The dishes were not big, but it was good although mine was a little bit on the salty side. Overall, good service, good location and good food except for the salty part.

Awesome place. Food tastes great. Staff is welcoming and the music is chill. We ordered antipasti boards which supplemented our wines well. We ordered some pasta with chicken parm which was delicious. They have 3 course meal for 35 bux for dinner which is awesome

First about the service...  My wolfpack went to Brasserie PUCK for dinner the Saturday we were in Vegas. We unfortunately were running late for our reservation & arrived 45 minutes after we were supposed to at 9:45 to a nearly empty restaurant. We assumed we wouldn't have any trouble with our table, so when we were told by the hostess that she'd have to check with a manager to see if we could be sat, we were rather shocked. After we were told that we could finally sit, a couple behind us were told that they were closed. Really? 10 p.m. on a Saturday night in Vegas where everything is open 24/7?  Hm, but maybe there's a lesson in all of this and my dear, dear wolfpack that I love so so very much won't run so late anymore?  But I digress.    I guess we shouldn't be surprised since the hotel was pretty empty too.  I have never seen a hotel/casino so empty on the Vegas strip on a Saturday night.  Once we got passed that frustration, we were greeted by some awesome servers. Like, nearly all of the ones working that night.  Super fun & friendly, but it also seemed like they had nothing better to do?   Now about the food... Us wolves weren't so hungry due to the large feast we had for lunch, so we all only ordered entrees.  We all ordered: 1) Italian meat pizza (according to my friends, not very good) 2) Rigatoni carbonara (I think it was rigatoni... delish, according to friends) 3) Ahi with asparagus & potatoes (I ordered this - very good ahi... though I like mine better :P  The asparagus and potatoes were cooked and seasoned nicely.) 4) Salmon, again with asparagus & potatoes (according to my friend, delicious)  Except for the lone wolf that ordered the pizza, I think we would all agree that we would order our food again.  The mixed drinks 2 of the members of my wolfpack ordered were awesome.  I ordered a pinot grigio with my other wolf - it complemented our meals very nicely. Oh - and the bread was good, too.  We would all definitely eat here again, if it's still there when we go next.  Hopefully City Center starts to pick up in business, because it was a gorgeous hotel/casino & it has some fantastic restaurants!

Horrible service. They may have been understaffed, but people were just standing around. We ran out of water and never got refilled even when we asked.  Good was delicious and amazing. If we had to go back it would purely be for the food - maybe takeout?? That would avoid the negatives and get all the positives.

NEED MORE STARS! The place was off the hook! Lets start with the ambience, nice & cozy for dinner while still being open enough for people watching (my favorite pass time). The service was lovely, our server was VERY educated, he knew everything there was to know about the menu & all the ingredients on it to the way each dish was prepared. The bruschetta was the best I've ever had. The olive oil they used was DELICIOUS with a slight sweetness. For my entree I had the fried eggplant, the best I've ever had as well. It was flash fried & then baked which creates absolute perfection, no oily or mushiness which is usually the issue with eggplant dishes. My aunt had the Veal ravioli with brown butter & sage. She thoroughly enjoyed it, I don't eat veal so I didn't try it, but I tasted one of the mushrooms so I could taste the sauce.... Phenomenal! I will definitely be returning here in the near future!

Stopped in here for refreshments while waiting for our Dream Racing pick-up. I opted for ginger ale to prep my stomach for the oncoming fast driving! My friend had a west coast IPA to pass the time. Aesthetic was trendy with video projection on the surrounding walls. Only down side was our bartender disappeared for a bit so we had to snag the busboy to request we get a check sorted out to not be late for our pick-up.

Well from the taste of the food, you can definitely tell this place was created by a chef.  I looked at the menu to review what I had, but I don't even know the name of the starter I ordered. Well, the menu doesn't really go by a "name" instead they just list out what the dishes are, which is kinda nice for the non-bilingual.  For the starter.. It was just a pile of mozzarella with what looked like uncooked bacon with green seasoning ontop. Wasn't really a fan of the fatty meat, but the cheese was good all on its own.  Now for my meal. The Panini: Mozzarella, Basil Pesto, Insalata Mista, Creamy Tomato Soup - I had NO idea what Insalata Mista was, but apparently it's a salad. It was so YUMMY! I thought the prices of these would be outrageous but I was completely wrong. My Panini was a reasonable $16.   The staff was so kind, and the place is gorgeous. There's not one thing I can complain about... Here's a 5!

Okay.. I may be slightly on the generous side but the food just totally won me over!   Went to Vegas this past weekend for a bachelorette party and decided to go here for our bachelorette dinner!   AMBIANCE- 4 stars! FOOD- 5 stars! SERVICE- 5 stars!  Ambiance was nice and simple, very open and modern. Hard to give it a 5 star because my other favorite restaurant Mon Ami Gabi over at Paris is hard to top. But this was a very schnazzy and fun place to have dinner.   The food can't even compete! Because it was pool day the next day, my friend and i decided to split the clam linguine. Which seriously was sooo good. Everyone else's was drool on myself good as well! The grilled chicken, chicken carbonara, and the rib eye steak that I got to taste from each of my friends plate made me wish there was an entree sampler... which I could have ALL TO MYSELF! Loved  everything!  Service was great! Waiters and waitresses were accomodating and very friendly! For the bachelorette party, we had a scavenger hunt going where we had to find certain guys to pose or do certain things and all of them were ethusiastic and completely on board. One guy was all about it and even went the extra mile. (Thought to myself: okay dude, thanks but realllly thanks now ok? lol)   Overall, loved the food and will definitely be back to share the experience with more people!
Sat at the bar and enjoyed the best negronis . Service was excellent and the food was exceptional.

I wanted to give this restaurant a shoutout for their amazing food, staff, and experience! I took my mom out to dinner for her birthday last night and our server was Tony he was amazing and made our dining experience unforgettable! Thank you to Tony and to the chef's that made my moms birthday very special we had an amazing time and I can't wait to go back and get Tony as our server!

Insieme a 'Spago' un buon esempio di cucina italiana all'estero! Pasta a cottura decente e sugo di pesce leggermente piccante che si fa mangiare volentieri! Inoltre in entrambi i locali, con Yelp si ha uno sconto del 20% un ottimo binomio!

Prosciutto Pizza? Almost as good as it sounds. The cut is kinda thick and the prosciutto covers the whole pizza. The Mascarpone Cheese base was my favorite part of the pizza.  The sausage pizza my dad got was amazing. And my wife's ricotta gnocchi (yes gnocchi made with ricotta instead of potatoes!) was incredible.

Before heading out to the airport, we decided to check out Cucina by Wolfgang Puck for lunch. An open restaurant with nice clean modern decor in the Crystal shops near Aria. Only a few patrons for lunch today, the hostess sat us quickly and the waitress came quickly and offered is water immediately after we sat down. We decided on the wild mushrooms and hen egg pizza ($17) and the Papardelle pasta ($22) after looking at Yelp reviews and recommendations by the waitress. The food took a while to come out, I'd guess 15 minutes, which is a bit long especially since there weren't many other customers in the restaurants.  Anyways, when the food came out, I was surprised by the portion. The pizza was a 10-inch pizza but most places that offer pizza on the menu is this puny sized a bit bigger than your hand pizza but this one was huge! Maybe 6 good sized slices. The pappardelle portion was pretty big too. My pizza was  in one word, amazing. The pizza was like paper thin and the crust was nice and crunchy. The mushrooms, braised leeks, and fontina and taleggio cheese were rich and delicious. The hens egg (albeit a bit dry looking) was cooked okay so I could slice the egg and the yolk spilled out into the pizza. Altogether the bite was very tasty, with the richness and earthiness of the mushrooms and egg with the right balance of the salty cheese. Next the pappardelle was very impressive. Hand-made and cooked to order (as per the waitress), the pasta was very silky and tasted fresh. The marinara was alright to me but altogether, a fine pasta. After the disaster of last night's crap dinner at another name chef's restaurant (a dude famous for Creole), I was impressed and satisfied at this chef's restaurant. I'd definitely try again! 4/5 stars only because despite having quality and tasty food with good service, it was only pizza and pasta. Nothing inventive and outrageously delicious.

Happy hour all day everyday at the bar...now that's what I'm talking about! Thanks to Misti Y's fantastic review we bellied up to the bar and were very happy! $5 pints/$14 pitchers of assorted beers including Negroni and Hoegaarden!!! There is also a nice selection of not-so-small plates...we had the Insalata Mista ($5) which they so very nicely split into two plates for us without our even asking. We also had the artichoke hearts which were lovely. Our bartender was amazing. The bar was packed but she never missed a beat, she even kept our pitcher of beer in the fridge so it didn't get warm. Great experience and I will definitely be back.
The Bruschetta was so simple and fresh. The rigatoni was incredible and satisfied my pasta craving! The zeppole was so creamy and amazing in the caramel sauce. Great spot. Get Tony as your waiter!

For the price, I was expecting to get wowed. Went in here with really high expectation as the Name and the prices are both on the high end. Ordered the Salmon which was good but nothing to rave about. We also ordered the Chicken dish but it wasn't really all that good. There was nothing in that dish to tie the chicken dish together. The plate just showed up with two pieces of chicken thighs. If the server would have informed us then we would have ordered some mashed potatoes to go with it instead of garlic bread. All in all I was really disappointed with this place. The server hardly showed up to our table as well.

Cucina was absolutely fantastic for our bachelorette party dinner!  With a group of 21 ladies, I was worried about prices and making sure everyone would be happy with the menu; however, our experience here surpassed all my expectations!  While I don't remember our server's name (maybe Tim or Tom??), he was absolutely fantastic!  The choices for wine, cocktails, apps, and main courses ended up being perfect and our server was extremely helpful when it came to ordering enough small plates that would satisfy our large party.   The location was perfect as we were staying at the Cosmo, and the one thing that really stood out for me was that there was no need to make a deposit prior or meet a required minimum upon dining.  That was the only issue I found with other restaurants since we were such a large group.  After having 4 bottles of wine, mixed drinks, a handful of apps, a main entree, and some dessert/coffee, our final cost was about $1600 - not bad at all for a group our size!    Organizing big group dinners can be a challenge, and Cucina was truly outstanding.  I highly recommend!!

I've never really been a fan of Wolfgang puck but i wanted some Italian and this place was the only one open at the time within 0.3 miles lol (yes, I don't like to walk very far).  sat at the bar so we could get the happy hour menu.  ordered chicken wings from there.  $6 for 6 pieces of wings. omg so good!  wings were tender and juicy.  for the entree, I wasn't too hungry so we split a crispy egg plant parmesean with spaghetti noodles on the side.  this dish was also very good!  one complaint is that if you order this, get the egg plant on the side to it'll stay crispy.  they were so nice to split the plate for us.  oh yeah I wanted some type of meat so added chicken to the entree.  $5 for like 6 slices of chicken.    overall,  cute place and great food!  THOSE HAPPY HOUR WINGS THO :)

Stopped in here for a snack before our concert and I'm happy we did.  It was happy hour at the bar and I got to see the Red Sox beat the Yankees! Our bartender was awesome, even though he's a Yankees fan! We had the meatball pizza, a glass of red sangria and a good size cheese and meat plate and it was only $29.  What a deal.  The meatballs were so good.  The only suggestion would be to add something sweet, like honey or fruit spread to the cheese plate.    I would def like to go back to order off the full menu someday.
Food is very consistent and excellent.  The staff is great and the bartenders are the best.  I highly recommend this restaurant if your in Vegas.
What can you say about Wolfgang Puck. The presentation is wonderful without being pretentious. Flavors that never ever over power. Very good wine selection. Try the pappardelle.

Came to grab a late lunch to-go on a Monday, June 11, 2012.  I was warmly greeted at the door by the hostess and manager.  I asked if I could get an order to go, and they said I could at the bar.  I didn't take pics, so my memory is a bit elusive... but I remember it being very well-lit, and modern.  It matched the space of the Crystals shopping center.  It was very lively, and I was surprised there were so many patrons at that hour (around 2pm).  I got the spaghetti and meatballs, as well as the grilled meatballs.  My friend, Arvin T, had been searching for the "best meatball," and so I joined him in his search.  I was very tempted to have a cocktail, having glanced a number of tasty looking handcrafted cocktails... next time!  I forget how long the bartender said the wait would be, and I had made a note in my phone (only to have deleted it, it seems)... but I remember it taking 3-4 minutes longer than he said.  Which was fine for me, but for those that are nit-picky...  Fast forward, I'm sitting on the couch in Veer Towers (that's why I chose to get it to go -- it was 8 minutes flat, from bar to doorstep), with Mad Men on Netflix... I dig into the spaghetti... it's cooked al dente, thumbs up.  I take a bite of the meatball -- my teeth sink through more easily than anticipated; it's a very soft texture, and I don't like it.  On top of that, it was surprisingly sweet tasting, not in a good way.  Disappointed, I wash it down with water, and give it a second go.  Same disappointment.  I open up the grilled meatballs and cross my fingers... The texture is more firm, like I'm used to.  However, this time it's way too salty!  I quickly grab the water, rinse, and repeat.  Salty!  Deja Vu.  Einstein's attributed quote came to mind: "Insanity: Doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results."  (He didn't really say that btw, but who knows who came up with it).  When my friend came home from work that day, I had saved him well over half (probably 3/4).  He tried it, and disagreed with me about the grilled meatballs being salty... only to recant his statement 4 hours later when he admitted he needed to drink lots of water at dinner.  Wolfgang Puck, your meatballs let me down that day.  But, being as sleek looking as you were, I will return to sample your handcrafted cocktails anyway ;)

Got the brick chicken, squid ink linguine, beef ragu and the kid pizza.    First off, the kid pizza is huge almost enough for two kids.    The brick chicken is excellent.  Tender meat and unique flavor.  Could use a bit more salt but thats my personal preferance.    The pastas are very good as well.

I love being in the area of this restaurant.  It just speaks luxury. And this place is in a perfect location.  Awesome Christmas tree was right in view. Stunning. Wish I felt the same excitement for the restaurant itself.  Now, it wasn't bad.  The food was quite good.  We actually went in to get something quick and non-filling, like a nice salad.  I found on the menu a Kale Salad.  It was good, but for 14 bucks, it wasn't THAT good.  And my uncle's 11 dollar bowl of soup simply was not worth the price.  Given all of that, our servers, though nice and friendly, were just not the most attentive waiters.  It took too long to arrive, take our orders and then return.  And this was only during the middle of the day.  It really wasn't that busy. But everyone seemed to be doing quite a bit of running around. Nice place but could use some improvements in customer service, IMO.

It was an okay experience. Service was great. Felt like it was overpriced. Someone in my party got ravioli and there was only 7 on the plate. I got a pizza and it was good. I might come back again to give it another shot.

I went here for lunch and ordered from the pre fix menu. I was able to try the bruschetta, shrimp scampi, margherita pizza, papardelle bolognese, and donuts with caramel sauce (sorry, I forgot the proper name for these). Everything was good enough, but I didn't have anything spectacular. While we visited around 2pm, the restaurant was pretty empty but the service was still very slow.

The only reason this place receives 4 stars is because of the service.  The food was amazing enough to make up for the terrible service we received, which would've earned 2 stars.  We had a reservation and were seated quickly, but things went downhill from there.  Once we ordered the food took an absurdly long time to come out, so long that various waiters/waitresses came to reassure us that our food was coming and to apologize for the wait.  We said it was okay, but we were all actually starving and getting impatient.  Once the food finally came, it was delicious, and we forgot about how long it had taken to get there.  Because of the time it had taken to get our orders out, they brought us two free desserts (a cookie plate, and fresh cream filled donuts).  Both were delicious (especially the donuts), but also took forever to arrive!  I believe we ended up in the restaurant for somewhere around 2 hours between all of the waiting.  I was surprised at the lack of service this restaurant had, but very impressed with all of the food.

Nice service from everyone.  Brussels sprouts were well done alone with other winter veggies. Sea bass portion was on smaller side and cooked ok. Never had a bad pasta dish here. Not sure if its fresh pasta but it takes like it.

Mediocre food at the worst table...lovely server saved the experience and she gets the star.  Honest to God, we were sat at a table behind a big structural pillar and were completely forgot about.  Long wait for really not great cuisine.  Expect more from a Puck restaurant.

Food was great, no issue there. Service was absolutely horrible!! Restaurant was not busy at all. Spent 5 hours there with an old friend, drinking wine & catching up. I gave the waiter a very generous tip which he DID NOT deserve!! $35 on a $112  check. Had to beg the entire time to refill our water, tea, ice for the warm wine,,, etc.. no salt & pepper on the table. Ordered a pizza & would have liked red Chile flakes for but he never came by. Never checked on us or asked if we needed anything. Then we decided to order more wine which my friend paid for. So we opened a new check. You would think after he got his tip he would have changed his attitude. Nope! Keep having to ask the busboy, who was nice, to get our waiter. Mind you as I said the Restaurant was not busy so I don't know what we were keeping him from. I work Front Desk at one of the largest properties. I rarely go out on the strip, but when I do I am so sad to receive such shitty service! Would never treat our guests as such! You are the reason locals don't want to go out on the strip, and the reason why guests are reviewing Vegas as very expensive with a mediocre experience! Get your service together or get another job.   Wolfgang I lived here 23 years and always loved & patronized your restaurants. I HATE when guests tell me they will never return to our hotel. But I have to say I am feeling the same way. Absolutely disgusted with the way we were treated today!!

Note: This review was based on a wonderful Happy Hour Experience  Wolfgang Puck Pizzaria & Cucina offers a great "ALL-DAY Happy Hour! It's located in the famous Crystall Gallery Shopping Center, which is a great attraction itself!  In this Gallery Styled, high-end Shopping Mall, WPPC also has an aesthetic appeal with eye pleasing, modern, inviting setting. The serving staff, especially the barkeeps were friendly, humorous and efficient.  WPPC has a large, comfortable bar (S Steel) with a partial view of the beautiful mall. One of its tv's over the bar counter is a thin-glass projection type, which looks like a piece of art! The restaurant is moderate in size, but has a spacious feel with its modern, comfortable tables and lounges. Those by the windows overlook the gorgeous gallery shopping area below.  One evening in late March, my wife and I enjoyed ourselves tremendously over 2 glasses of house red wine ($7@), a draft beer ($5), a Spicy Pepperoni Pizza ($14), and a plate of assorted Marinated Olives ($7), which was much bigger in size than we expected. We came for HH only and did not try the dinner menu.  - For its nice ambience, good food, and attractive location, we were not surprised to see quite a few locals there, at the bar that evening! The Crystal Gallery Shooping Center and the WPPC will defintely be one place we'll bring our out-of-town guests to for a good time!  Additional Info - Go visit this fabulous Crystal Center, even if you don't eat/drink at WPPC! - Crystall Shopping Center itself has a modern, artistic architecture with unique aesthetic design, totally worth a visit for tourists and locals alike! This mall is like a gallery with beautiful sculptures, fountain tubes, ornate staircases.... To get to the mall, one can ride the free CityCenter Tram, from Bellagio to the Crystall stop, or to the Aria/Monte Carlo stop, from where then walk around to visit a couple of NICE galleries (Glass Blowing by Chihuly; Sculptures by McDonald) along the way; followed by walking on the picturesque overpass/footbridge to the Mall.  My wife and I spent a pleasant afternoon walking in the CityCenter - the Aria, the galleries, the Crystall Shopping Center, and happily ended our wonderful evening at the Wolfgang Puck over good food and drinks!  Peterskis, Apr 2012

Food is just what we expected, great! The service was super slow!   We just happened to hit this restaurant on a Friday night and they got slammed right after we ordered drinks. They said it was due to surrounding events that caused them to be unusually busy. It took way too long for us to get our drinks and that was right before the major rush hit.  The atmosphere was casual and a bit on the noisy side. Very brightly lit! It is in the middle of a main shopping area. Kind of fun for people watching. I didn't care for my Moscow Mule cocktail. I sent it back. Not sure how they make theirs and couldn't keep the waiter long enough to find out, but they replaced it with another drink. We understood how busy it was, but the waiter didn't even try to explain and or apologize. Nor check back with us on how our food was. We had to ask for the manager. They did comp one of our beers for the wait. We had Alfredo, Pizza and Eggplant. All of which were delicious!   We recommend Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria! Just check to see how busy they are before you sit down! Vegas can be so unpredictable!

The food here was incredible. Wolfgang Puck does an excellent job blending flavors that result in a delicious, interesting, and truly mastered meal. The food was light, but incredibly satisfying and the service was perfect.

Came here for dinner on a Friday night. No reservation necessary since every time slot was available. Ordered the boar ragu and the seafood pasta, both of which were OK. Have had better homemade pasta unfortunately at other establishments. Service also left something to be desired. Great effort was required to get our server's attention. Also no complimentary bread, which is why we ordered a side of garlic bread. Yet upon leaving, we noticed multiple tables with bread baskets, so not sure what that was about. Otherwise, it was A-OK.

Wolfgang Puck at Crystals! Good food, Nice spot and Nice staff :)   Entrees ranges to $20-40 which is not bad, Pasta around $17-30 ! Good price for a delicious meal. My favorite meal so far in this restaurant is the Carbonara cause they used Pancetta instead of the regular bacon and The Lasagna!

They have an excellent prix fixe menu that is delicious and well priced. You will leave satisfied. Monday's and Wednesday's it is half off bottles of wine!! The service is incredible. Our waiter Javier was amazing even after I had an issue with one of the meals I didn't realize had meat in it!! Great meal in Vegas on a budget. Food was top notch.

We were really looking for just a snack to hold us over for a late night dinner reservation. We were pleasantly surprised with the food, drinks, and service.   We had the Mushroom pizza, frito misto, and tiramisu. The pizza was definitely my favorite but the Frito was fantastic as well. Is there really anyone that doesn't like Tiramisu? You won't be disappointed with the dessert as well if you have room for it! Nice spot with great food and Tony took great care of us.

Very much enjoyed this dinner. Staff is super attentive and my water glass was never empty. The food was delicious though it took a very long time to get our entree.   We grabbed the set menu for $35 and tried the proscuitto, octopus salad (apps) - these were EXCEPTIONAL. Do order it.   Entree was the salmon and rib eye, both very well done. Rib eye was a bit chewy but still tasty!  To end it off we got the tiramisu and the donut holes. Which was the cherry on top. Everything was so good. Oh did I mention I got the white sangria? So fresh and delicious, it's a must.

Tony was our waiter and he really made us feel so special! We were VIP for the evening and couldn't have been happier. Food was amazing. We tried the piccolo cheese board, rigatoni, sausage pizza (with an egg! You're a baby if you're not into egg on pizza!), and the rib eye special. Highly recommend. We loved everything and the California Cabernet we enjoyed with the meal. Tony guided us in our menu picks and was spot on. He also comped us the most delish dessert ever - fresh hot zeppolis! We are from NY and consider ourselves zep connoisseurs. These were fantastic.  Also loved the bus waiter. Such a gentleman. 20% off if you check in on yelp. Though you'll gladly tip the waitstaff the savings. Check it out.

There was nothing I didn't like about the experience. We started our meal off with the bruschetta which was topped with delicious marinated tomatoes. Then I had the citrus marinated beet salad with goat cheese. Divine! Best salad that I have ever had! My partner had the radish cucumber salad which he said was a little plain (thus only 4 stars). Now for the incredible entrees... I had eggplant Parmesan which was simply incredible, it was served with a pasta which was a perfect balance of rich, creamy, garlicky. Yummy! My partner had the rigatoncini with Piemontese meat sauce and he said it was delicious! And to top it off, our drinks were perfectly made each time.  We didn't order any speciality cocktails but stuck with out favorites; a greyhound and Jack and Coke.  Of course, I must mention the service... I was satisfied. Food came out at a nice pace and everybody was friendly and polite.  I highly recommend this place especially if you're staying anywhere near Crystals high end shopping mall.

I went for happy hour with my gf and a coworker... we were hoping to get a quick bite to eat before going back to work.   We sat down and the bar top was filthy... crumbs and goo leftovers all over it. Nobody came to greet us and we sat there for 8 minutes when we decided to leave.   I have eaten here before and I know that being dirty is not the norm but the food has never been great... its only convenient since I work nearby...   the service yesterday, the dirty restaurant and blah food in general means I wont give them another try for the foreseeable future.

This review is only for their happy hour, which is essentially all day.  We got here at 12:30pm and there was no one at the bar. We were intrigued by the "all day" happy hour which is either not really a happy hour anymore or it's a happy day. Which one is it? Hmmm...  We ordered the chicken wings ($7) which were very crispy and who doesn't like crispy wings? I was a big fan of the negroni and I should've kept ordering that. I decided to switch it up and order the Moscow mule next and was not a fan of it. It tasted mostly like ginger beer with no vodka at all.  My girlfriend ordered both their red and white sangrias and she was not a fan of either. I tried it and we agreed that they were both overly carbonated with too much soda. That seems like a trend with some of the carbonated drinks here.  We ended our meal with the tiramisu hoping that it could salvage our experience with the food here but it didn't help.
