Overall it's just a meh happy hour and you can probably find better options in Vegas.

I give this place 3 stars for the food but the service and atmosphere were lacking.  I think we saw the Wolfgang Puck name and expected something more, when the reality is he probably slaps his name on many Vegas establishments.  We rarely saw our waiter and it truly felt like we were dining in the middle of the mall.    That said, the lasagna was good, as was the brick chicken with grilled corn and pancetta.  The fried calamari could have been cooked a bit longer (was very pale colored) but was served with delicious sauces (tomato sauce and pesto aioli).  If you're looking for something casual, you'll probably enjoy the food.  If you're looking for a nice night out, there are hundreds of other nice restaurants to choose from on the strip.

This is the only place inside Crystals at City Center that I can afford to indulge in. We took a break from window shopping (the only thing you can really do at the stores here), and had a really nice lunch at Wolfgang Puck's Pizzeria. The ultra modern restaurant is open and airy, located in the middle of the mall.   While no one in our group of four ladies was particularly starving, we just got three things to share. I guess the motivation behind that was the skin tight size XS dress that was waiting to be worn a few hours later. So, we ordered the fried calamari appetizer, one basil pesto grilled chicken panini and the calzone pizza which we had them make as an open faced flat pizza. They were kind enough to cut the panini into fours, and surprisingly, we still had leftover pizza! Loved the delicious panini, and the thin crust pizza was very tasty. The calamari was nicely fried and not oily at all.  Service was top notch here. I'm really starting to notice the high level of hospitality in Vegas, which is pretty refreshing. Will definitely be back to do do some casual dining when I'm staying at Vdara. The bar area is also super swank with TVs projected onto a piece of glass. Nice job, Wolfie.
Service and drinks were great. Food was horrible. My pasta tasted like it came out of a can.

We were craving pizza and this hit the spot. It was light and delicious with really fresh ingredients. Plus, I liked that the ambience, liquor etc was nice for dinner - pizza restaurants can be hit or miss that way. Also got the Kale Salad and Bruschetta and both we're yummy! Service was good and prices are reasonable. There was more we want to try so we'll be back.

Dropped by for great bar food (Calamari, assortment of Pizzas, Wings) and drinks, all of which, were delicious. There is that "Wolfgang Puck" twist on every dish and cocktail. Joanna, our server, had great recommendations, and was spot on with customizing our drinks. She deserves 5 Stars for service alone!! Love this hidden gem at Crystals Shops near Aria/Vdara.

This place has great ambiance and our server Bryce is super helpful and friendly. I got the "pork steak" which turned out to a pork cutlet, but the flavor is great. It taste similar to BBQ Vietnamese pork. We also got the Pappardelle, which was perfect.
My experience here was amazing! My waiter, Apollo, took very good care of us. Always attentive and so very pleasurable. Would definitely come back! This is what you look for ! Thank you, Apollo.

It's like my mind is playing tricks on me lately I could of sworn that you are still my baby I'm on a merry-go-round Going around, driving me crazy at...WP Pizzeria! - Jay Sean (lights off)  I needed a 'safe' meal that was close to me that wouldn't be too heavy since I was playing in a world series event the next morning. WP restaurants have always been good to me and a vegetarian pizza seemed like a great idea. I really like the atmosphere of this place since its in an open area and very bright, compared to so many dimly lighted places all around vegas.   I ordered the mushroom pizza which came with thyme and arugula (finished every bit of it). My initial reaction when I saw it was that it was such a big portion. The pizza wasn't greasy and the cheese wasn't overwhelming either. The caesar salad with chicken looked appetizing as well but took a while to come out. I really wanted to save room for dessert because they had something called a zeppole that was supposed to be a delight but I just couldn't do it.   P.S. Service was definitely a highlight here!  Food: 4 stars --- Service: 5 stars --- Atmosphere: 4.5 stars --- Price(value): n/a
Great food and atmosphere. Even better with family and friends in a corporate event.  Tony and staff were very attentive to our large group.

I was so disappointed with this place! Went to dinner with my family and friends the restaurant was empty there were like 2 people by the bar and we still had to wait 30 mins for the server to come and take our orders then another 40-60mins for them to bring our food.  The food was whatever.  At the end we ordered coffee and desserts so there goes another 20mins waiting for that.  I asked the waitress how much longer she said "it's coming right up" ok so we sit and wait.  After waiting for another 30 mins we asked for the check and still no dessert so we got up to leave and I told the waitress on the way out we never got our dessert she didn't even apologize or anything just smiled.  Will not be going back.  Was expecting more from this place.

We came for a late dinner, at around 9pm and were seated promptly. Our waiter was very polite and helpful in explaining the menu, wine options & prie fixe menu. We started with a glass of wine and a ginger & pineapple moscow mule.   We decided that we didn't need 2 desserts (regrets). So my husband got a meatball pizza and I ordered off the prie fixe menu. The meatball pizza was absolutely delicious, I would highly recommend it. The meatballs were very soft, and spiced well. The ricotta cheese was also a really nice touch. The crust was great too.   For the prie fixe dinner, I ordered the bruschetta, rigatoni & tiramisu. The bruschetta was really good, but kind of odd because it wasn't covered in tomatoes like I expected. But the little greens on the top was super good! The rigatoni was also super good, the sauce was a little watery but super tasty. The noodles were cooked well and there were tons of mushrooms. I added a healthy dose of fresh Parmesan too, so good! The tiramisu was good but more chocolatey than I expected too, but it was good. Our friend also did the prie fixe menu with a bruschetta, margherita pizza & Vanilla Zeppole.   The star of the meal for us was the vanilla zeppole! He didn't totally know what he was ordering, but we were so surprised when it came out. It was so fresh and warm, the Carmel sauce was super yummy too. Either way, everything we had was great, no complaints, but you have to order the vanilla zeppole!!!

Omg, best dinner ever, try the meatballs for an appetizer !!!!! It's unassuming how good it was going to be but we will be BAck next time we are in Vegas. Good value as it was not I the casino. I enjoyed the sangria? Although don't sit overlooking the mall, it's very warm by there. Sit inside the resturaunt

Service:  sucks. Waited 45  minutes for food. poor waiter they gave him the whole east dude of the restaurant to handle by himself.   Food: mediocre to bad. I had the Italian meat pizza. I think dominos pizza is a notch better.   Wolfgang... This restaurant is disappointing.

Happy Hour all day, everyday at the bar! This is the most important thing you need to know. Don't be fooled by the malicious tables calling your name. Plant your bootay at the bar and gobble up some deliciously priced pizzas, salads, appetizers and booze. ($5 Hoegaarden on tap!)  There is more than enough for a meal on the menu. We had two individual size pizzas, a salad, calamari and a glass of beer for around $30, and the only thing that slightly disappointed was the insalata mista. The dressing was pretty much oil without zing, but the greens were fresh and beautiful. The pizza dough was thin and soft. We had the veggie selection, and it did not have sauce, which my husband missed, but I didn't mind. I still thought the pizza was flavorful with Ricotta cheese. The calamari was tender and came with bonus fried shrimp and little veggies. The batter flavor was spiced nicely. An amazing value for on the Strip, especially at Crystals!  We came in about 30-minutes before closing, and we experienced no attitude. Arriving close to closing time is always a good test of service, as bad servers will glare at you or try to convince you the kitchen is closed. The bartender, who was our server, was friendly and not pushy even after the place had officially closed.  If you happen to have blown all your cash at Miu Miu or Fendi or Kiki or... wherever, sidle up to the bar and enjoy quality happy hour treats!
Five star service from Tony!  Such a funny and crazy guy.    The bruschetta and the zeppoles are my favorite, I can't wait to go back!
Amazing!!  I come to Vegas every couple of months and this is a Gem, amazing food, great service, and good prices.  I have had many different things on the menu and it is all excellent.

This place was great! Loved the location in the shoppes at aria and the menu. The pasta was delicious. We also had the meatball pizza which was perfect! The crust was amazing. The dessert donuts or zeppolis were delicious. The white chocolate sauce and raspberry sauce were great for dipping. Must try!
Decided to try it for lunch and liked it! Decently priced and good food.  The boar ragu is great. The bruchetta is a little on  the sweeter side but still good.

My wife and I ate at Cucina tonight.  The food was excellent!! Since we did not have a reservation we were seated near the bar.  The waiter took our order, handed us the food, and almost didn't come back to see if we wanted to pay.  Someone was there to fill our water in his absence, so my complaints are soft complaints.  The pappardelle bolognese was excellent.  I have had a very similar dish in Italy and this meal was very authentic.

This is definitely NOT a $$ restaurant. It's more between $$$ & $$$$ price wise. Went there for dinner. The food was good but for these prices you can get much better food other places! Worst than that are the staff who try really hard to force $8 bottle of water at you and immediately change attitude as soon as you don't order the most expensive food on the menu! Do not recommend it!

Everything here was a step above olive garden and just underwhelming.  We took our reps out for a quick dinner before the evening started to really roll.  The pastas were all a little overdone and not quite to our liking.  I mean it is really cheap and located in the shopping mall within citycenter.    Check out other places to really enjoy pucks culinary delights.  It just seems like they didn't get it right here.  The salads were actually pretty good though.  But they charge extra for anchovies.  Kinda shitty to charge extra for a salad that cost as much as a pizza.  Cheers and good luck!

Me and the bf came here and sat at the bar, the bartender was great with switching the tv to a game we wanted to watch. We ordered drinks, apps and entrees, all of which we have zero complaints. The wings were CRISPY and delicious! We loved them! The Caesar salad came with anchovies, I'm sure you can request it without, but I don't mind them.  I got the raviolis, the large order, which in my opinion wasn't very large. They also were not filled enough and weren't pillow-like. They seemed to be off in the cheese to dough ratio. They were more flat and I believe it was simply because they were a) under filled and/or b) made with mozzarella cheese vs ricotta. Mozzarella melts differently than ricotta, which could have also contributed to the flatness of the ravioli. But otherwise they were delicious. But who couldn't use more cheese??! :-) Overall it was a great price for a nice relaxing dinner to break up the day.  $70 (before tip) for a pitcher of sangria, meat and cheese board, Caesar salad, wings, and raviolis. Not bad. We will be back to try new things.

Amazing service, good food and fine dining in upscale shopping. We were able to book a reservation same day for 8 ppl on a Saturday. No problem when we showed up with 9, they pulled over and extra table which gave some extra elbow room. They adjusted the place settings right away. Drinks were well made from iced tea to Sangria to martinis! I am big on glasses being refilled and our bus-person was on point! He was courteous but quiet and bothered no one. Our waiter was amazing, kind and very apologetic when they missed our order of ravioli. The manager and waiter did whatever they could to make it right. We shared pizza and salads, clams and linguini, pork chops and pesto, chicken and braised short ribs. Calamari was perfectly cooked. Whatever you order you will not be disappointed. Food was delicious....great job staff! We will be back to see you again.  Oh with meals & drinks but no appetizers or desserts price came to less than $40 per person before tips. Enjoy!

I've been here for lunch a couple of times and have had a great experience every times. They have the largest portion of clam linguine and it is always cooked to perfection. The pizza was also delicious and you cannot go wrong with any of them. They also have a happy hour menu if you sit at the bar. Service is attentive but a little slow. Overall, a nice casual lunch spot located in Crystals shopping center.

I'm really torn on this place as I've been here multiple times and received mixed service.  The first time I went was a few hours before my flight and ordered salad and pizza with a diet coke and everything seemed to be fine.  The second time I went was for lunch one day with two of mis amigos. We ordered a handful of items, and followed lunch with an expensive bottle of wine and a cheese plate.  The glasses were extremely dirty (all three, one had dried food pieces on it) and the server proceeded to pour what amounted to be $20 worth of wine into one of the glasses before we noticed the dried food piece mid-pour. We were in Vegas so we really didn't mind. The cheese-plate took about 30 minutes after they gave us the first bottle which was almost finished, and was more of an American-sized cheese-plate (huge pieces of cheese). I would still recommend checking it out.

We came here with another couple during the beginning of March Madness. We thought the place would be packed but it wasn't, which surprised us. We got the meatballs as an appetizer and they were great! Every entree we ordered came out great and even better than we expected. I loved the setting of the restaurant also because we could watch people wander around the Crystals mall. If you come here make sure you go to the restroom to check it out, it's definitely different and a very cool design!

Solid, solid Italian food in Vegas!  We made reservations for a Sunday night but we didn't need them as it was pretty empty at 8pm.  We ordered my favorite Roman pasta dish (cacio e pepe) as an app and loved it!  I have never seen this on a menu in the States so I was really impressed that they had it.  The cheese was fresh and the pepper gave it the perfect kick...I'd order this as my meal next time!  Then we got our dinners - my husband got some dddeeelicous meatballs and pasta I got pasta with meat sauce and it was GOOD.  Like, so good I wanted to go back for dinner the next day!  The pasta was al dente and the meat sauce was thick and flavorful and stuck right to the pasta.  Our server was quick and attentive.  We never had low waters and he was always around if we had a question or needed something.  The ONLY thing I didn't like about this place was that they didn't give bread unless you asked for it, and we actually had to ask twice before they brought it out to us.  Prices were pretty standard for a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, and the quality of food was worth it!

This Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina is located inside the Crystals shopping center on the 2nd floor. My husband and I came here for lunch before we headed to the airport and were seated right away; the hostess and server were very nice and friendly from arrival to departure.  We also liked the food here a lot, we had steamed mussels as appetizer, the sausages in the mussels were very tasty and mussels were perfectly cooked,  just the sizes were kind of small. I also had their special fish of the day, it was very tender and flavorful. Husband ordered their Beef Carpaccio and Steak Tartar and he liked it so much that he finished the everything in 5min.  We also ordered some of their red wine, I can't remember the name of it but it was recommended by the server; it was very smooth and flavorful, I wish we have more time to hang out there and try more food and wine.  We'll be back!

Wolfgang pucks is always a great choice for healthy delicious food.  No matter. Where I go from Orlando to Vegas or LA I can count on a great meal that is not cheap but won't use a whole paycheck either.  My Italian friends were impressed with the food, although Italians never have anything good to say about pasta unless they are in Italy
Food was amazing.  The service is awesome.   Best salmon ive ever had.  They also have kid plates and the deserts are ridiculously scrumptious.
I had a Caesar salad with anchovies and ragu pasta. The food was delicious and I'd recommend it to anyone.
Great food, great prices and excellent service! Tony, our waiter, was super friendly, attentive & entertaining! I highly recommend this restaurant.
Marinated olives and sopressata sandwich are great selections from the midday Tapas menu. The sangria by the pitcher will get you back on track if your suffering from a Las Vegas hangover.

Had the tomato bruschetta as an appetizer and the veal scallopini as an entree, both of which were delicious. If you're in Vegas, skip the buffets (which are usually disappointing) and head here instead.

We were looking for a casual dinner on the first night of our staycation at Mandarin Oriental, so we chose this restaurant inside of Crystals. We were impressed by the modern dining room and, although casual, there was a taste of elegance in the warm, inviting decor. And since it's pretty open on the second floor of Crystals, you can do some good people-watching while you dine.   My husband called ahead and told them we were celebrating my birthday (which was the next day). The hostess greeted me by name and wished me a happy birthday, which I thought was nice. Everyone was extremely attentive throughout the entire meal. Waters never went empty, we were never left alone for long, and they checked on us frequently without being overbearing.   We tried the Caesar salad, chicken piccata, and margherita pizza. All were delicious. I don't like capers, but I pushed them to the side of the chicken and thoroughly enjoyed the meal. The pizza was very good - fresh tasting sauce and cheese on a softer crust and, although I've never been, it's what I imagine a fresh pizza would taste like in Italy. For dessert we tried the zeppoles. What an interesting take on a simple Italian dessert. They were filled with a creamy orange custard and served with caramel dipping sauce. Delightful! They had a very nice wine list and a full bar (happy hour at the bar all day, every day. If I'm in the area I'll definitely stop in for a drink and a nosh!).   Also, this restaurant has a "Compliments of the Chef" locals program in place that entitles locals to preferred seating, priority reservations, and a free dessert per couple. Just tell them you're local!

Our experience at Cucina was outstanding. The service, right off the bat, was terrific. Our server, Quetzi, was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. My girlfriend has a severe gluten allergy, and Quetzi walked us through everything on the menu and checked on the specials to be sure that they could be prepared gluten-free.  I do not eat GF, but we ordered everything GF that night, and I can confidently say that gluten-free diners will love Cucina.  We started with the Piccollo antipasti plate, and it was a pretty sizable portion that makes a great appetizer for two (but could probably accommodate three as well). The bread, which is about the only thing Cucina did not have a GF option for, is outstanding. The meats, cheeses and olive tapenade were all great.  The Ensalata pizza on a GF crust was great. Crispy but not dry, it had a great basil pesto sauce with some acid added from a little red wine vinegar. The greens on top were fresh and delicious.  Cucina only had gluten-free rigatoni as a pasta option that night, but it was scratch-made in house. It was incredible. My girlfriend said it was the best pasta she's ever had since being forced to alter her diet more than seven years ago. I would never have known it was GF pasta. It was cooked to perfection, and the Manila clams, shrimp and calamari that accompanied it were delicious and perfectly cooked.  We also had Cucina's house Pinot Noir (from Wolfgang's own label), which we got free with a MyVegas voucher. It was delicious, with hints of cherry and cocoa.  I cannot recommend Cucina enough. Everything about our experience was worthy of five stars.

I had Mahi tacos. The fish was just at tad rare, crispy cabbage, and surprisingly good corn tortillas. You could taste the fresh fish. You get some lime to add however much lemon you like with your fish. I like the taste of lime and salt. Though not offered, a hot sauce would go great with this dish.

Cousins came to visit and we did a bit of walking and shopping. Come time for lunch,  we could not decide. Finally, I was asked Carnegie Deli or Wolfgang Puck. I looked, deadpaned and just said "DUH! Wolfgang Puck". Service was great, our server giving us suggestions on not just the food, but specialty drinks as well. I didn't do much talking,  i was just enjoying my food. The BEST butternut squash soup EVER!
Tony took great care of us! At first we were apprehensive to eat at a 'mall restaurant' but we're greatly pleased with the service and the delicious, incredible meal.
I love this place! Always great food and great service. It's never overwhelmingly busy and has a great comfortable vibe. Order anything and you will enjoy it!

This is a place you walk by and just think, oh wow it looks nice and fancy but it doesn't seem like the food will be great here.    It's never crowded and the menu doesn't seem extravagant.  But let me tell you, don't be deceived... the food is delicious here.  We started out with a calamari; it was cooked to perfection.  The calamari was tender and crispy with a light breading.  The sauces that came with it was a lemon-pesto and a cocktail sauce.  Both were amazing and kept it fresh.  I had the margherita pizza which seems fairly plain but was the best margherita pizza i've had.  The salty cheese and crispy soft bread and the savory tomato sauce all complimented each other.    My SO had the cheese panini with tomato soup; the best that she's ever had and she's a grilled cheese and tomato soup fanatic.  We were so full we couldn't order dessert.  I would definitely come back again

I give it five stars for location/service. Server was great, nice ambience, the food was weak....shrimp scampi, WEAK, Margherita pizza, WEAKraviolis was empty ... Lol don't make me laugh. I've  had ketchup that was better then their sauce. Come on Wolfgang, what the PUCK, I was really disappointed what an $85 waste, it would have been better spent in A slot machine..LOL.  If you want some real Italian food go to Batista's hole in the wall....I can't believe this is an Italian eatery I would never go back. This review is just my personal opinion of this establishment. Opinions may very.

So obsessed with this place, I want to go back to Vegas just to have the pasta. We went for a casual dinner & were pleasantly surprised by how delicious it was! The pasta was cooked perfectly & the sauce was to die for, don't get me started about how good the meatballs were! Definitely will be back next time I'm in town!

We had another amazing dining experience at Cucina by Wolfgang Puck.    They just happened to have gluten-free ravioli available the night we dined.  They were light and delicious with cheese filing and a marvelous tomato sauce on top.  This time we also tried the gluten-free mushroom pizza with fontina, braised leeks, taleggio and a fried egg on top!  OMG, I have a new favorite - the flavors together on this pizza were unique and magical!  Wow, Wolfgang Puck... you really knocked it out of the park with this home run!
Had a great meal with the wife! We had the bruschetta, garlic bread, and rigatoni. Everything was great. Service was amazing!
Service 5 stars! Pork belly with balsamic yummy:-) Crispy arancini great... Roasted pepper aioli the bomb!!! Great deal on Kids meal! I apologize for late review came here several months ago.

My husband and I ate here early one night before a show. Seating was quick, and we even noted the unique water glasses (wine bottle bottoms). Took a while for our food to come but once it did we thoroughly enjoyed the thin crust pizza and eggplant Parmesan. Yum! I'd definitely return next time I'm in Vegas.

Best meal we had in Vegas - our server DJ was a delight as well. Very family friendly - great menu with a variety if you need to cater to different tastes.   My family and I chose to eat here while we were shopping at mall where the restaurant is located because of the name - Wolfgang Puck!  My wife had a steak that was perfect - son had the best spaghetti we have ever tasted, my daughter had a burger which was fantastic and I had the salmon which was remarkable - I ordered asparagus which was the best I have ever had.    Management of the restaurant was very attentive and even went out of the way to make our visit special by granting us a small favor which my kids will remember.   If you have a chance the visit here is worth it - great value for a meal on the strip. We went back a couple more times during our stay and had incredible meals and great service each time.

Well, everything in Vegas seems to "stand out" and this place's design is no exception.   We had 7 people in our group and apparently there were only a few tables that could fit all of us...one of which was located in an unusual spot. Our table was behind the big sign at the entrance and also behind one of the big support pillars. You can barely see us from inside the restaurant but from the outside, we're in plain view. It felt weird because we were literally right next to the escalator and the entrance so people were walking right by us and staring...kind of like when people look at the primate enclosures at the zoo. One side of the table had chairs and the other side had a really low couch; when I sat down the table level was at my chest.  I had the chicken panini with a side of potato chips. Both were excellent. Arguably one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. The rosemary fries were amazing as well.  Most of the group had the same linguini and clams dish but most of the clams were either empty or had tiny bits of clam.  5 stars for food but 4 stars for the weird table layout.
To add up  unfortunately your restrooms are so dirty  bad ugly  again dirty dirty dirty.

Just got done with shopping and walked over to eat. Asked for a table and the hostess rudely informed me that they are closed. Now I frequent the place as I live next door. I asked her to confirm that they closed two minutes ago. She proceeded to laugh in my face and say yes then turned around. They just lost a loyal costumer which is rare for Vegas. I overlooked the fruit flies in the past but this level of rude and disrespect is beyond me!

We came here on a Thursday night with a reservation and had no wait time. The space is really nice and the tables are well spaced out. The service was great, friendly, funny waiter who was attentive and polite in spite of the fact that we weren't ordering the most expensive thing on the menu. We got the Chicken Piccata and the Pork Milanese, both were phenomenal: great portion sizes, yummy sauces, nice presentation, and both around $25. Highly recommend.
Food is excellent!  Have been here every time we visit Vegas.  Pizza is delish, sangria is spectacular, their salads, rib eye, pasta is tastey!  What's no to love!  Eat here and enjoy it!

We did the Sunday family style dinner as part of my bachelorette party and honestly best meal we had in Vegas all weekend! A ton of food for 20 dollars a person and it was soo flavorful! (salad, pizza, meatballs, chicken parm and 2 desserts). And all the entrees were delicious, every part was exceptional.  Shout out to our server Vance!
Very good food for a pleasantly not absurd price.  The setting was surprisingly pleasant for a mall.

I was on a work trip and staying at the Mandarin Oriental. It was during lunch and most places around were busy. I happen to walk by Cucina and noticed some seats available at the bar. I've been to other Wolfgang places and have always been impressed with the food.  This was no different. I ordered their salad and added grilled salmon that was perfectly cooked. The salad was well balanced and not over dressed.  Being an Italian themed restaurant I had to add a side of meatballs. They came out scorching hot and delicious - yum!  A reason why I didn't give it a 5 star although the food was great and the bartender was super nice, they were a bit slow in taking my order as well as bringing the food out.  The gentleman next to me had a harder time as he was obnoxiously complaining. Nonetheless it was entertaining for me.  I'd definitely recommend if you are looking for a bite that is not too pricey and packed due to the casino or hotel crowd as this location is in a high end mall attached to Aria.
Very good. I've never had a bad meal at any of Puck's restaurants and this one is no exception.  Service was very good as well.
The mushroom pizza was good, but one of the few vegetarian options available. I'm not so sure the sunny-side-up egg worked on top, however.

Last lunch before leaving Vegas, and did not disappoint! I made lunch reservations not knowing if they were going to be busy. They weren't on a weekday and we were led to a nice table overlooking the mall. Cucina is located inside Crystals and a very short walk from Aria's entrance which made the trip even more convenient.  They have a great 3-course lunch special for $25 to include an appy, entree, and a small dessert. Great price esp for it being in the strip and inside Crystals.  We were given bread and olive oil/ vinegar to munch on, and I ordered the following: -Shrimp scampi ($5 extra): The 3 shrimp were large and the flavors of the garlic and lemon were on par. I loved how they included bread so you can use it to dip into the sauce! YUM!!! -Ravioli (no peas): I enjoyed my entree. It was a white light sauce used and it was the perfect kind. Not too heavy and not too creamy. I didn't care for the white asparagus but the mushrooms were good. -Tiramisu: Small dessert and not overbearing. It was the perfect amount to finish off a lunch. I also tried my friends Vanilla Zeppole (donut holes) and they were good - sugar coated donuts.  Our service was great and we were checked on frequently. Waters were filled and the ambiance was cool. Loved how there is a strip restaurant that is reasonably priced!

Very Very good pizza.  Enjoyed ourselves very much.  Had Sangria which was delicious.  Loved the circular appearance of the restaurant allowed you to see what was going on without being completely in the mix of all the chaos.  Located in one of the chic new hotels this last few years.  First time in the crystal shops.  Used open table to book a reservation and worked great!

Wolfgang did not live up to my expectations. I was torn between the ravioli and the lasagna, and the waiter talked me into the lasagna. When I got it, it was the first time I've ever received lasagna by itself (without any bread or sides). I tasted it, bland. It just wasn't amazing at all. My friend got the $27 salmon which came with mashed potatoes, and I guess it was good, but $27 worth? Not by my standards. The $19 lasagna was probably worth $4 to me. First and last visit to Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria.

I must come here every time I visit vegas!! I have tried the pizzas and some pastas but I must say the clam linguini and wild boar are my most favorite. Too bad last time I went they did not have the wild boar pasta for some reason so I got the veal ravioli instead and that was really good as well! This is one of my favorite restaurants on the strip!

I came to Las Vegas with my husband and three kids. Being in Vegas as a family of five can be very pricey. However if the quality and service is great than cost is all worth it. That is exactly what you find here at Cucina! The food was so amazingly delicious! The ministrone soup was superb! My son orderd ravioli and it tasted like was just freshly made. My hubby ordered seabass and it was cooked to perfection. My daughters ordred margarita pizza, they loved it! The service was amazing as well. Our server was really sweet and funny!
Excellent pizza place.  I had the Italian meat pizza and it was great.  Service was good too. Caesar salad was good but not great.

Great vibes!! The service was excellent. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The food was great too. We got the mushroom pizza and pasta. Both were very tasty. Only issue was that both dishes were very oily. But still good. The dessert was great too. The doughnuts were amazinggg!

came to Vegas for the first time over memorial day weekend. came from Oakland CA. really wanted to experience some great food. the guys I came with didn't want to eat here after seeing the menu (went to shake shack instead. what a waste) but that didn't deter me. this food was mindblowing. had the Brick Chicken and Caesar salad. chicken had a kick to it, a little spicy, but man was it good. the food was great but Apollo, my server, was the highlight. this guy was amazing. we had good talks about life and not getting overwhelmed  by it. he knew his food. knew the drinks. but really just a pleasant guy. Apollo if you're reading this, you the man.

Majorly disappointed that they ran out of ingredients for both white and red sangria but then it was almost 8pm.  Loved that the waiter sensed our disappointment and instead gave us some free shots.  Now if that isn't customer service, I don't know what is!  The food and service is excellent.  Very efficient on water refills.  I was excited to try a Wolfgang Puck joint and was definitely not disappointed (aside from the sangria).  I opted for a pizza, my sister had the lasagna.  Both were the best of the best that we have had.  I enjoyed the casual yet "fancy" feel of the restaurant.  Next time I am in Vegas I will definitely stop in for the happy hour specials, which I hear are awesome.

My friend and I needed a quick place for lunch before we flew off, back home to Cali. Thank goodness we saw the pre-fixe options here when we walked through the mail earlier in our trip.  There was a great variety to choose from in the pre-fixe menu. I went with the minestrone soup, chicken, and dessert. The soup was very mild and could have used a little more flavor. My main entree was very yummy! Cooked and paired well with the pasta. As for dessert, donut holes with dipping sauce.  All not bad for the price. Overall great experience. Service was good. Nice location in the mall.

The linguine side for $7 blew me out of the water.  The simplicity and excellent taste were beyond any other food we had in vegas.  This place redefines fresh pizzas.  We had a spectacular lamb chorizo pizza
The service and the ambiance was nice. I ordered the spaghetti and a side of meatballs. The food was tasty, although the meatballs were a tad bit salty.

Located inside Crystals Mall, Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria & Cucina offers a gorgeous yet inviting dining room, as well as a modern and chic bar and lounge scene. The restaurant's orientation offer's a bird's eye view of the Crystals Mall, but if you want something more intimate, opt for the interior dining.   The menu is clearly Italian-influenced, with choices like Italian pizzas, salads, pastas & paninis. They also have authentic appetizers such as Italian salumi (San Daniele Prosciutto, my ultimate fav...not easy to find in the U.S) , Grilled Octopus, and Prime Beef Carpaccio. The fine selection they have really demonstrated the authenticity the restaurant brings forth.   Prices are reasonable, so this is a great option if you aren't looking to drop money as if you were dining at Joel Robuchon. The food is definitely well-prepared and nicely presented. The wine list is also solid, with options from both the US and Italy. Glasses are reasonably priced at $8-$12 range.   My most memorable thing here was the dessert- Italian Doughnuts - the Zeppole. I haven't had Zeppole in the states in ages..so this was a delectable and pleasant surprise! Paired with caramel dipping sauce and vanilla gelato - this makes for an outstanding dessert to share! They're fluffy and light, and not overly sweet (comparable to French Beignets).   There a number of reputable Italian restaurants in Las Vegas. Many renowned chefs have opened restaurants on the strip -Mario Batali, most notably for Carnevino in the Palazzo and B&B in the Venetian, Valentino's in the Venetian, Bartolotta in the Wynn - the list is really very extensive. But, if you want to eat somewhere that is appropriate for a casual lunch, a glass of wine in the afternoon, or a solid dinner meal -this is your go-to place for any occasion. The hospitality and service will also impress you.
Was formerly Brasserie PUCK. LOVE the new concept and menu. The pizzas are traditional great Wolfgang fare...try the mussels...to die for!

Imaginense lo emocionada que fui a un restaurant con el nombre de Wolfgang Puck en la marquesina .... como decepciono! Se merece dos estrellas y media, porque a 3 no llega, especialmente para la expectativa que genera El lugar esta dentro de un shopping, como muchos de los lugares de Las Vegas, pero este de alguna forma decepcionaba mas, el lugar era realmente shopping y el restaurant como uno de esos locales en uno de los pasillos, abierto de todos lados y con mucha luz artificial. Me sente en la barra, y a pesar de que eramos pocas personas en el local, llamar la atencion de un mozo parecia tarea imposible. Finalmente logre que me dieran bola, para traerme unos ravioles sin mucho gusto a nada que estaban medio frios, ni les cuento para cuando me trajeron el queso parmesano. Me cobraran por ellos un precio bastante alto.  No creo que vuelva

Wow, this place serves the SALTIEST clam linguini I have ever tasted!  No exaggeration - it may well have been the saltiest dish I have ever been served.  Ever.  I ate here with two friends, and two of us ordered the linguini and our other friend had the bolognese.  Not one of us could even eat the food without first putting lemon juice on it to neutralize the saltiness.  Not to mention that my friend's linguini had most of the creamy sauce in it while mine was mostly butter and herbs (they were made in the same pan, so wtf?!) I've always known Wolfgang Puck's restaurant was nothing to write home about, but this experience was extremely disappointing.  It wasn't cheap, either.  And no soda refills were offered, just weird tasting tap water.  Which also needed lemon just to make it tolerable.  Ridiculous.

This happy hour is so worth it.  I had the chunky tomato soup (not on the happy hour menu) for my starter and it was Delish.  If you like a good chunky soup.  Then I had the mushroom pizza with a white sauce. It had a interesting flavor but I liked it.  Then, I had the calamari and it was ok but the price was good and the presentation was ok.  The service was so so at the bar. Plus, you get a 20 percent off for YELP.

I wish I can give no star at all.  My wife and I had a long day and couldnt wait to come back to hotel. we ordered food togo but the server is very unhelpful and they got our order wrong. We ordered pasta and salad and they forgot to include the forks.  When we call and complain to manager, he claims that they do not provide it unless we have to ask for it. Doe this make sense to you?? We have to ask for forks when we ordered pasta and salad?? What kind of service is that?  manager is the biggest joke of all. Doesn't even understand english. All he said was "comeback and pick it up or ask for forks at your hotel". what a jerk!!!   I will never ever go back to this restaurant!!
Tony was a great server, very attentive and enthusiastic. Steak was great along with pizza and bruschetta. Low key for the strip.

Great restaurant and their 3 course offer is both reasonable and tasty.   Sizing is great and the food was well prepared.   Service is quick and is very attentive. Be aware that coffee refills will cost you !   Salad was amazing . The Salmon was well cooked and crispy and the tiramisu was very tasty and the side of roasted cauliflower was beautiful and tasted great.

This place is reasonably priced for Vegas, but I would skip it and go to somewhere a little more expensive but not order as much.  We had lunch here and ordered a salad, pizza, and a panini. All lacked in flavor. The pizza was thin and I could hardly taste the sauce, and the prosciutto tasted low quality. The panini was basically a piece of bread with bits and bobs of cheese and pork. The bread was okay, and it wasn't toasted/pressed properly.   Was completely disappointed in every facet of my experience here, service, the booths have weird cushions that sink when you sit down, and we ordered a drink and it turned out to be "mini" size, was expecting regular size.    Don't bother coming here.

Got seated right in. The menu was simple. We ordered the caprese salad and italian sausage pizza.   The waiter took a long time to get our orders and the food took somewhat a long time.  Got the caprese salad - it had tomatoes, mozzarella, pesto and balsamic vinegarette. Expensive for a salad, it was good not great... I wish I had a bit more acid with the salad. Never getting a salad that pricey.  Got italian sausage pizza and it was good. The crust was thin and it was hot. The cheese however, fell off the pizza at times. There was little sausage and it had garlic pieces on top. I don't know what the greens were on the pizza, I think it was broccoli or something along the lines of that, but it gave a bit bitter taste because of the greens.  Overall, the place and location is in the Crystals. The place is modern and its kinda small. The service is a bit mediocre. The price is a little on the pricey side. Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill in the MGM Grand is better because there are more choices to choose from and its good... better than this place.
Bland tasteless food, mediocre service, and boring atmosphere. Not worthy of being in one of the nicest shopping centers in the world.

Being a couple steps away from the Aria this Pizzeria and Cucina was perfect for a nice lunch. It is located inside the Crystals complex which exudes class and high life. This Pizzeria is actually pretty WELL PRICED in my opinion for the quality of the food that you get and the service. Wolfgang Puck is everywhere in Vegas so it is almost expected that you will eventually try is fare.  We ordered a classic Margherita Pizza and kicked it up a notch with the Duck Confit Pizza. Both were absolutely delicious and well made. Not too mention, surprisingly filling. Other than their pizza they did have an assortment of paninis and pasta to choose from. My fellow guest chose a nicely crafted beer to go along with his pizza and I chose their Puccini (which made for midafternoon fabulousness!)  The Margherita Pizza was well made and definitely some of the better pizza I have tried. Duck Confit pizza was very different and an interesting experience for my palate. The base for the pizza is a squash base which makes it more heavy while complementing the sprinkled Duck Confit. There are great choices for herbs placed on their pizzas as well.  I was happy with the service, though would have liked it if the waiter stopped by to refill our water more.   Overall, great deal for some great cuisine! Try it!

It's that hole in the wall in the middle of an upscale mall, The Shops at Crystal. Another one of Wolfgang Puck's establishments, Cucina is a small upscale restaurant right next to Starbucks. By the way, that Starbucks is not owned by corporate so your Starbucks promo cards might not work if you go there. I made a reservation through Open Table which they happily accommodated.  -As a shareable starter, we ordered the Bruschetta (tomato, pesto, aged balsamic, parmesan) $11.  -I ordered the Rigatoni (bolognaise, ricotta salata) $23. I was more of craving for a specific bolognaise (veal-pork) which I did not find in this restaurant. The rigatoni was okay, nothing special.  -My significant other ordered the Eggplant Parmesan (spaghetti "cacio e pepe") $25. It was served in separate plates and there was plenty of pasta to share. -We didn't order any alcohol since our hotel was quite far from this area but there was a bar in the middle of the restaurant. They offer a good variety of bubbles, white, red, and dessert wines to choose from.

I came here this past weekend while we were in Vegas celebrating my birthday. We had a dinner reservation for a party of 10 and after a long day at the pool and drinking everyone was running late. They were very accomodating and held our table while our party trickled in. The service was great and the food was fabulous! Absolutely loved everything we ordered. The veggie pizza with truffle oil was great, I've been craving it since I had it and the caesar salad was superb! I will definitely be visiting this place everytime I'm back in LV.
Quetzi was our server. She is sweet, attentive, and full of energy. The food is delicious and exactly what I was craving. I ordered the Caesar salad and the Bolognese pasta.

Came here at Wolfgang Puck Pizzeria and Cucina with my girlfriend around 4. We both got a cocktails. The server Kristine reccomend white sangria and we got aMoscow mule and a white sangria. Had the prosciutto pizza and the best service of our  life!   Cannot wait to go back.  Kristine was the best!
Good food and portions. Service and staff were great! I had a pretty satisfying experience (:

We came from Az to Las Vegas to celebrate my son-in-laws birthday & the meal was fantastic from beginning to end.  The sea bass, seafood pasta & sirloin were cooked to perfection.  They presented our birthday boy with a delicious zeppole dessert.  We cannot wait to go back to Cucino.
Very slow service but Tony compensated with free tea and bruschetta, he was very helpfull

I usually enjoy Wolfgang Puck restaurants. There are so many here in Vegas, but this is one of the few I haven't been to. It's located in the The Shops at Crystal. I picked Cucina because it's so close to the Bellagio and I'm bringing kids, so I can't travel too far.     We were seated immediately at a table by a window. It's a perfect place for people watching because everyone takes a detour through here to avoid the sun and catch some A.C. Plus I find the atmosphere and decor to be modern and clean but still warm. It's also a very open space, so I don't feel crowded or rushed. I ordered a fixed price meal for myself and a kids pizza for my daughter. Yes, they have a kids menu. That's like an automatic bonus point for me. Included in my meal was a starter, a main course and a desert. I opted for an eggplant bruschetta as my starter and added a pepperoni pie for the main dish. My wife ordered the shrimp scampi appetizer and the ravioli with white asparagus, mushrooms and peas.     "Well how did it taste?" You ask. I though the food was delicious across the board! Both appetizers were tasty but my bruschetta was tiny and left me hungry. The scampi on the other hand was a big portion and tasted "lick your fingers" good! My pizza was rustic or simple. It had a thin crust cooked crispy with a basic tomato sauce and a good amount of kick thanks to the pepperoni. Even better than my pie was the ravioli. The sauce and filling were creamy and buttery, but surprisingly not heavy. The mushrooms do a solid job filling in for a protein, so you're not left feeling hungry. I thought it was the best thing on the menu and worth coming back for.     For desert we split the tiramisu and zeppoles. A zeppole is basically fried dough with a creamy filling. This version was absolutely amazing and came with a side of warm strawberry preserves that could have been served on its own. The tiramisu was very good as well. It was light and had a cinnamon and rum kick to balance the drizzled chocolate on the plate. I enjoyed every course and thought the value was worth $35 a person.    Without a doubt, my food was great. My only complaint was how much time I spent here. It took WAY TOO LONG! I was here for over 90 minutes and I didn't order drinks or anything out of the ordinary. It took our server 20 minutes to take our payment and process our check. She literally dissspeared with my credit card for 20 minutes and didn't come back to give us an update. That kinda behavior makes me nervous as a customer. And I know that nothing funny was happening with my stuff. I know the only reason I had to wait was because next to us was a large party and all 13 of them were paying with a split checks or doing something super complicated. But that's not a ME problem, that's a YOU problem. And when I'm at a nice restaurant, I'm paying extra so that ME is treated well. I'm still going to recommend you grab a meal at Cucina, but don't be surprised if getting out takes a little while.

Top notch service!! Service is very attentive and impeccable.  The food was great.  The pizza prices are very affordable and the pizzas were a good size.  The caesar salad was very good and they were nice enough to split it up on two plates for us.  The calamari was very tasty.  I recommend this place and would come back.  I love when places refill your drinks promptly, take our money promptly, and get us on our way.  It's a nice date ambiance so dressing up for this place would be nice, but I went casual because I was there for the Las Vegas Marathon to load up on carbs.  We made a reservation for 6 and were seated promptly.

Weak. Totally overpriced and lame.   We ended up with a $100 giftcard to the whole CRYSTALS shopping center, which was pretty much dead when we came to the Vdara hotel for a couple of weekdays. Maybe they thought I'd buy a $3000 watch if they gave me $100, but of course that's a bunch of bullcrap so I was going to get a meal or two out of that $100. This is one of the only places in the complex for a regular lunch, so there we went.   I had high hopes since we went to Spago (didn't mean to go to multiple Wolfgang Puck restaurants) the previous night and loved it. However, for the price the food here was weak and forgettable.   I got veal ravioli with mushrooms. Lots of mushrooms. The weird fungi looking kind that don't really taste like anything. This was pretty much the focal point of the dish, because nothing else really stood out. The sauce was pretty bland and the veal didn't taste like much of anything. The portion was good but for $20+ I was really glad I had a gift card. Don't get me wrong, for $10 per plate I still would have thought it was weak, but for about $70 total after tip I was just mad out of principle.   Scampi appetizer was also kind of weak. Just lots of butter.   Just kind of a weird experience. Supposedly in this really upscale complex being served expensive food but it tasted more like something from a chain.  Lots of tourists at the other tables (sometimes not knowing what or how to order, being foreign tourists..) because there's just nowhere else to eat. What a weird scene!   Also service was slow. We got there right when it was opening at 11, so we could use up our giftcard before driving back to Fresno. And this would hold us over til we got home too. But the slow service was whack. We were one of the first people in and people who showed up much later than us were eating before we got our dishes. Lame!

service: The waiters were all very friendly and kind.   food: the size was really big for me. but the taste was good. Especially the Bolognese rigatoni  environment: It's located inside a high fashion mall and surrounded by shops. Very quite unlike on the Vegas strip.

Currently one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.   Be it the flavoury chicken piccata, thin crust mushroom pizza or eggplant, this place knows how to cook a good meal!  My chicken was perfectly cooked, no too dry and I felt satisfied after the meal without the usually yucky bloated feeling I usually get after a big meal.   The prices are reasonable and I love a bargain. I really dig the setting (Aria balcony), we had an attentive and respectful waiter.  Overall, this place is great, hope it stays this way

*Thumbs up* The grilled octopus salad had a tangy, citrus vinaigrette that complimented the pieces of tender octopus. The manila clams in the linguine main entree were fresh, and the freshly grated parmesan cheese on top was a nice touch.  *Thumbs down* The margherita pizza came free courtesy of MyVegas loyalty points, but that doesn't excuse the soggy and flavorless crust. The pizza could've used more fresh pieces of basil, instead of just one measly herb per slice.

Hey LV yelpers! I had dinner here last night with my gf who lives next door in the Veer towers. I was really excited to try a new restaurant and I have never been to a Wolfgang puck's before... I wasn't really impressed with the food. We ordered the cheese ravioli, Margarita pizza and lemon cheesecake with blueberries. It was OKAY, would I go back? Probably not unless we are lazy to drive off the strip since it's walking distance from her place.  In my yelp opinion I rather drive off strip and get the same or better quality food for a better price tag $ My gf's friend was our waitress so we had good customer service.  I probably won't be back especially since I don't drink so even happy hour won't bring me back. Next.

It's a bit pricey especially with the Canadian dollar so weak.... But, it was worth it.... my Fritto Misto was not only easy on the eye, but delectable!! Simply fried to perfection! I especially enjoyed the fried lemon slices!  Paired w/ their Sauvignon Blanc (Wolfgang Puck) .... In my humble opinion....A perfect way to start the night in Vegas!

I went back here based on my great previous experience. Ordered the veal meatballs from the bar and a margarita pizza. Meatballs were kind of gross (not what I was expecting, they had like a fried crust and no sauce) and pizza tasted exactly like the kind of plain pizza you order from a regular pizza place (but good still). Place was fine but it was not worth coming twice.
It's one of the best Italian place. Thumbs up for the food and the design of dinnerware.
Server and food was very great. Everything was nice except the hostess was not very friendly. Made me not want to eat there at all (at least in my opinion).

I looked up Wolfgang Puck's different restaurants and decided on the Pizzeria & Cucina. It is located inside the Aria above Starbucks. I came here between lunch and dinner, and not surprisingly, it wasn't busy, so I sat at the bar. They have a happy hour menu, but despite the name, it's actually available all day, seven days a week.  To start, I had a glass of the red wine sangria, which was wonderfully sweet. It ended up being one of the best-tasting sangrias I've ever had. For an appetizer, I tried the grilled pork belly with balsamic glaze. Quite small, but I loved how it was so tender on the inside with a crunchy exterior. For my main entree, I had a half order of spaghetti and meatballs. Some of the pasta dishes are available in a half size, so just ask. Spaghetti and meatballs seem so simple, but they did it perfectly! They also gave me complimentary bread with butter and red pepper flakes when asked.   The bartender was attentive, and service was excellent overall. Really enjoyed my experience here!
Very cool and casual place for great Italian food..I loved the ravioli with wild mushrooms and margherita pizza was awesome. .great value

Wow, I was not expecting such a tasty meal from (what appeared to be) a mall food court style spot.  The bar and dining area were all open to the mall 'elements' and simply decorated with no linens on the tables and basic glass/flatware.   However...the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful in making suggestions from the menu. EVERYTHING was delicious! We started with the Tomato Bruschetta, Grilled Ciabatta, Basil Pesto, Parmesan Reggiano as an appetizer, it was unique and perfectly balanced in flavor. We also ordered the Margherita pizza, Italian Sausage pizza, Baby Kale salad, and Garganelli Carbonara. Everyone in our party was satisfied and raved about the great flavors.  I was thoroughly impressed, especially for the price!

We were invited back to try Cucina again and this is an update on my past review. First off,  the service was top notch and of course the food was awesome. Dave, who waited on us, was attentive and made our dining experience awesome.. We ordered the pork steak, linguine w clams, chicken, sausage pizza, and cured beef with cheese. We cleaned up the plates and did not leave any food left on the plates..The food was good the first time and even better the second time. But more importantly we were treated like VIPS and i just want to thank Evan and his staff for making that happen..thks Evan. We will definitely be returning soon.

Food was ok, but nothing to write home about, except the garlic bread.  I had the veal marsala and my friend had the eggplant parmesan.  I ate at Wolfgang Puck's Bar and Grill and it was way better and also cheaper.  Staff here was nice, but server was way too chatty.  Had a nice view of the mall to people watch though.

Highlights from the menu (as of 11/19/2016):  - bruschetta (antipasti): $8, one of the best I've tried! The tomatoes tasted so fresh and the ingredients blended so well together. definitely recommend!  - soppressata (pizza): $17, soooo good! I'm not a huge fan of salami but the pizza was so delicious I didn't mind at all.  - rigatoni (pasta): $20, definitely good for sharing. My group also got the pappardelle which was also good, but if you are looking for something for tomato sauce based, I would go for the ravioli.   - bistecca for 2 (daily specials): $79, also highly recommend!! The order came out a little more rare than expected (we asked for medium rare), so keep that in mind if you're ordering this. The meat is so soft and rich, I was sold after one bite! Comes with potatoes and broccolini, from what I remember.   Overall this place has GREAT ambiance, GREAT service, and GREAT food. Good for groups or with another person- if you're coming with one other person, I'd recommend a pizza and pasta to share. Thanks for a great experience! I will definitely come back next time.

This place is amazing! Not only the food but the service is top notch. I spoke to the manager and chef to do something special for my girlfriend's birthday. They went above and beyond. The Chef made a dish for her that was her favorite in the past and had been off the menu. Truly went out of their way to make the day special for her. Thank you guys!

Came here to cucina today for lunch.our waiter Tony was fantastic. A+ service. I ordered the sea bass and it was prepared perfectly. Picatta, with lemon butter sauce and broccolini. I will definatly be back and order this again. My companion had the veal scaloppini and was very happy with his meal. The environment is lovely, modern and relaxed. A very nice retreat from the noisy casinos. Will be back

First time trying this place for my cousins bday and was not impressed.  Wasn't horrible but don't think I'd come back for a few reasons.    Location is inside the crystal shops adjacent to the aria hotel.  Kind of an interesting location being in a shopping mall with a wide open concept.  A few reasons why I didn't like this place.  1. Waiter was VERY nice (his name was Tony).  But not sure if it's because it wasn't packed or possibly felt like he was the only waiter working for Saturday night dinner, but service was really slow.  Long wait for food and check.    2. Food wasn't amazing.  Saw a bunch of pics on Yelp that may have been outdated but a lot of those foods were not on the menu anymore.  We have the spaghetti (decent), pepperoni pizza (decent), margherita pizza (not good), prosciutto pizza (VERY good), and ravioli (plain).    Glad I got to try the place, but most likely won't be back.

This was the best surprise of our recent trip to Vegas. We generally avoid the big name chef spots, but gave this a try for lunch. Full menu at the bar (excellent start). The bartender (who reminded me for all the world of Jim from "The Office") topped up my prosecco (moving along nicely). The kitchen initially advised that I couldn't have my chosen appetizer, then sent out a modified version made especially for me (Brownie points accumulating rapidly). Both of us had pizza which was really, really good. I asked the very personable bartender for a drink fit for a winner and he whipped one up. When the bill came, they were experiencing issues with the credit card system, so they knocked off one beer for the trouble (fantastic finish, boys). Check out the Chihuly's (good) on the way to the offputting semi-unisex bathroom (bad).

Best four-course meal I've had for the value! $55 bucks for the chef's tasting menu - includes salad, shrimp scampi, pasta dish, seabass and steak, and three different dessert samplers...all per person! Will definitely be back again to do it!

We decided to go here on a whim since we had a gift certificate for the Crystals and saw that the prices here were surprisingly more reasonable than the pub nearby.  We had great service starting with their consideration of one of our guest's allergies and their helpful service when the food took a little bit longer to prepare.  The food itself was great, we started with the shrimp scampi which was a good sized appetizer for two people consisting of the bread, toppings and a good amount of shrimp.  We each ordered the prosciutto pizza, hers without cheese and mine with cheese, both variants were very good and were sizable enough for one person each to have and still have some leftovers.  Overall, I would recommend dining here to anyone who is looking for a more upscale dining experience that still feels comfortably casual.

The food is absolutely phenomenal! We've eaten here so many time this review is long overdue. Just brought my friend here for the first time the other day and she too fell in love. The calamari and shrimp are my two favorite appetizers. For entree, I am obsessed with the spaghetti and meatballs (truly the best here) and carbonara. Their pizzas, salads and other entrees are also good. Wolfgang Puck knows how to do it!

This restaurant was excellent! For a girls weekend in Vegas I had tried to cut down on pizza and other unhealthy foods but when we got there, all bets were off. So on our last night we headed over towards Aria and had gluten free pizza at this awesome place. The restaurant is located in a mall between the Aria and Cosmo, which is probably the only negative because it doesn't offer any cool views of the hotels or the Strip. But the food was worth it. We shared 3 pizzas and a dish of pasta- we were five super hungry, sunburned and recently pizza-deprived girls. Oh and we started with a burrata and prosciutto appetizer. Everything was delicious, Wolfgang definitely knows how to make great gluten free pasta and pizza crust. Perfect amount of chewiness, even my non-gluten free friends thought it tasted like the real deal.  We split just a basic tomato based rigatoni pasta, but it was so good for being so simple. And then had a tomato basil, Italian meat and sausage/broccolini pizza. I think my favorite was the the tomato basil but all three were great, I was surprised that the sausage and broccolini flavors complimented each other and totally worked. I tend to like more veggie pizza versus meat, which is why I liked the first one best but meat lovers would be more than pleased with the options here. Can't wait to come back and indulge in this pizza again the next time I'm in Vegas!

Our best dining experience in Vegas so far! A great upscale atmosphere without ridiculous prices like most places along the strip. We had the Margherita pizza, Sausage pizza, and the bruschetta and everything was amazing! Our server Tony was so nice and made us feel like we were the only guests in the restaurant.

Really good. Great service, too. I got the margherita pizza and my husband got spaghetti and meatballs. So seriously delicious. Nice and simple too. Out waiter was very nice and attentive as well. Definitely recommend.

One of my best meals in Vegas. Our waiter was Cabel and he was great. Very attentive and knowledge. Here is why I would recommend this restaurant  1. The service: attentive and knowledgeable  2. The food. So many great options that even if they aren't on the menu they will offer to make it for you. 3. Environment and atmosphere: very sophisticated and posh   I would recommend the spaghetti it was so good. The pizza, goat cheese platter and ravioli are also good.

Lunch with the girls  Shared duck confit pizza, Cesar salad and lasagna with a pitcher of white sangria.  The duck confit pizza was interesting because it's something I never seen made That was used as a pizza topping but it wasn't so bad. Some duck confit, Greens and freshly grated cheese. The lasagna was made tasty and good size. Very soft and fully flavor. Nothing special with the salad a typical Cesar salad that you can't go wrong with. Topped the whole meal together with freshly light white sangria was yummy!

I have stopped in here for lunch a few times when I've been in the area. Very nice open air location in The Shops at Crystals.  I usually get one of their lunch specials which includes:  1) Caesar Salad, Creamy Garlic Dressing, Crouton, Anchovy  2)  Spaghetti Pomodoro, Tomato Concassé, Basil  3)  Tiramisu, Mascarpone Mousse  All three for just $25.  The service is always quick and the food is always spot on.  Great job and I'll see you next time I'm in town.

Had a buy one, get one My Vegas reward. Arrived around 11. We were the only ones at the restaurant when we were seated. I ordered a small ceasar salad to start. It was very good and perfect size for a starter. It had anchovies on top which I love.   For entrees I had the burrata ravioli and my husband had spaghetti and meatballs, both full size portions, there is an option to order half portions. My ravioli were good, got about 9 of them which is perfect for lunch. My husband's was a huge portion with 3 large meatballs. He liked it but could not finish it.   Our waiter was adequate, nothing special about the service.  Our bill with buy one get one was 33 dollars.

The atmosphere is calm and serene, the decorations are appropriate, servers are nice and the quality of the food is what you would expect from Wolfgang Puck. The major problem I have here is with using the discount cards that are affiliated with this restaurant and the managerial staff's lack of acknowledgement for such.   My wife and I came in to have lunch and ordered from their prix fixe lunch menu. Halfway through our meal, we were told that the 30% off discount we showed our waiter would not apply to that menu since the prices were fixed before. Typically I understand this, but when this is not advertised and is the sole reason why you purchased the card, this mistake should not fall on the cost of the consumer. Technically, this can be classified as entrapment, as we were given no fair warning of a selective discount, and not one single printed advertisement says discounts cannot be applied.   When speaking with management, we were told they "don't control what the vendors write" (even though multiple other restaurants have restrictions printed on the same ad), and "we need to go to the website for the fine print" (who does that, and how would we know to do that?) I've done advertising before, I've been in management before- trust me, you've got a lot more control in what's printed because it's technically illegal to have a vendor falsely advertise for you including rearrangement of context and content of advertisements.  This is very unfortunate because the quality of the food we reluctantly paid full price for was excellent, and the staff working there who have no say in the advertising were sublime. I do recommend coming here, but be forewarned if you carry any of the discount cards. My review stands, at least until they can correct their mistake and not blame the consumer for their advertising oversight.

Wow!! The food was delicious! We had Endive Salad & Bruschetta for starters. For main dishes we has Mushroom pizza, Salmon & Eggplant Parmesan. Everything was really good and done to perfection. One of the best eggplant-Parmesan we had & the pizza.... Amazing!!! Quality ingredients and perfectly made thin crust.    The service is pretty good too. Professional & patient waiters. Relaxed atmosphere. A tip: go to one of the 'Half-Price Food/Show Tickets' stands/kiosks on the strip & purchase the %20 off coupon for the restaurant. It will save you a few bucks..

Yummy spot! Grabbed a quick bite with my boyfriend and we loved everything we ordered! It was happy hour so we sat by the bar and enjoyed watching a soccer game. I drank a pitcher of white wine sangria myself and it was so refreshing and sweet! We split a half margarita pizza, half pepperoni. The wood oven pizza that had the perfect crust and just enough wood taste in each bite. I also ordered a salad that was part of the special-- it had plum and nuts... UNREAL! The only complaint I have is that I wasn't a fan of the cheese. I think it was called borgota cheese??? It was a like a very creamy mozzarella? Anyways overall loved this place!

Pizza here was great. It was really nice inside the Crystals Shopping center. Eating inside Crystals made me feel like I was a high roller's wife spending the big bucks. Even though Wolfgang Puck's is actually very reasonable in pricing. I would absolutely go back again.

The family and I really enjoyed dinner here.  Fantastic, friendly, well-timed service. My wife had the clam linguine and the pasta was cooked perfectly, the clams (a great portion) were so fresh, and the sauce was light and very tasty.  I had the veal raviolis with mushrooms, and it was so good I mopped up the sauce with bread.

I think it's safe to say that we had a flawless experience here. It's located inside the Crystal Shops and is very convenient if you're staying in the Aria like we were. We quickly made a reservation, since we got to the hotel and checked in with just enough time to grab food and head over to MGM Grand to get our tickets for the JT concert that night. There were no problems getting reservations with such short notice.   The hostess was extremely friendly. She seated us right away and made small talk. When she and our waiter heard we were going to the concert, they assured us they would expedite our food and make sure we got out of there as soon as possible. They weren't kidding! The service was so fast that we ended our meal with a little time to spare and had time to finish our drinks and relax for a bit.   As far as drinks go, we ordered some dirty vodka martinis, and they were great! super strong and dirty enough to not realize how strong they were!   For our meals, we split the eggplant parmesan and the Roasted eggplant, garlic spinach, and fresh mozzarella pizza. Both meals were absolutely delicious and they were the perfect portions - we were full AND didn't have to worry about leftovers. Even the pasta that the eggplant parm came with was delicious!   Overall, had a great experience. Would definitely go back if I was staying on the strip next time!

In the Crystals shopping center in City Center... the restaurant opens into the mall.  The music was strangely loud but mr. boyfriend thought it appropriate while I thought jazz would do.  TVs by the bar (which we could see from our table); happy hour at the bar; and a pleasant wait staff.  The ravioli was delicious and served fresh from the kitchen.  It was served at the same time at the pizza which appeared to be sitting out too long (soggy crust!).  I wouldn't order the pizza next time, but try another dish.  The red sangria was good.  An easy quick (open late) dinner location in Vegas that isn't crawling/packed to the brim/noisy.

this is our second time to eat here prior to playing a charity poker tournament with Tony Stewart's race team.  I love the ahi tune and my husband ordered a pizza that was unbelievable crispy and delicious.  We always eat at the bar and it took awhile to get service or anyone's attention, but once we did, the server was attentive and continued to refill our iced teas.  For the price the best place to eat in the MGM.

Wow. Cucina was so disappointing. My expectations were definitely high for a well reviewed restaurant by Wolfgang Puck in Vegas. Walking into the City Center mall, I could tell the ambiance would not be the best but the hostess and servers who greeted us helped bring back a nice restaurant feel.  Service was always friendly and helpful but definitely a little slow. I did up my rating from 2 to 3 stars because of how helpful everyone here was to our group from recommending drinks to walking us through dishes on the menu.  With good service but a mediocre environment, the food could have really made this place stand out. Sadly, it was around the same as a slightly higher end chain American-Italian restaurant (think Magiano's, Buca, Brio, etc). The pastas were overcooked and the pizza were soggy. Sauces were watery and under seasoned. Fortunately meats were well cooked and portions were decently sized (for Vegas).  Considering all the great food in this city, it would be hard for me to ever return to Cucina or recommend it to anyone.

Went here a week ago while visiting. For past 5 years this place is always on my list when I arrive. Brought some friends and it service was way off. Long wait for a table as half the restaurant was closed. We were told they didn't have enough staff. Then while we waited for sat at the bar. When we checked back with hostess she had decided to take us off the lust because we were at the bar!  More waiting. My friends so aggravated. Table service slow also. So disappointed in one of my old favorites.

This is probably one of the best pizzas I've ever had! Seriously sooo good, and I eat a lot of pizza. They have all day happy hour in the bar. You can get a personal pizza for only $7 as well as some other items. They also have a delicious white wine sangria on their happy menu as well. Or you can get the Vegas dining card and get 30% off. We went 2 days in a row for lunch it was that good.

Really great food at Reasonable prices and attentive service.  Stopped in for a lunch with a colleague and couldn't believe how quick we got in during the CES show and right in the middle of lunch. We ordered a pizza, a bowl of minestrone soup, a salad and the cheese ravioli. All great portion sizes at great prices. Served Hot and fresh to the table. As busy as it was the waiter was attentive to refills, asking if we needed more items, pre bussing the table and more. I would recommend to anyone Looking for a great Italian lunch. Located inside the crystals shops next to Aria hotel.
